Reviews: These headphones are what I was looking for. I wear hearing aids, but like to listen to either audio books or music when out walking. I also like to wear a broad brim hat to protect my face from the Texas sun. I've tried other over the ear and bluetooth headsets, but they are heavy and cannot be worn behind the head. These headphones can be worn over my hearing aids and behind the head. They are lightweight and did not shift. They permitted me to still hear outside noises like cars and critters which ear buds do not. Old school, but still work real good!

I bought a pair of these headphones to use as my workout headphones. I used them for nearly 6 years before they finally broke. I used them in nearly every workout (6 days a week, for about 90 minutes a day). I sweat constantly, and these headphones really held up through it all. Because I sweat so much, I would clorox spray them occasionally. Honestly, I was so surprised at how long they lasted. I bought another pair because of how long the first pair lasted. They are comfortable, durable, and have decent sound quality. Honestly one of the best purchases I've made. When I ordered them from amazon they came in a timely manner, were packaged nicely, etc. Worth every cent.

These headphones are one of the few that are over the ear headphones that don't give me hat hair or hurt my head. They can be comfortably worn around the neck too, which is nice. If you're buying these, you aren't looking for sound quality, so I'm not even considering that. They stay on your head when you excercise, can you say that about any other over the ear headphones?

I love these headphones. I have had several pair already over the years and I would probably be a bit devastated if they stop selling them. They last a decent amount of time; mine have lasted anywhere between 1-3 years (1-1.5 on average) which is pretty good for the price and I love the sound quality. It may not have as great of sound quality as some of the expensive ones like Beats, but it's still pretty good. The only trouble with it is if you play anything louder it can be heard by others around you.

The only trouble I ever have with these is after so long the wire at the base of the aux connector will break, but it takes a while for it to happen (this is why I need to buy a new pair like this every 1-3 years). I wear mine a lot too, especially when walkin and moving around so it does get a little roughed up, but it holds up well and relaxing them at the price isn't so bad at all; I definitely get my money's worth out of them!

They are comfy too! I wear mine for hours and have little to no discomfort at all and they can be worn with glasses on without issue (usually any discomfort from wearing them is not common, minimal and goes away if they are removed for a few minutes, and the discomfort is mostly when I've worn them with glasses for long periods of times, generally after a few hours).

They're also not as easy to accidentally knock off ones head as they do have a plastic loop that sits over the war to keep them in place, and don't fall off easily either. They stay in place and out of the way.

I would recommend these for anyone who just wants a comfy pair of headphones that will stay in place, but aren't looking to break the bank on an expensive (overpriced) pair.

I like behind the ear phones. I hate ear buds. These are good for workouts, sweat doesn't short them out. Good enough bass, comfortable. Cord is long enough for computer use. Much lighter than Bluetooth headphones which make them good for running. Because they don't cover the ears entirely they don't make my ears hot.

For the price, there isn't very much you can complain about in the sound quality department. These get plenty loud and fairly clear with a somewhat flat frequency range that's slightly more pronounced on the high and with a little boost on the lows, but not a bassy set at all. Sound stage is great for the price range. They feel heavier than expected in the hand, but light on the head.

Biggest complaint is that there is a designed under cut that runs along the entire bottom part of the plastic band and has a slightly rough or sharp feel to it so it gets annoying and irritates the top of my ears from the plastic that's around the area that sits on your ears. I don't care how this looks, but I stuck a bit of athletic tape around that area and it's fine.

I prefer earbuds, but I recently got a daith piercing in each ear, and the jewelry I have in my ears at this time won't allow ear buds to fit, so I wanted to find a different style headphone that didn't seem very obtrusive. The ear clip style that are similar seemed to have such mixed reviews as far as the clips breaking, so I chose to go with this style, which seems sturdier in construction. I love that the ear portions tilt and move so that they grip tighter to your ears, making it easier to hear the sound clearly and also helping to avoid others around you being able to hear what you're listening to. The only possible down side I've found so far is that I had to have my phone volume at almost halfway before I could really hear what I was listening to, when, with other varieties of headphones, I can't get the volume turned down low enough to not bother my ears, so they definitely don't provide a very loud output, but I've found them to be sufficient. I have not yet tried these in a place with a lot of ambient noise to know if they're decent at blocking that out or not.

good workout headphones. back in 2014, i had purchased a set of amazon basics wireless bluetooth headphones. these worked great for a very long time, however, one day before my workout they refused to turn on. charged them up, still no dice.

was hoping i could come on and simply by another pair of the amazon basics pair, but i was wrong. apparently amazon quit making the ones i had.

sony has been around for years, and ive owned several sony products over the years. i bought these and they are very reasonably priced. i didn't wanna pay 50, 60, 70 or 80 bucks for a set of bluetooth headphones.
these are the old school corded headphones. they arrived quickly and are very comfortable. had them over a month now, and i Love them.
pick up a pair today!

Holey-smokes these are good. WAY better than expected. Considering the price, they are a outstanding value.

They sound great! I mean, literally (I guess auditory-ally). Not just great for their size and weight, just great. They're quite light-weight, very comfortable and feels very secure on my head. These sound much better than the on-the-ear lightweight headsets I've tried.

My family goes through a lot of headphones and earphones.
We've tried many types: wireless / wired, over ear / on ear / earbud, ...

My frustration is that I end up buying replacement headphones or earphones at least once a month (for the five of us) ... because they just last very long.

I really like these because they sound fine and are very simple and rugged. This is my second pair ... the first pair lasted a very long time, I think for a couple of years.

These are great, exactly what I have been hoping to find.

My MP3 Player is loaded with audio books, and some music, that I listen to at the gym. I generally prefer being read to when working out than listening to music.

Earbuds are uncomfortable for me and don't stick in my ears. I have fine over-the-head headphones with good sound and volume, but they are heavy and make my head hot. What i have been searching for are lightweight, behind-the-neck, wired headphones like the ones I have for my smart phone.

Sound quality is very good and so is the volume. The volume control is on the MP3 Player, of course, but it is amazing how much variation there can be between different headphones.

Lightweight, behind the neck, cmfortable, good sound and volume. I'm searching no more, I've found what I've been looking for.

I always wear a baseball hat outdoors in spring thru summer which is where, when, I tend to wear headphones. They're inexpensive and fit very comfortably below my hat. There also relatively inexpensive which outdoor use requires. In-ear plugs which I admit are more functional, but I hate them so they aren't an option for me. And the sound is ok given I play usually compressed music on the phone player.

Disclaimer: I haven't received the item yet, but this is my second pair. Reviewing the first pair, that finally gave up after all the abuse I've subjected it to (not it's fault at all)

This is the best pair of headphones for running, period.

Sony sound quality is more than acceptable for this use, and the shape of the headphones precludes them falling off of you as you run, a common problem with little earbuds or separate headphones. The behind-the-neck design is the best in terms of how firmly it's attached to your head, without causing extra sweat or inconvenience.

Oh, and do get some.replacemebt foam tops for those, they get funky quick, and they tear

WOW! Especially considering the price...just WOW! I have everything from Apple Ear Buds to $400 professional studio monitors! There aren't a lot of manufacturers the make this style. These have a great range for plugging into a source for busy work music! They're very comfortable! For the price, you can't beat them...especially if you don't want to mess up your hair, or your ears are in agony after only a few hours of having them in. I highly recommend these!
They fit well over the microphone of my hearing-aids, that are the over-the-ear type. Also very light for wearing for long periods.

I bought these because I was having trouble finding earbuds that would stay in and be comfortable while jogging. These headphones stay on as long as I don't look up at all. If I do, my neck bumps the back piece, which joggles the earphones. Today, while using them, my right ear started to really, really hurt. I'm disappointed.

Great headphones for the gym! I can't vouch for the sound quality of these headphones because I don't use them for anything other than listening to TV programs through my gym's cardio equipment. That's the use for which I bought them and they work perfectly. What more can I say?

3 days having this headphone and I got to say I like it it came in good condition no broken or anything like that and everything work fine I give 9/10 on ranting that are good means

1- sounds good guality
2- fit perfect on my head right sizes
3- there is no bass or anything like that but it sound super loud and good
4- this headphone won’t bother you while you lay down
5- pretty much this headphone is meant to use while working out or running
6- is great headphone and is cheap too you won’t regret it buying it

I highly recommend getting this headphone if you planning on buying it is cheap and great :)
A replacement for the pair I wore out (listening to tunes on my bicycle, about 8 hours/wk). These do not interfere with my glasses or helmet. They're terrific.

I'm probably a little spoiled because I always use my bf's headphones which are studio headphones. I needed something I could wear to do light cardio in, but I can't wear earbuds. These work fine. They stay on my head and the sound is okay. They feel weird to me, like they're going to fall off my head.. but that's probably because I'm used to heavier headphones. Many would consider the barely-there feeling a pro, I imagine. :)

I have an MP3 player my son gave me some years ago. I put it on a timer and play my favorites each and every night to help me sleep. From the beginning I had tried different earphones and finally found this one. It gets tugged, pulled, stretched, and still lasts a long time before it needs replacing. This last time I bought two of them so I would have a replacement immediately when the one I use every night no longer works. I am glad to keep buying this earphone because the price is right and the fit is comfortable when try to get to sleep. It meets my needs exactly and I just hope they never stop making them.

for the price they are great. I use them on my computer and the sound is perfectly fine. I'm a gamer so if it wasn't good sound I would be crying about it. If this is your price range, this is an easy buy
they are little quiet for my taste but they are comfortable and they work

Awesome for the price. Sound is clear and balanced the way speakers should be, even in the low to high ranges. It's really comfortable and is great if you wear glasses. Received this on Monday and I just ordered another because the first one ended up on my husband's iPad.

The sound is great! Its very light and compact, A long time ago I had one panasonic with this kind of design, over the ear, and is one of my favorites.
This Sony is above my expectations.
it fits for my smaller head. The sound is excellent compared to other earphones I've tried. I can hear all of the instruments and get a complete engrossing sound experience.
Light in weight, fits well, good sound all around SONY quality. Great not to have annoying wires when listing to my Audio Books and MP3 downloads.

Great for running, they stay in place like a boss. Don't let your kids near them, they will rip off the foam pads that cover the ears. Sound quality is probably 6/10 for a headphone this style (on ear). But I'm not listing for sounds quality while I"m running.

I bought these headphones for my husband. He likes them and finds them very comfortable. They don't slip off and the sound is clear. They cup over the ears to eliminate background noise. They are a basic and reasonably priced. He's pleased with the purchase.

Audiophiles may find something wrong with this headset, but for me the sound quality is fine. Rock music of various styles all sound crisp and clear.

However, the cheap plastic of the band does tend to pinch on the ears if worn for prolonged periods. If you just use them for a 15 minute jog, you should be fine. However, working overnight listening to music for hours the discomfort becomes apparent rather soon. Wrapping a strip of duct tape around the band by the ears will save you some pain, if you don't mind how cheap it will make them look.

If you want a long-wearing solution I'd suggest elsewhere. Short-term they'll do the job though.
I bought these to wear when I'm streaming without messing up my hair (what a girl). They're perfect for that but are painful to wear for longer than a couple of hours
Had these before and needed wired headphones. Very comfortable but not as much bass as my Bluetooth headphones.

This is my favorite among others, like those in-ear buds whose bass output is superb, but...I said but due to the tendencies to hurt your ear canal after a while. Most of my older headphones are made by Sony and Sennheiser. This Sony MDR-G45LP is light and comfortable to my ears and ear cannals, but Sony has something to do about it because the slit below that part of the plastic headband which hold the tiny electrical cord to the other speaker is "biting" the top skin of my ears due to its weight after long hours of wearing it. If you're planning to buy this style of headphones, and you use this for exercising or jogging/running, you are better off to buy that other style that has the slit positioned at the side (not at the bottom) of the head-band. I don't want to return my headphones to Amazon that's why I wrap that portion of headband with soft fabric, and planned to replace it with a short transparent plastic tubing later. You cannot buy a pre-split tubing, therefore a sharp kitchen knife or an Exacto-knife will be handy for this; just watch out, and avoid slitting your fingers ;-)

As others have stated, it doesn't have much bass at all. But it's still good headphones. I work as a custodian at a grade school at night and I don't like ear buds (they keep falling out because I am cursed with freakish ears from the pits of hellish fire).... Anyways, good for work and for exercise. :) I likes. :)

I think this is my 4th pair! They're great - they sound good, they're easy to take off and put on, they're light and comfortable enough to wear while I'm working out. And I don't need to stress that someone's going to steal them because they're crazy expensive!

While they don't offer triple-deluxe-ultra-mega-whatever-sound like those $300 headphones the music junkies brag about, these headphones will let you listen to music. Ta-da! That is what they are supposed to do.

Plus, they hold onto your ears really well so running and other athletic activities.

I bought my last pair two, maybe three, years ago and they last that long despite all my time in the weight room.
Sent this back, sounded great first day or so but had a rattle to one ear. Speaker was not secure in its cup, wires disconnected from base, lost sound. Manufacturer defect.

From advice from a friend I bought 3 pairs of these, one to leave at home , one at work and a spare for anything else that comes along. I was really amazed at how good they sound. I like the behind the neck simply because it makes wearing a hat some much easier when I walk. I use these with a shuffle MP3 player most of the time and for me there is more than enough cord and the plug angle is no problem at all. Also as a Prime member it was free shipping and fast delivery. Amazon is great!

First, yes I know it was my own stupidity. But, when I search for Bluetooth headphones and the picture comes up showing headphone WITH NO WIRES attached, I assume they are Bluetooth headphones. They aren't. My bad, but I still feel ripped off.

I have tiny ear canals and can't comfortably wear earbuds, but when I ordered these headphones, I had a job hanging price tags at a grocery store, meaning I needed headphones that would stay in place. They do, and there's no cord to tangle when I store them. They're lightweight and have survived in my purse for months. LOVE them.
these are great for the price. I needed something that if thrashed, wouldn't bother me (due to purchase price). These work and take a daily beating, so far they are surviving.
My favorite headphones ever. I've had a few of these throughout the years, and I'm very happy they're still available for purchase. They last longer than any other headphone I've ever used.
I was looking for headphones that didn't feel so heavy on my ears and these were perfect. They don't sit on top of you head they go behind which I like and are very lightweight.
this is my third pair. love them...all still working.
Works great, good sound quality, comfortable. Replaced these for the same pair I bought almost 10 years ago.

These are the best behind the ear headphones you can get at this price! I already had a pair that was wearing out. They are perfect for wearing in the winter because they keep my ears warm, especially for taking long walks! And, they do not hurt my sensitive ears. There is no deep bass on some songs, but deep enough for me. When it comes to earbuds, which are annoying most of the time, you have to push them deep into the ear to get that deep bass. I gave 4 stars for the cheap plastic and foam ear covering.
Fits well; great sound quality. This my third purchase of these headphones. I ruined my first pair by accidentally clipping the cord with garden shears. This is why I always keep two pair on hand.

I don't know how the behind-the-ear headphones aren't bigger. Ear buds are the worst successful invention ever. Full headphones have great sound, but get too bulky. These are perfect for using at work or at the gym. Good sound and a great fit. After I lost my last pair and couldn't find another replacement in stores(Target, Walmart, Shopko, etc.), I found them on Amazon. I bought a pair for me and the girlfriend. She loves them too.

These are the best behind the neck headphones

The sound quality is crisp and clear
Good bass
Snug fit for avid runners

I tried others and always come back to these for the last 7 years
You can't beat these for the price. They are truly audiophile-grade as opposed to the usual bass-heavy crap out there. They are perfect for the spoken word (podcasts) too. Pretty darned comfy too.

I can't recall where I purchased my first pair of these headphones, but I just got my second pair in the mail. These are simplistic, sexy, and functional. There's no doubt about it. They fit perfectly, they have great sound quality, and they last more than people suggest. Yeah, they feel flimsy at times, but nothing that bad, and they're more durable than you might think. Always pleased with these. :)

For the record, the reason for having bought a second pair is because the right side of the headphones on my first pair was no longer working. Which is to be expected considering how long I'd been using them. Nothing to complain about, especially at the price. :)

I can't use ear buds. They simply fall out at the slightest movement.

So for working out and doing chores, I use these. They stay put and sound pretty good for the money. This is probably my 4th pair, and as long as they keep making them I will keep buying them.

My only complaint is that they only last 6 months or so before one of the ears go out. I do use them a lot however, about 20-40 hours per week.
This is my third pair and each has lasted about 2 years with heavy usage-
These are the headphones I use for working out when I go lifting, and running. They hang onto my head/ears just great

I don't like using ear buds, they never stay put. Maybe I have small ear holes? Either way, these are great because fit right over the top of my ears, so I don't have to worry about them slipping off. I've had them for two or three years now and the fabric on the inside of the headphones is starting to wear thing and come off. Then again I wear them all the time, especially when I workout, so I feel like 3 years worth of use for such a cheap price is totally worth it. The only complaint I have is that sometimes my ears get sore from the plastic on the top, but that's only after wearing them for a long time and it's still better than the earbuds constantly falling out or the giant padded ones that make me feel claustrophobic. Overall, good simple headphones for a great price.

So far
So good

These are the best. They sound good, are inexpensive, and the best part is that they don't mess up your hair. I don't like the feel of earbuds and as a female, I hate big ear phones over my ears - they sound great but flatten my hair. For these, the ear part covers just your ears and the headband part goes behind your head, under your hair so no muss. I'll never go back!

For the past four years my wife has been looking for the perfect headphones to use while she exercises at the gym, and I mean three/four days every week. She bought these on the recommendation of a fellow gym member and the search is over! They are lightweight, have a single cord, and sound great. Because they go behind the neck rather than over the head they are more comfortable and reduce sweating. She loves them!
I love my Sony Street style headphones they rock! :D I love the behind the head style. And I love the sound quality for the price.

These are the only headphones I will buy, I love the way they fit around the back of my neck and not on top of my head. I hate earbuds,these are perfect for me. They have awesome sound, not completely noise cancelled, but I like being aware of things going on around me...the sound is great, and they don't mess up my hair. My son tried mine, so had to get him a pair too...very light-weight, and the bass is great. Mine have lasted me a long time.

These inexpensive wonders of technology provide the sharpest sound and the highest treble available. If you appreciate crystal clear music that remains "whole" while hitting the highest notes, these are the ones to get.
Great - great - great. Hard to believe these behind-the-neck earphones are hard to find on the street but they are. Even box stores don't have them. Lucky we have Amazon for stuff like this.
lightweight, bass sounds okay but not great, pressure is not too much on ears, cord should be longer

I have had a bunch of pairs of these, they are the best.

I use them for skiing, biking, and anything active. I especially like the loop-around the head style because it is easy to take one in and out without having to look or use two hands, no guess work.

I am a male with long hair and I also like that it conveniently goes right under-neath my hair bun.

The sound is decent and they can take a lot of sweat, but can show signs of stress if put under too much pressure or banged around a little. Most of the time I just notice a slight noise when I am handling them, but there is no affect on the sound quality.

I've been buying this model for a few years locally. Decided to see what's online and happy to find them a little cheaper. These are my all around headphones and love them. Double check recordings with them and the studio headphones to see where I'm at in doing the mixing. These are also my ipod headphones. I almost live in headphones and I'm hard on them. These hold up pretty good with good sound quality.
I love these, the sound is good , and i like the way they fit your head.

I guess Sony doesn't make stuff like they use to. Theses were a replacement for a pair I bought 8 years ago that had awesome sound. The sound in these is very tinny sounding and I have to crank up my iPod. The one good thing I can say about them is I didn't have to use the jaws of life to open the packaging.

I like this style of headphones for working out in. Earbuds are painful and other styles don't stay on. These worked well, good sound, stayed in place during my 3 mile run. Had an older pair that failed to keep a connection but they worked for years before that. Nothing lasts forever. I would buy again.
The sound is ok, but they won't stay on. I have to almost hook them on the top of you ear (not comfortable) and even then they want to slide off.
I love these headphones. They are light to run and music sounds very good. Once I bought similar on Phillips and Maxell but have nothing to do with these. Worth paying the price.
Comfortable, light, good sound. Only negative is no volume control, but otherwise a great buy.
Very satisfied
Amazingly comfortable and the sound quality is good.
Great sound, priced right.
Best value for the money and they are comfortable when lying in bed. I've used these for years and gave a set to my wife who loves them too.

These pair of headphones are very, very loose. I have used Sony's behind the neck headphones for the past 6 years and every single pair has had at least twice the clamping pressure...which isnt a bad thing if you want them to stay put. They should stay put, not move or bounce around with any movement. And I have a bigger head too, it would be even looser on a smaller head.

The sound quality is what you would expect from $14 headphones, decent sound. Build is lighter and feels cheaper than my previous sony headphones.

Conclusion is I can't recommend these headphones because they are way too loose, if you aren't moving at all then they might work for you.

Comfortable, good sound. Not very rugged. I'd like it if they made the place where the cord goes into the plug more robust. Eventually they develop a loose connection there if your running motion stresses that connection. But, when that happens, I still buy another pair because nothing else I've found works as well. (I use a wired headphone so my FM radio will work)

Sony has let me down once again.

I only bought these because I had newly pierced traguses and needed something of good quality to go over my ears. There was a better version of these headphone but as usually, they discontinued it, and we are left with these crappy ones. These are so bad that I decided to just remove my piercings early, suffer the bleeding and swollen ears to put in flat backed piercings so that I could wear NON-Sony earbuds again.

I have a bad history with Sony. I have had to buy $400 in headphones from them (before I realized it) because their phones and earbuds have a tendency to fail after a few weeks, no matter how well cared for, the left ear ALWAYS goes out. When I call and ask them to improve the product they never do. When I get a replacement pair (not a refund) when my earbuds quit working after a week, the replacement pair also breaks or I am charged for it. Between my poor history, my Sony Playstation Network account being hacked and my MP3 Walkman being on the fritz since I first bought it, I'm done with Sony for the most part.

DO NOT WASTER YOUR MONEY!!!!!!!!!!!! Take it from an expert at wasting money on Sony. If you choose to take the risk, prepare to be completely disregarded by the company!
Bought these for family member who prefers the street-style headphones. Good value for the price. I would give 5 stars if it had mega-bass feature.

Why spend a bunch of money on sweat resistant headphones? These work just fine so far. I went through 2-3 different sets of sweat-proof headphones because when running 4 miles then doing P90X or P90X2 after I sweat ALOT! I know if headphones can keep up with my drainage from my pores within a couple days. These hold up I run with Oakley's mainly and the conveniently hold them down so my glasses aren't bouncing around the headphones stay in place and are comfortable and provide great sound. I also have Dr. Dre Tours, Motorola Bluetooth (Didn't hold up to claims of being sweat proof) and Skullcandy Hesi so yes the sound is good for working out. The sweat also conveniently is soaked up and drains off rather than completely in your ear unlike the Tour in ear headphones.
as advertised, can not stand those ear bud types.
For the price, these simply cannot be beaten. Sounds excellent, and great for working out, that's what I use them for!

I got these for jogging but ended up not using them for that because my music wasn't loud enough or clear enough for me. And I wasn't expecting them to sound perfect or anything... If you like your music pretty decently loud and clear, these might not be for you. I ended up getting the adidas sport in-ear neckband ones instead, which were also pretty reasonably priced but gave more clear and a little louder sound, again not perfect sound, but a lot better than these. Now my son uses these when he's playing video games I don't want to hear, so at least we found a use for them!
same as the one I've been taping together for 3 years. Finally a new one. Hard to find a behind the head at this price.
This is really a good headset, however, the only problem is that they cannot be adjusted. They are slightly too big for me any I cannot adjust.
They are not kidding, these bad boys are LIGHT!
Great sound, comfort, the convenience of neckband headphones. I bought a pair for myself and one for a gift. My friend and I are both very well-pleased. They have also held up well under heavy use.

I bought these specifically to wear them while I had my motorcycle helmet on, and once you get the headphones settled into the ear pockets of the helmet, they work great. The neck band comes out under the bottom of my HJC and G-Force helmets, doesnt interfere with the fit.

Quality is surprisingly decent. But MUCH too quiet. Works for getting by, but if you like to listen to reasonably loud music (not ear bustingly loud, but certainly loud), this device is NOT the one for you
Yet another replacement for a son who loses or breaks things--great stocking stuffer. He requested this item and I know he likes it!

Arrived dead on time no issues with customs, mainly use them for work, I work long nights in a stock storage so this makes it easy for me to get in with my job and not worry about the headphones being ripped off my head or causing me to get caught in any machinery, they are reasonable loud but not too much I can't hear my boss when she's got orders for us. Great product when your on the go and just need something to take you out of the tedium
This is my favorite style headphone, but don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed.

I love these headphones. I'm glad they're still available on-line (Best Buy no longer carries them, evidently due to consumer-related complaints re skin contact with the plastic, resulting in irritation). These headphones are inexpensive, comfortable, and very durable. Music sounds great whether using them on an i-Phone or a Sony "Walkman". The plastic is strong yet flexible, and very difficult to warp or break. The Foam Pad Ear Covers will begin disintegrating after six months of daily use, so plan on purchasing replacement pads for future use.
I love these. They're cheap and they don't leave a band mark on the top of my head.
these headphone work awesome love them
perfect for treadmill use.

I chose these because I have a smaller head. They turn out to be a good choice for that. I am very pleased with the price versus sound quality. In fact, I recently bought a second pair for home use (the original pair are in the office). I might wear them, with breaks, for a few hours at a time. There might be a better pair out there in terms of how they fit my head, but these are good enough for the price and all that they do for me.

Have you reached the point of frustration with cheap ear-buds that work for awhile but won't stay in your ears or get pulled and loose sound on one side? I had reached that point so many times that I was looking for exactly this product, fits comfortably over the ears, sold frame, corded on only one side so less likely to get snagged and pulled - and the sound is phenomenal for headphones in this price range!

Simple, very inexpensive and do the trick. I listen to these everyday on the way to work on transit and back. These aren't Bose or Beats but heck, either is the price. The wrap around design is super convenient for those like myself that don't want to mess up my hair! Great value, good volume, decent sound, no brainer.
Love these for exercise. They take a beating and stay in place even when soaked in sweat.

OVERALL
A very good headset for the price. Caveat, the price varies considerably, even on Amazon.com, often from hour-to-hour. I purchased a new set for $9 from Amazon.

COMFORTABILITY
"Behind-the-neck" headphones are generally the most comfortable type you can purchase. However, you can buy a half-dozen different headsets which look identical except for the brandname. Some will be comfortable, some won't. Apparently different folks have different shaped heads and ears, which is important to the fit of behind-the-neck headphones. So, when you find a set which is comfortable for you---buy an extra set or two and stash them. Personally, I find the Sony MDR-G45LP headphones to be very comfortable---but your experience could be different.

ADJUSTABILTIY
Like all other "behind-the-neck" headphones Sony MDR-G45LPs are non-adjustable because no adjustment is necessary. In fact, that is one of the advantages of "behind-the-neck" headsets as compared to "top-of-the-head" headsets.

CORD LENGTH
Despite the silly complaints of a few other reviewers that the cord is short, it is in fact the Sony MDR-G45LP cord is the standard length---long enough for you to carry your MP3 in your pants pocket. Short is better than too long---you can always add a cheap extension, for example Cables To Go 40405 3.5 mm Male/Female Stereo Audio Extension Cable, Black (1.5 Feet/0.45 Meters). If the cord is too long, it will catch on things, straining the cord at the plug----which is what will ultimately kill the headset.

SOUND QUALITY
The sound quality of the Sony MDR-G45LPs is VERY crisp and clear, (unlike many headsets which are optimized to "pump up the bass" which makes voice and treble muddy). I use the headphones to listen to audiobooks for which it is perfect.

CONSTRUCTION QUALITY
Appears to be good, but unfortunately, the Sony MDR-G45LP has a right-angle plug. Virtually all headsets "die" by strain on the wires at the plugs---so straight plugs are far better than angled plugs (because straight plugs pull out easily, rather than straining the wire).

COMPARISON WITH OTHER TYPES OF HEADPHONES

"Behind-the-neck" headphones are generally the most comfortable type you can purchase. They also the best at staying in place when exercising.

For an "outside the house/office" headset, I prefer my J-buds JBuds Hi-Fi Noise-Reducing Ear Buds (White) with my Budkeeper Carrying Case - Fire Engine Red (BKFD20-G47) case, which I clip to a belt loop. I can also stash a couple of extra AAA batteries with my J-Buds in the Budkeeper. The J-Buds in the Budkeeper are a much smaller package, and J-Buds are better at noise reduction, for example in a doctor's waiting room with a TV on. However earbuds can become uncomfortable after several hours. I suspect that the build-up of heat and moisture in your ear canals might lead to infections if earbuds are worn several hours daily. Indeed, enough heat builds up to melt your earwax, which then solidifies in and on the earbuds. Premium earbuds even have replaceable "wax filters". If you wear non-premium earbuds, clean the earwax out regularly, or it will get to the speakers and kill them.

"Top of the head" headphones slip easily, require adjustment, interfere with wearing hats and interfere with women wearing hair "up". The only purpose for which a "top-of-the-head" headset is better, is for listening to music while taking a nap.

Apple/airline type earplugs are just plain uncomfortable, fall out of your ears easily, and do not provide the noise isolation of earbuds.

I was recently given an expensive pair of Monster headphones. Since the only thing I have to compare them to are the earbuds that came with my iPod, I didn't know if they were worth the high price tag. Now I know. You do get what you pay for!

While I love that pair of Monster headphones, I couldn't use them and wear a hat. I use them while doing my walking outside and, with it being Spring and soon Summer, I want some of the protection a hat would provide. I looked at some options here on Amazon and decided on these neckband headphones.

They do allow me to wear a hat and still not have to resort to the earbuds, which I find are uncomfortable. Even to my untrained ear, the sound from these is tinny, at best. They block no outside noise. As a result, I have to turn the volume way up with these where I turn it way down with the others. I will probably use these when I use a hat, but I will definitely use the others if I am not.

I live on an Air Force base, and I use these headphones for running around the runway. They don't completely drown out the jet noise, but they do a good job of holding their own against F-16 engines. They're durable and comfortable, and I would recommend them to anyone who needs a good, solid pair of headphones for running.

I bought this pair of headphones to use in the office. They stopped functioning within 2 months of use. I cannot imagine if this product was put under any type of duress, it would probably break immediately. Also, it's not a particularly comfortable behind the ear type of headphone. Look elsewhere.
Only kind I wear!
Fits nicely around neck. I like how it fits around neck (no messy hair) and it is close to ears without covering my hearing of events around me.
For my husband who is hard of hearing so uses these to watch TV. It is the second set do to the wires that connect to head phones come undone.

I have purchased this headset before. I do medical transcription so I want something that isn't going to cover my entire ear and something that won't mess up my hair! Would get these over and over again!
Excellent ear phones, great sound.

I bought these with some trepidation as Sony "likes" their items and prices them too high. Due to that, and these at a price below $15.00, I should have known they would NOT be worth half the price paid! The sound quality is like something you could get at a discount store for a couple of dollars, BUT it does have the "regarded" name SONY on them so we as consumers should just pay the money and like the result. Well SONY, once again I must say you have over priced a product and I hope it is quickly removed from shelves or you will only further damage your reputation. Did I mention these are TERRIBLE? Well, I guess I have now, and they are that bad! Further more they will break at the slightest amount of pressure it feels like. Crap, just crap! I am ashamed of SONY for selling something like this with their name on it! Don't spend a penny on this item folks, and you will not be disappointed. These are being returned immediately!

Literally the only headphones I wear for exercise. I have sweated all over these, worn them for forever, and they work consistently and stay on my ears when I run long distances, lift weights, etc. Not to mention the sound quality is excellent, I'm no extreme audiophile but I know good quality sound and these have them. Best work out headphones on the market.

This is a very good product for the price. It is light and comfortable. I wear it for about an hour before needing a break. Music is clear, detailed and crisp - I say this after trying three other low-priced headphones. The only fault is that the music is a bit bright and there could be a little more bass. But you are not going to get Grado or other top-quality sound for $20 or less. My wife has the similar Phillips product, which is pretty good, but the Sony sounds better. I tried some DJ style phones that were heavy and uncomfortable. If you're going to splurge, the expensive Bose are light, comfortable and have very accurate sound. But the Sony is good for the price.

This is a nice headphone that replaces an older worn out similar pair. I think the sound is even better in this new one. I know it does not compare to very expensive ones, but these are perfect for me...good treble, mid range and bass. They fit neatly on my head which is rather small. I think they may be tight, at least at first, for a large person. I have not had them long enough to tell if they stretch in size with use. They are great for using on a tread mill or for running etc.
I like this style for learning music on my walks. These are comfortable and the sound quality is good.

There is a seam on the neckband for the wire and it has sharp edges. After a while it feels very rough on the top of your ears. They should have put it on the top of the band so the smooth side would rest on your ears instead.

The design of these headphones is the main reason why I have them, but the sound quality is a definite plus. I use these all the time when I do live radio broadcasts on location. The slim design allows them to be packed in the equipment cases easily, and the sound quality allows me to hear everything that I need to when in use.

Anyway, I'm wearing a pair right now; and, while they COULD be more comfortable while sitting writing online reviews (they're kind of tight), there is NO headphone set I've ever had that I like better for running or working out--I just wish they were wireless.

I love these headphones and have bought many pairs over the years. The behind the neck style is perfect for my body when it comes to comfort and staying in place. I'm also pretty hard on them and they'll still usually last a couple years.

These headphones fit well and will not slip off. There are two things I do not like about them. The first is the cord is too short, it needs to be about a foot longer. This movement results in the sound cutting out on one or both of the headphone speakers.

My only issue is that other people can hear my music when i have it on. I think i don't listen to my music that highly too. But if you don't mind it, this is a great headphone. I always loved neckband headphones.
These headphones work way better than the earbuds but my ears must weird because after about on hour my ears hurt. My husband will only use this brand and he loves them.

I use these at the gym 6 days a week and they are still going strong. They take a beating and still work like new. Very good sound quality. They don't isolate the sound like "beats" do, but I am fine with that. For the money these are a no brainer.

Inexpensive. Lightweight. Very nice.

Simple and light weight. Just what I wanted. I'm wearing these over the mic of my BTE (behind the ear) hearing aid, so works well together.

For years, the Sony MDR-G45LP Street Style Neckband Headphones were my go-to headphones. They were cheap, durable, and best of all, they sounded great. They would normally last me about 6 months before the headphone jack would rip off, and about a month later the sound in one side would eventually go out. For me, 6 months is a long time for headphones. These headphones were, however, extremely painful on my ears. I had to remove them after a while because they would hurt really badly and I had to rub my ears. These are no longer my headphones of choice, I have moved onto to the most popular pair of headphones by Panasonic.

These Sony headphones were exactly what I was looking for as a replacement pair for my boyfriend. I was worried these would be too small for him but they sit perfectly on him and are not too small. The sound is great and they are well-made. I recommend.

I have bought these headphones three times in the last 9 years or so. I usually get 2-3 years of use out of them before they begin to short out. I hate ear buds, and clunky headphones. I can wear these with my hoodie or baseball cap. Very useful for urban exploration. Good balance of sound and volume too! A little stiff out of the box, but you get used to them and they loosen up a bit. I hope they never stop making this model because at ~$20 / pair they are a good bargain and investment. Much more durable them some of the higher end ones out there.
Love these headphones, they're the only ones I can use. So comfortable. Cann't use earbuds because they hurt my ears. Please don't stop making them!!!

I do like these Sony MDR-G45LP headphones a lot. They are super comfortable, light weight, offer good sound, and most important, stay in place when I'm walking. For me, the fit is just right. However, when compared to the Philips Rich Bass Neckband Headphones SHS5200/28 (also sold on Amazon), the Sony's sound isn't quite as robust. The downfall with the Philips are they are a little bulky, and don't stay on my ears as well as the Sonys. So, for sitting at my desk, I prefer the Philips. For walking, the Sony wins. Both are great buys for the money.
These headphones are uncomfortable behind one ear. I've bought this type before and liked them. These not so much.

The plastic headband is cheap and poor quality plastic, broke after 5 uses, 6 weeks after I brought it. I bought the same model 5 years ago and it still works but the new model is apparently much worse quality material.

Buy them. At $14 they are a steal. Easily worth double the cost. I use them for running and they stay on my ears and have great sound. I plan to buy backups in case sony decides to discontinue them. They are the only over the ear head phone that works for me. I've tried the FX-Sport for $160 and had it slip off my ears. Just buy it.

These have held up being thrown in my gym bag and back pack, but they aren't especially comfortable. They do stay on, but since they aren't adjustable, they often get in the way of my ponytail or hood. Good for the price, but not my favorite.

I give these a 3 because the sound quality is not great, however, I do love them. I had an original pair in the 90's and love these just as much as my originals. I got them so I could sleep comfortably with them on and I do. Great for night time listening.

I go through a lot of headphones with all my cardio workouts. Ether the sweating or the occasional yanking on the cord as I swing my arms eventually doom them. These inexpensive headphones are hardly the most comfortable or produce the best sound quality, but they fit my need -- cheap enough that I can treat them as disposable. Also, since I'm using them for workouts, I don't need to worry about the best sound quality.

So in short, very inexpensive headphones that I don't need to worry about getting damaged.
These are great for canceling out annoying girls at the gym however they will not cancel out tmi loud grunts. I love them because you don't have to keep adjusting like earbuds
Sound is good, but, uncomfortable for me.,

I have at least 4 pairs of these. They work on my ipod, my laptop, even my ham radio. The sound is reasonably good, and the workmanship is first-rate. I wear these to watch full-length movies and they never get uncomfortable.

For the price I haven't found anything tht comes close. Get an extra pair of earpads and if you find the phones are too tight, try heating the neck band with a hair dryer while bending it outward.

This is the second pair I bought for my son. He still has the first one and since he liked them so much, I got a second pair for him to use with his other computer. He said they are better than the very expensive headphones he has. For the price, they are great!!

Sound quality is acceptable for my use (on air in a news studio). My real reason is to not have headphones wrapped over the top of my head. These are perfect for that purpose. They are lightweight and just what I need for radio.
I wear them all day every day. They are comfy. Just too much treble not much bass and not as loud as the last brand I paid more for but they're durable.
Love them always. Will never switch from these headphones, unless Sony stops making them and forces me to.

Can't be harsh seeing as they are less than $20, but you get what you pay for. Seems like the volume isn't near as high with these compared to any of my past headsets of varying type. Not crazy about how they fit on my ears either.

I have invested more money in the Sennheiser PMX95 with floating ear pieces, which are very comfortable. Plus the wire is made of a flex cord so it is unlikely to break. I got these as my running headphones. After owning some $40 Sennheiser headphones for years now, I've learned what good, low-cost headphones sound like. These are not good low-cost headphones. There's an area between subwoofer and mid-range where things are too quiet - the headphones can't really put sound out well in this range. The sound in general is a little tinny and scratchy. The combination ends up adding up to a disappointing sound when listening to any recorded voice, because it typically has been put through that kind of mic processing to have that deep male radio voice, right in the range these headphones are worst.

All of that said, the sound isn't terrible, it's just subpar. You'd think Sony could produce headphones in the same quality range as Sennheiser for a similar price, and based on what I know about headphones - it's a difference of a few cents for the manufacturer to get that right, so they're making crappy headphones to avoid competing with their more expensive products. Very lame.

There's also an issue when running with these. I wear glasses - pretty light ones, which are nice for running. The way these clip around my ear can sometimes cause them to slowly wedge themselves beneath the stems on my glasses, causing them to bounce around while running - a very dizzying experience. However, on a few runs I've been able to gradually adjust them to prevent that - basically if I set them back a little farther on my ear than where they'd naturally sit, they seem to stay in place just far enough above the stems that they don't cause issues. So far.

I liked the price and the quality seems to be alright, but these hurt my ears.
I wanted an inexpensive pair of headphones to wear at work but after having these on for about 25 minutes I feel like my ears are screaming in pain. My head is a little large, those "one size fit most" hats are usually too small for me and these are just not great at adjusting to my size.
I have had other pairs of neckband headphones so I don't think that is the problem, it is just a size issue I guess.
Looks like I will need to buy a blue-tooth adapter for my computer so I can use my Motorolla S305's because I can wear those for hours with no issue.

However the build quality is a little iffy. The jack itself fits very snugly into most devices which means you have to tug a little to unplug the headphones. After a few months of this, the rubber bit came off the L shaped jack. This exposed the wires and as a result, I can now only hear in the left ear (wire failure). It may also be due to me dropping my iPod Touch a few times (tugging on the wire where it hits the jack), but I'm not sure.

Either way I'm going to buy another pair as I'm otherwise happy with them, but this time I'll be pulling off the rubber sleeve and sticking a little glue in there to be safe.

I love these headphones by Sony. I feel the older model was a little better. They seemed more heavy duty and could take a lot of beatings. I had a pair of the old model for almost 10 years!!! I hope these last as long; we'll see. There is a little plastic piece that I've noticed aren't on the new model, which supports the headphone on the ear more or something. I know some people thought it was annoying but I thought it made the headphone a little more stable on the head and comfortable for me. Not a big deal though.

I bought a pair similar to these, made by Phillip, and I hated them. They're ok for just sitting around listening to music but if you are looking to go running or something of the sort they are not good at all. They fell right off of my head (maybe I have a small head I don't know). I was very happy when I got my Sony headphones. Hardly moved at all while running.

The sound quality is pretty good; good enough bass for a pair of headphones like these. I felt the old pair had better bass though but egh not THAT much of a difference. Definitely happy with these. Also noticed the cord on these isn't as long as the old model either which I like a lot! The cord for the old model was WICKED long and was annoying I had to rap it around my iPod to keep it from getting in the way while running. Don't have that problem anymore.

My headphones arrived today, and I couldn't wait to try them out. I was looking for a quality behind the neck headphone, at a low price, from a good manufacturer. This one, from SONY, came up in my search. It was under $20.00. I am glad I purchased it. It is lightweight and fits me perfectly. It has a cord for headphone jacks in your phone, Kindle, etc. It is not wireless, I was not looking for that feature. The sound quality, for the price, is excellent. I listened to some music on my Kindle Fire HD8, and the sound quality from that device was excellent. The headphones are well constructed, which is typical for SONY products. I recommend this product with no hesitation. I found no faults with it.

I had one of these earlier, so wanted a second pair once i wore those out. but the package i received was faulty. they simply would not work. I wanted to return them, but nobody came to pick them up. easily the worst purchase from amazon i have made till date.

Overall these are relatively good headphones, but I'm not entirely sure I'd recommend them to someone asking my opinion. The reason for this is that I bought these in hopes of addressing a specific problem -- fit for a small head and ears while also retaining decent sound. The bar for "decent" sound is relatively low also since I am deaf in one ear.

Despite the behind the head band, these headphones still slide off altogether too easily for me. I find I regularly have to move the headphones back up on my head again. In addition, the sound quality is so-so, even for myself with limited hearing. I really don't expect much at all in the way of sound quality from headphones due to my hearing loss and, given the inexpensive nature of these headphones, perhaps that is the reason for the less than decent sound quality. Thing is, I have another pair of Sony headphones that cost all of about $15 more and they are terrific in terms of sound quality, so I'm not so sure it's a function of price.

In any case, for the price these headphones are fine. The cord length is good and the headphones themselves are quite lightweight. For the price, not a bad pair of headphones - just not quite the fit I need.
Broke in me in 2 months.. great dog dodo item.....

I have very much enjoyed my Sony headset, but I am very frustrated and disappointed in Amazon most likely selling or sharing my e-mail address after my purchase. After never before having a problem with "scamers"......I now get many daily e-mails from supid people and sights that clog my e-mail wanting me to purchase everything that can be imagined. BEWARE!
I didn't read the description, bc I thought the headphones were flexible. No carrying case was provided either. But for $17 what does one expect?

I use these because I can't use earbuds. They work well for the price and have decent sound quality from what I can tell. They work fine with glasses or even dangly earrings, and if positioned right, you can use it with your hair in a ponytail. I usually wear my hair up higher and have this go down below it. I will say after a couple of hours (averaging 3-5) it will hurt a bit behind my ears, and that sometimes increases depending on if I'm wearing glasses or not. It's not a particularly awful pain, but it does decrease the amount of pleasure of listening to music for an extended period of time. Aside from that minor issue, I still use them because they're decently sturdy. They are not collapsible, if anyone was wondering, I usually carry mine around in a small purse if I am not wearing them.

I've bought these headphones often since they first came out. They fit nicely but takes some time to get used to the configuration wearing this style. If you wear Hats, have long hair, these phones are a great solution instead of Ear Buds ( which I despise) or Conventional over the Head style Phones. Personally, as a Long time user of these headphones ( I use them to Modulate my Radio Broadcasts) I think their Sound Quality has suffered over the years, but these are still adequate for small speakers whose strength is good on the Higher sound spectrums, adequate on the Bass just barely.

If you want a fuller sound experience, buy bigger Cans for a Fuller Listening Experience, but if you want something Light Weight, Ear Feeling Friendly for Hiking, Biking... these are more than Adequate .

Just about to order my fourth pair of these head phones, which are more comfortable for me than painful ear buds, and don't give me headband hair. The reason I keep ordering new pairs is that after a while, one channel or the other stops working and I end up with mono headphones. Fine for listening to podcasts and other music-free content, but not so great for music. I bought my last pair in March and here it is December and I need a new pair because there is no sound coming in the right ear.

The Street Style MDRG45LP is just what my husband needed for his rather large cranium. The behind the neck design is the only option the feels comfortable. He has tried ear buds and they result in either always falling out or when in for longer than 20-mins result in ear pain. The behind the neck design of the Street Style provides a comfortable solution for those grocery store visits.

The physical design is sturdy and provide enough flexibility to be adjustable without fear of breaking them. The padding on over the speakers are a typical foam that provides a level of comfort. The on-ear design allows for clearly being able to hear both your audio of choice but also the world around you except of higher volumes.

These are wired and come with a long enough cable to allow for use of an audio source in your pocket. The end is equipped with a 1/8“audio jack which is a perfect pair for most mobile devices. The connector has a 90-degree angle at the end. I like this touch as it feels like it will have less of a chance or kinking while in a pocket. I did have some issues getting it to sit just right in my iPhone 6. If I pushed it too far in it would sound very low and distant. If I pull it out just a bit and make proper contact it worked like a charm. We have been through several headphones/ear buds and never had this prior.

Sound quality is decent, considering this price point. (currently $15.62) It has a fair base response and the high were adequate. My source for testing was Amazon music streaming and some pod cast. I know these are not the best sources but also consider that this is what my husband uses this for. That being said, the base is ample however lacks accuracy. The highs are strong and match pretty well to the strength of the base tones. It’s the mid-range that suffers the most. Vocals can be muffled at time depending on the music. Pod casts work very well as any vocal bas tones augment this short fall.

Pros:
• Solid construction
• Fits well for those with a large dome
• Wired so you never have to charge them and can keep them in your car
• Great value

Cons:
• Sound quality is adequate. There are better sounding headphones however for this price point this is the best by far.

Conclusion:

This may sound like a bad review but it is quite the contrary. The Street Style MDRG45LP headphone is comfortable, durable and provides good sound quality for this price point. I gave it 4 stars because of the price for performance. Subtle changes that would have me up it to 5 stars would be to flatten the response to allow the mid-range to open vocals. That being said I have yet to find anything better at this price point.

I have purchased and repurchased these exact headphones for years because they are so comfortable, get great volume, and capture bass really well, and they're cheap. I love the wrap around design and that the speakers stay in place over my ears. I've never had a pair that didn't last at least a couple years, and I'm so happy they are still available.

One minor warning, if you listen to a lot of music with really heavy bass (death metal, techno, etc.) and crank the volume too high for too long, you can blow out the speakers. They'll still work, but you'll definitely hear a bit of a rattle every time the bass gets going, and it impacts the overall sound quality that you'll get. (Simple preventative on that, just don't max out your volume if you're listening to heavy bass, keep it around 80%-ish and you'll be fine)

Decent Headphones, but they are pretty cheaply made. I use mine almost every day and the foam stuff covering the ears is starting to tear. They are actually pretty comfortable, and I have a big head, so that is difficult to find in this style of headphones. I just wish they were a little better made. This is my second pair. Attached is the image of what happened to the 1st pair.

Looks: They look and feel cheap.
Quality: The sound is bare bones. Basically the same quality you get from any given pair of cheap plastic headphones. The cushions are very thin. Recommend buying some thicker cushions to replace the stock ones.
Price: It's cheap, that's why it gets an extra star.
Users: It DOES stay on your head rather well, so it'd probably be OK for working out (I'd still recommend thicker cushions though), way better than earbuds at any rate. I can't recommend it for folks with glasses though (it starts giving me a headache after a while). It works just fine for an office environment with the HUGE caveat that it blocks no sound whatsoever, so it fails for me, as this is the main reason I bought it. You can kinda block out noise by blaring the music but to block out background noise but these headphones will be audible to a cubicle neighbor. Additionally, at that volume they really show their low-quality from an audiophile perspective.
Cheap and great quality. I got these because no earbud will ever be able to not fall out of my ear.

I originally bought a pair of these from Circuit City before they went bankrupt and they didn't break. I only bought another pair because I bought Sennheisers out of curiosity and was disappointed... they had the same sound quality. Anyway, I couldn't believe these were still available and couldn't resist buying a new pair... and the quality is still there! I'm betting this pair will last another what... probably ten years if it was anything like the last pair.

I tested these against the Philips SHS5200/28 and the Philips HS520 Neckband Headphone.

Of the 3, these came in 2nd. They have a weak sound, with limited bass response, and although they're cheap and pretty, they just don't compare in quality to the Philips options

The winner was the HS520, with strong bass, low price, and quality construction.

Philips SHS5200 have the best sound, with the HS520 's a close second.

However, the SHS5200 is about 33% more expensive, at $20, while these Sonys and the HS520 are $15.

Also, the SHS5200 has a problem of the plug breaking when the cord gets snagged on pretty much anything. I had 2 of them break in a 6 month period. They're virtually unfixable when they break, as the cord is braided, and not a simple soldering job to repair.

So if you're in the market, go for the Philips HS520

I love to buy Sony brand but this time I am not happy. I am not big on sound, as long as it is good quality then that is fine with me. So the sound quality is good enough for me for this headphone. The reason I am not happy is that the foam covers started coming off all the time. First the right and then both sides. I bought foam replacements, I hope they are better than the first pair.
The item being sold does not match the item pictured. It is a wired product, while the headphones pictured are wireless.

Got these for my wife, sound wise they work fine but she could only use them for a couple of weeks before ditching them. They was pinching into her ears and causing pain after wearing them for awhile.
Light headphones. Excellent audio from them. Well-made item. Can't go wrong with them. Once you wear them, you won't go back to your old phones.
I prefer the behind the neck headphones to ear buds for running and exercising. Sound is decent. Could be a little more comfortable but they get the job done.
The sound is ok, but the fit is awful, when I had them on they actually pulled my ears out, the back part is a little bit more firm then it needs to be.
I prefer the "behind the head" style of smaller headphones and these Sony headphones meet my criteria. Sound Good Too!
These sound decent but leave painful pressure spots on the edges of my ears with prolonged use. I know they are inexpensive but even a little size adjustment would be great.
Small enough to sleep in and stays where the belong with great sound. I love these. Hair stays where I want it when. I wear these.
inexpensive and works. why someone would spend $200 on a slighly better headphone baffles me. Advertising perhaps? Endorsements?
Perfect little headphones that sit on the lower back of my head! Very comfortable.
Good for office desk use. Tend to hurt the tops of my ears (where the ear connects to my head) after extended wear. Sound is pretty good.
Very comfortable and you can still hear what is going on around you
Thankful to have found these. Not a fan of huge, expensive headphones.
These headphones were purchased to use with a hearing assist system. They work great, fit very comfortably and the audio is excellent. For the money they are a great buy.

I've tried a ton of headphones lately and these sound by far the best to me. I like generally flat sound. I'm more concerned with clear mids and highs and want present but not overpowering bass and low bass.
Headphones I've tried include the following with my totally subjective sound rating on 10 point scale. YMMV.

Audio Technica ATH-M50X - highs a little subdued for my liking - 7
Beats Studio 2 Wireless - Subdued highs, some mid bass emphasis but not overpowering. 6
Bose QC25 - A little weak on bass and weak on highs, best ANC. 7
Bose QC35 - Can be a little bassy, especially at low volume. Bright highs. Best ANC. 9
JBL - EVEREST 700 - Way too bassy. 5.
JBL - Everest Elite 700 - Much better than non-Elite, 7
OPPO PM-3 - Excellent, expensive. 10
Sennheiser 202 - yuck. Too bassy, no highs, but cheap. 4
Sennheiser 280 - well balanced. 8
Sennheiser Momentum M2 - Close to perfection. 9.5
Sennheiser PXC-550 - wireless noise cancelling. These are excellent. 9
Sony - MDRXB950BT/B - Extra bass says it all. 4
Sony 7506 - Perfection 10

Out of all that I've tried the Sony 7506 are closest to perfection, to live performance. They are not bass heavy at all but can produce comfortable solid bass down to quite low frequencies. Tonal balance leans towards the upper mids and highs. Bright but not harsh. You end up hearing subtle sounds in the music that is missing with other headphones. Those who want more bass or don't want bright highs won't like these. But for my listening taste this matches perfectly.

They are also very comfortable. Many of the headphones listed above are not as comfortable. Either tight band or thin band or ear cups that aren't big or deep enough. These headphones are great. Biggest disadvantage vs. many that I've tried recently is that these are wired... with a long heavy cord easy to get caught on things. I was looking for a wireless headphone. But ultimately I couldn't find one at a reasonable price that sounded anywhere near as good as these. Next closest was the Sennheiser PXC-550, but at $400, wireless wasn't worth an extra $320. I also found that there were times I didn't want noise cancellation. Too bad Sony doesn't make a wireless headphone with anywhere near this sound.
Best of all, these are by far the cheapest of the decent sounding headphones I've listened to. The headphones in this list range in prices from $20 to $450.
Highly recommend the Sony 7506... if you like this sort of sound signature.

These are my favorite pair of headphones I have tried so far. The overall sound of these are very balanced. This means the Low, Medium, and high tones are for the most part balanced out. You can easily look up a lot of information on these headphones. They are an industry standard which I have enjoyed owning for more than two years now.

The overall design of the headphones is fairly good. They are structurally well designed for the most part.
- Noise isolation is mediocre. You can hear people saying things through these depending on the volume.
- Sound leakage on the original pads is fairly low. People won't have to hear your music when it is at a fairly loud volume.
- Extremely long, coiled cable with 1/4-inch adapter. Possibly gold connections.
- Sturdy cable design. Each cable bend point is reinforced with additional rubber. Soldering to the driver seems sturdy as well, it should be able to withstand most tugs. This is usually not an issue with the gargantuan coiled cable. The coiled cable also prevents a large number of tangles!
- The headband is fairly comfortable. You could easily find a cover for it if it becomes a problem.
- Cup adjustment pieces have numbers on them to ensure a specific setting.

The problems I've had with these over time:
- Headband will lose its tension between your ears over time. These headphones no longer fit as soundly on my head as they used to.
- Faux leather pads will need to be replaced. I have included a picture of both of my ripped pads which I replaced with "Beyerdynamic EDT250V Headphone Ear Pads Black" these will create some additional noise leakage.
- The wire that connects the drivers to the headband can get stuck in the housing. (see picture) This may wear the wire a bit.
- Cable is extremely long. This can be an issue when you want to use these headphones outside of their intended purpose. The cable is generally a bit heavy, causing strain to the connections. I very often have to move it around to have it stop bothering me. The cable can be replaced with some soldering. There have been projects modifying the headphones to have a detachable cable. Google "Sony MDR-7506 Detachable Cable Mod" that I believe would improve the design of the headphones.
- Like all over the ear headphones, these will be uncomfortable with glasses. They do become very uncomfortable after a few hours.
- While these do come with a transport bag, even the fold up design makes them a bit of a pain to transport. This is to be expected.
- Fold up design doesn't center the cups when the length of each ear cup is at minimum. (See picture) Not sure what this does to the longevity of the headband.
- The blue portion of the "Professional" stickers on the sides are decals. One of mine peeled off. It looks similar, but is starting to disappear, and collects dust. (see picture)

Aside from a few gripes, these are still my favorite set of headphones. They simply sound right. I was appalled to go to the store and listen to some Bose headphones and hear how bad the quality was in comparison: for a set of $300 headphones.

These are undoubtedly worth the price. Don't hesitate to buy them if you can overlook the problems i have had.

I'm rating these five stars, but they do have one pretty big negative. They are excellent, studio quality headphones. If you plan to wear them out and about though (like the NYC commuter I am) they effectively also serve as earmuffs. That's all well and good in winter, but on the June day I wore them out, I was sweating out the top of my head and down my neck. Amazing sound quality, but not great for being out in the heat. In their defense, these headphones never made that claim. They never made any claims at all, as they are an inanimate object without speech capability. They do have the capability to deliver superb sound quality though, which is mostly what you want in a pair of headphones.

I love my 7506's. I do alot of video editing, edm production and djing as my main hobbies, and I would not use any other headphone. There is just something about these that reveals any and all audio errors. My rule of thumb is if it sounds good in these headphones it will sound good at the club and vice versa. Now that I have told you how much I love these they do have some major faults.

1. These headphones are very cold sounding even a bit harsh especially with low quality sources like spotify and soundcloud. These are aimed at the professional audience. If you have work to do get these. If you want to sit back and listen to music buy the mdrv6 or audio technica mh50x. As an aside everyone that says these and the mdrv6 are identical must be tone deaf. The v6 sounds warm with way more bass. By comparison the 7506's are harsh and cold with a more technical (tight) sound.

2. The ear pads are terribly uncomfortable do your self a favor and replace them immediately. For some reason I personally love the cloth pads from Turtle beach gaming headsets. I just hate leather and velour on headphones they make my head sweat and ears hot.

3. It's time to make these with a detachable cord. Audio Technica made the mh50's with a detaching cord, it's about time Sony did the same with these and the v6's. I am writing this review because of this. I was djing at a club when an attendee (cough very inebriated human being) fell on the ground and ripped the cord right out of the ear cup. Sony is lucky I won't use any other headphone in a professional setting.

When all is said and done though these are unbelievable headphones at a great price with nice build quality. Sony please just make them with a removable cord (im on my 3rd pair in 9 years and would gladly pay double the price for this one feature. Also, I hate having to get used to a new pair every few years). Finally, to sum up the review, if you are looking for good studio/dj headphones these are fantastic! If your looking for a more casual listening set of cans gets the mdrv6 or at mh50x.

I recently developed a liking for headphones and wanted to try out the 7506, having the impression they were sort of a long-standing classic pair. I also read an extensive report claiming them to be the best pair of over-ear headphones in the $150 MSRP range.

I haven't owned them long enough to say much about durability, and they may have not had enough time to "burn-in" (I'm not confident myself of the importance of burn-in, but it seems to be a widespread-enough idea that I do give my headphones a short burn-in), but so far I agree that they are a great pair of headphones. They have a much more even or flat response than any popular pair of headphones to be sure, but my primary comparison is my go-to pair of Sennheiser 380 Pros. They are both phenomenal sounding. The best way I've found to describe the difference is that the 380s lean just slightly towards the lower frequencies, and the 7506s towards the brighter side. The 380s have a wider soundstage, as well (probably because of the larger ear cups and distance between the speakers and your ears). As a result, there were some songs that felt more rich from the 380s...but some songs that felt more exciting from the 7506s.

The 7506s have a relaxed fit, and the pads are quite soft. They will likely make contact with your ears, and I do feel some fatigue after extended listening. I have a very big head and typical sized ears, which is why I opted for the 380 Pros as my first pair...the ear cups are massive, very large and deep, and make no contact with your ears, but the headphones are heavier and grip tighter, so instead of any ear fatigue you feel a fair amount of warmth. The 7506s have padding on the speakers themselves, as well, inside the ear cup, so the contact with your ears is padded. They are lightweight and don't grip too hard. The headband is comfortable, though I noticed it tends to grab my hair more than I'm used to.

I don't like the coiled cable, though it is more lightweight than the one on my 380s, so it's a bit more manageable. I also don't like that the cable can't be removed, and therefore not easily replaced.

The ear cups don't swivel side to side very far, but can flip all the way around, and are on a hinged arm. You can sort of push them up against the headband (with the two ear pads together) to make the set pretty compact, and there's a basic storage bag that they'll fit in. They're fairly mobile.

I also noticed that the best place to grip the cups as you put them on or take them off is covered with the same thin material that's on the ear pads. It makes me think this will probably wear out fairly fast, but that's sort of a nit-picking detail.

I'm fairly new to the audio scene and don't pretend to be an expert, but hopefully this can give a wide audience an idea of what these headphones are like. I give them 4-stars for a satisfactory, but not exceptional, product. You are getting what you pay for, but in my opinion, not more.

I'll probably update this review once I've used them a bit more extensively.

Additional comments:

I've now owned these for nearly 4 months, and have used them quite a bit.

They aren't so great for using at my DJing jobs. While their mobility helps, they don't produce massive volume, and they don't isolate all that well. This makes it a bit hard to listen to songs in advance before including them in my set, with the music blasting from my system.
