I narrowed it down to these (Sony MDR-7506) and the Audio Technica ATH-M50, which at the time of this review, were $50 more than the 7506. I had seen both headphones recommended numerous times. Luckily for me, 2 co-workers had the 7506 and the M5's, so I was able to AB test both.

I listened to a variety of music on each pair. Here's what I found:

Sound:
• Treble - The 7506 is a fairly bright headphone. It does tend to push the highs a tad, but I didn't mind it. I didn't find it painful to listen to, even after an extended period, and I liked the detail that it brought out in some songs. The M50 did not seem to push the highs as much, but to me, it felt a little bit more restrained and almost muffled sounding compared to the 7506. Not bad, just not as "airy". Overall, I preferred the 7506

• Mid-range - Both headphones did well in the mid-range, but I thought the 7506 was overall more clear.

• Bass - This is where I thought the M50 would win hands down. After many reviews that I read, I expected the 7506 to really get trounced here. This was definitely not the case. It could be just my tastes in sound, but the 7506 had very tight, detailed bass. The M50 had slightly stronger bass, but not quite as detailed as the 7506. I would guess, like many things audio, this will be largely subjective on which you prefer. I did not find that the 7506 was lacking at all in bass, though.

• Comfort - This was probably the biggest plus for the 7506 vs the M50. The M50 felt much heavier to me and squeezed my head a lot more than the 7506. The 7506 were light and much more comfortable. Complete win for the 7506. The pair I tried had the Velour ear pads, which may have helped with this. I highly recommend those as well. You can find them here: http://www.amazon.com/Beyerdynamic-Velour-Earcushions-MDR7506-Headphones/dp/B0016MF7W2

• Price - Even with the upgraded ear pads, the 7506 came in over $30 cheaper. Win for the 7506 here.

• Build quality and durability - Both sets of headphones seemed very well built and durable. I don't see any immediate issues with either pair. I've heard many people with 7506 that have owned them for 10-20 years with no issues except for needing to replace the ear pads. I also read numerous people with M50s since they launched (5 years ago) with no issues either.

Conclusion:
Not surprisingly, I ended up purchasing the 7506. They were cheaper and I liked them better all-around. I'm sure there are other people that would do the same AB test and prefer the M50, so your mileage may vary. I actually ended up purchasing 2 sets so I could have a set at work and a set at home. Highly recommend these headphones and get the Velour pads as well as they are a very worthwhile upgrade.

I'm an audio/video professional, and for the money these are awesome. They're not quite as good as the Sony 7520's costing about 4x more, but they're a great buy for the $. I've used Sony headphones for decades in my work... they're rock solid. I can't speak to how long they'll last yet, but I'm still using another pair that's over 15 years old, so we'll see...

That being said, I do feel that in many other product areas Sony has really gone downhill. And their customer service is godawful.

These are the best! I have tried so many others but found these to be clearly superior. I like to listen to theater organ music whether on CD or over the internet. This is a very difficult instrument to record and to reproduce accurately whether over speakers or using headphones. There are so many layers of sound all coming at you at once. The base is deep but subtle with a lot of differing textures instead the the loud dead thud heard in so many other genres of music. These headphones right out of the box do the best job of faithfully reproducing all of the above of any that I have tried or unfortunately purchased. They should do even better after burning in.

Listening to a live performance of a pipe organ, one is impressed by the "airiness" that only an organ has. It has to do with the sound being produced by wind and by the acoustics of the building in which it is housed. These headphones do an excellent job or reproducing that as well. I don't get that feeling of having something plugged in my ear or even listening to headphones. That was an unexpected bonus.

I had tried to get by with headphones in the $30-40 range but the learned the hard way that he who buys cheap, buys again. I am aware of the fragile leather ear cups from other reviews, so I will treat these gently because these are so comfortable.

I bought a pair and I bought another pair a couple of weeks after.

Coming from a pair of Grado SR-80i, I will point out that these sound very different. The Grados are open-backs with lends a wider soundstage and better mid-range definition. The Sony MDR-7506 are closed-back, has more top-end and extends much lower in comparison. If you love your Grados like I do, this will take a while getting used to.

I do not think comparing the Grado vs. Sony makes much sense given the difference in operating principles. Yet if someone needed a clue, I found the Grados more forgiving on bad recordings. The Sonys on the other hand will tell you as it is. If you can afford 2 pairs of headphones, I will suggest the Grado for HiFi and Music appreciation (read as enjoying) and the Sony for more critical listening where accuracy is important (monitoring).

Both a great set of headphones for the money. I do digital backups of my vinyls so the Sony sees more head time.

I had a pair of these over 10 years ago as of 2017 and these are very good studio headsets.

I do, however, have one issue with them and that is that they do have a higher frequency within the 3 khz to 8 khz area which you may have to compensate for if you are looking for a true flat studio range.

Now with that said, these are great for normal music listening with a wide dynamic range.. picks up high ranges very well.

I actually have had 2 sets of these MDRs over the years just for the enjoyment of listening to music.. Very good Noise cancellation.

I was looking for a nice around-the-ear set of headphones at a reasonable price. My choice came down to these and the Audio Technica ATH-M50x headphones, which cost nearly twice as much.

The sound from these is awesome. It had been probably 20+ years since I'd worn ANY over-the-ear headphones and I was instantly reminded how wonderful they are. You will notice things in your songs that you hadn't noticed before.

While these are not noise-cancelling, they do a good enough job of limiting noise. I've worn them on planes and while walking on the treadmill.

Be advised that this comes with a long cord. The product listing mentions the length of the cord, and it is accurate....and looong lol. I have it resting on the back of my neck when I'm doing dishes for example. This may be a deal-breaker for some.

They do fully cover my ears and as a result my ears get warm, especially when I'm on the treadmill. I know these aren't designed for working out, but be advised the pads will be wet with sweat if you work out wearing these. I usually just dab them with a paper tower and let them air dry.

Finally, headband is slightly uncomfortable for me at times. The padding of the band is good not great, and my shaved head probably doesn't help. Also it may be that they a little breaking in.

That may sound like a lot of complaints but to me they are minor. I like these headphones a lot and wear them often. They sound sooo much better than the earbuds I've been using for so many years. Getting these was a blast from the past, a reminder of how great music sounds through a good set of headphones.

There is so much I want to say about these head phones, but I'll keep it brief.
Maybe you shouldn't get them; all my other headphones sound like garbage now.
Whenever someone plays music from their phone speaker, it hurts me. Once you hear these, you can never un-hear them.

These headphones sound amazing, and are totally worth the ~$80 pricetag. Nothing I have sounds better.
But they aren't very portable, and are surprisingly large on your head.
They are amazing, but leave them next to your computer, and get something else for out and about.

For sound, they get an 11/10, they aren't made to be portable, and they aren't very portable. But I still bring them to work with me whenever I remember.

If you've only had iPod quality earbuds and midrange speakers like me, these will change the way you listen to music. The sound is warm, clear, distinct and enveloping. With the Beyerdynamic Earpads, they feel like a fleece for your face. The long, telephone style cable is excellent for fiddling, although it is a little bit of a pain to tuck it away if you're going for a walk. Which you really shouldn't be doing anyway because this sound is so enveloping that you won't be aware of a mugger until they have your money.

I guess the looks could be a downside for some people, but I get a bigger thrill from seeing professionals use my headphones than having them be clear of text, snazzily designed and a pretty color. Also, at least for me, you can't really comfortably sling them around your neck for a minute when someone's talking to you, you have to just take them off.

I've had these for some time now. So I think it's time to write a brief review on them.
First and foremost they are comfortable even on my large ears. It takes many hours of use before they become uncomfortable.
They sound fantastic. They aren't bass heavy or anything. They are well done. They also do a descent job with noise cancellation even though that's not a feature. You can still hear through, them though (nothing crazy though). The cord on these is nice. It is very long and springy. You won't accidentally rip your headset off with this cord. I have a sound card which really brings out the greatness in these. Of course everyone has a preference. I tune up my equalizer and theses sound perfect to me. I would recommend getting the Soundblaster ZX with a nice pair of headphones if you like to change up your settings on demand. I love the combo.

I had been getting into video editing for some time and never really understood the true value of having a great headset. After much research and seeing these have been the industry standard headphones for decades thought they would be a great place to start to start improving my sound for the videos I edit. These headphones are awesome! If you are using them for extended periods of time (several hours) then you may need to take them off from time to time to give your ears a break but can generally keep them on for quite some time which is great.

I had a pair from this headphone line in the past, and used them until they basically fell apart (one side stopped working, and the cushioning material for the ears eventually peeled away.) And yet after trying myriad other brands, I rate these as my personal best. After my first pair died (took several years of daily use), I went on a quest to try a bunch of different headphones. After wasting hundreds of dollars over the past couple years on everything from fancy $200 pairs, cheap Amazon-branded pairs, and plenty of random ones from places like Big Lots or Walmart, I finally just came back to these for a meager $15. There's simply no beating the combination of comfort (especially for people with glasses!), sound quality, and price. I work in front of a computer for hours at a time, and almost always have headphones (and eye glasses) on. I probably have a larger than average head shape too. Every single other pair I have tried ended up making my ears hurt before long, except this one. While the construction quality is decent, I do expect to run through a new pair every couple years, but at this price point, it's really hard to complain. In summary, I am so thankful these are back in my life.

These are great headphones for music and movies for the price. I have never owned a big-money pair of headphones & after buying cheap ones that I had to replace multiple times due to breakage, I decided to get these after a recommendation from a friend. After buying them for myself, I also bought them for each of my kids. They're great for average use... i've never been bothered by outside noise, they are comfortable, and the sound is of good quality. They also are much sturdier than the cheapie $10-$20 ones I've gotten before. (My kids haven't broken them, which is a minor miracle)

I do recommend getting a bag or carrying case for them (I use a Crown Royal bag:) it certainly helps protect them and they do seem vulnerable at the hinges where they collapse for storage.

The only thing my kid complains about is the wire is kind of short. I prefer it because the wire is nice and thick and never gets tangled. with my previous cheap ones, it was always the wires that were delicate & one or both ears would go out. These are so much sturdier. (I think he just finds them too short when he wants to sit in the recliner with his iPad on the table & watch his Minecraft. If you don't require your headphones to meet these specific and ridiculous needs, the length should be fine.)

When I first tried these on, I found them a bit uncomfortable. My over-ear phones are much more comfortable. But, I plugged these in and listened (I'm a guitar player and spend a lot of time listening to musical details. The sound was amazing! At first I thought I wouldn't like these, but the sound came out and I was blown away. I can't believe $15 headphones sound this good. I bought these as backups to my AT over-ears and wasn't expecting much but these are really really great. The only reason I didn't give five stars is because they are a tiny bit uncomfortable.

I previously bought a pair of Amazon light weight headphones. Today the Sony headphones I ordered 2 days ago came. Price between the 2 almost the same. However that's where the similarity ends. The Sony headphones don't fit snug...slide all over...outside noise is barely muffled...the sound quality is not bad. But since they don't fit at all can't really appreciate the sound quality. They are going back tomorrow.

These headphones are great! I'm not an audiophile, so I can't really tell you how the sound compares, but they sound fine to me. I was more impressed with how long they lasted. I took these on several flights, had them in my overstuffed bags, dropped them and generally abused them. Unlike all other headphones I've had (which generally last me 3-6 months), these lasted 2 years! They got caught in my work chair and the pin was bent when I stood up, otherwise I think they might still be going. Since I will be traveling in a few weeks, I've already decided to purchase the noice-cancelling Sony's for a bit more.
The downside to these headphones (and reason I gave them 4 instead of 5 stars) is that the cord is a bit long and would get stuck between chairs, desks, etc (which is what eventually led to their demise). The cord was different which was good because it didn't seem to get tangled so often but bad because I think that's also why they were constantly getting caught in things. Lastly, I like headphones to fit snugly, these were lighter weight (which I don't like as much) and weren't so snug-fitting. Probably better for people with larger heads.

I got these for $7.99 on a lightning deal. They are excellent for the price. I ordered two pair: one for my 3 year old and one as a travel pair of headphones. The sound quality is impressive for the price. These are on the ear headphones, not over the ear. So, passive noise isolation won't be as good. However, they are quite comfortable. I could easily wear these for a couple hours while watching a movie. The physical size of the headphones make them a good choice for children. Sure, they aren't brightly colored, but I'm willing to bet the sound quality and price are much better than you'd pay for a branded set of crappy headphones. Also, I was surprised at the quality of the cord. I was expecting a thin, cheap cord. It's actually fairly thick and tangle resistant. Only complaint I have -- I wish the cord connected at a single point, rather than running to each ear piece. But, again, for the price they're darn good quality.

Update: I've now used these headphones several times on the treadmill. I like them even more now. When running, you'll occasionally run into a set of headphones with a seriously flimsy cord. As you run, a flimsy cord will bounce and become seriously annoying. These don't do that at all. I love how the solid cord just hangs with minimal movement. Also, the ear pads will get a bit sweaty, but nothing a quick wipe won't rectify. I'll let you know how they hold up for exercise use.

I purchased these to carry around, mainly to have something that isolates noice a bit more than EarPods, they do the job, they are comfortable (though if you have a bigger than average head they might not be as much) and the sound quality is ok (they do have a bass booster which helps not hearing external noises but its a hindrance if you are looking for sound quality). The material quality is also ok, I read a lot of reviews stating that these broke almost immediately, and though they are not sturdy or particularly well built they should last a good amount of time provided they are not mistreated. I give these five stars mainly because of the price.

Arrived on time & in good / new condition. Sound quality is mediocre, but these are a heck of a lot better than dealing w/ the tears-inducing migraine that comes from headphones that squeeze my ears and jaw. They're not as comfortable as they claim to be, but markedly more comfortable than the Amazon Basics ones of similar appearance. If you're looking for something practical, and can handle a very short cord, like if you're on your laptop, these are for you. Wouldn't use them for exercise or movement of any sort. I'll probably buy them again, if they randomly short out on me. I'd say they're worth the $15 I paid, but if the price goes up, I won't buy them again. :) -Account holder's progeny

WOW - Picked these up today after wearing the ZX100 for the last 3 years and wearing through the lining on the padding.

Sounds is incredible, rich bass, not 'deep' as Bose/Beats might sell you, just a solid, full, well balanced sound, much better than I expected from a $20 pair of phones. Looking at the cost difference between the '100's and these, the $5 is laughable.

Feel is fantastic, quality materials, folding pads is awesome and a thick cable with the right angle connector makes life easy. Tug to hard one way? Pressure gets pushed into the wire connection, not the actual plug which (one of my favorite, and most often utilized features of the 100s) so they won't snap on you.

Cost, well, if you can't shell out $20 for a decent pair of headphones it might be worth spending that money elsewhere.

Very happy, terrific product and price point. Blown away!

These phones sound really nice, for being under $20. I have owned at least 30 different headphones since 1974, and these sound as good as any of the $100 Sennheisers I had back when Elton John's "Rocket Man" was new music. The power requirement for the voice coils in these phones is remarkably low: They sound great for listening to music on a cell phone or tablet, and you won't even have to crank the volume up to maximum. Some of the headphones I have owned recently don't work well with mobile devices, requiring more output power than the audio chip in a cell phone can provide - that won't be a problem with these Sony ZX-110 phones. They sound just fine on my Samsung Galaxy Tab S at 50% of max volume. Frequency response is very good for economy priced phones, with clear treble and adequate bass response to let you "feel" the drums and bass guitar. Soprano and contralto vocals sound nice and clear, without that "muddy" sound that cheap phones give that don't have enough high-frequency response. These phones fold up into a very small, compact footprint that is easy to store in a medium or large purse, or any briefcase, backpack, or laptop computer bag. The cord is 3 feet, and has a 90° angled plug. This cord length is great for use with a cell phone in a shirt pocket, although not really long enough for home use with a desktop computer. If you are going to use these phones to listen to music on a home stereo or desktop computer, you will need an extension cord, but these aren't terribly expensive.
COMFORT: Sony got this right: these phones grip your head just firmly enough to stay in place, without squeezing you to death. I have had a couple of Sony phones that were horrible in this respect, with way too much compression on an average sized head; that's not a problem with these phones. The ear pads are very comfortable, and they don't press hard enough on your earlobes to make you need to take your earrings off to use the phones.

SUMMARY: A Typical Sony economy-priced headphone with much better sound than you might have expected at this price point. Folds up very small for carrying in a purse or laptop computer bag, Very comfortable to wear for up to several hours.

PRODUCT RECOMMENDATION: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

This is the worst sounding headset I have ever bought. $3 airline headsets have far better sound than these. They are also very inefficient. I can barely hear the left speaker with the volume on max. I have bought many headsets for myself and family, including a number of Sonys. I never had a problem with Sony before.

On the plus side, they are comfortable.
My brother loved it. The first ones I gave him (2 years ago) still works, but the leather has been deteriorating for the regular use. For that reason I got a new one for him.

The package had already been opened, the manufacturer's tape/seal was cut in one area and the box looked to have been bent in that area to allow for the product to be taken out.
One strike against, but maybe someone just didn't like the fit. So I open it up and the head phones are great!
The cord is thick and sturdy, the head phones rest well on my ears and head, perfect! Happy camper.
I plug them in and.. click click.
Click *music*, click *nothing*.

Seems this was a returned item as it's quite defective. :(
The plug has a small area that is moving in and out and with each movement the sound is being disrupted.
I've returned it for a full refund and will try once more to get a working pair as I did quite like them.

I need several sets of fairly compact folding headphones with decent sound and a good price, so ordered these along with two others to try out (the JVC HAS160A and the Panasonic RP-HX40-G.) Having used Sony products in the past, I expected these to outperform the others, but they didn't. The sound isn't as loud as the others, and it's fairly muffled, not clear. Clarity is important in my application (hard of hearing assistance), but even for casual music listening, these would be disappointing. I tried them on a small battery player and a more powerful Yamaha mixer, but couldn't tell a difference in the sound quality, just more volume on the mixer.
On the plus side, they have a little better bass than the others, and are probably more comfortable to wear for long periods (I only tried them for about a half hour.) And they look more impressive, being quite a bit more bulky.

These are cheap and totally okay headphones. They don't have fantastic sound quality but you get used to it after a few minutes. They seem well built and collapse into a more manageable shape if you want to carry them in a backpack or whatever. Honestly I would not buy these again because I like a bit more sound quality but now I know. Would be a decent gift or for someone who just needs decent headphones at a low price.

In this household, we care a lot about sound quality. We're spoiled with great 2 channel stereos. For headphones I listen to Grado headphones, at least until they finally broke down. Recently we found ourselves surrounded by headphones.

So, in a headphone shootout here at home, two kids, two adults we came to this conclusion.

$200 Beats (paid $70 black Friday sale price): 1/4 picked as fav. (the teen)
$120 Bose: 1/4 picked as fav. (the mom)
$10 Sony: 2/4 picked as fav. (the audiophiles, dad and 10 year old)
$20 Apple earbuds 0/4 picked as fav. (universally hated)

We listened to uncompressed rock over an iPod shuffle, or Youtube.

These "giant killer" Sony phones have a clear, detailed, open sound. Meaning that the music don't sound cluttered between your ears, it seems to extend to around your head. Bass has real detail: you can hear the note, the reverb and the string pluck. For bass, these beat the Bose and Beats, with ease. Also, unlike Beats, you can actually hear people talk to you when you have these on. Not everybody in my family thought these were the best sounding though, my wife preferred the Bose.

The low point: they aren't as super comfortable as the Bose. Everybody agrees the Bose are the super comfy pair. Technically, these were not the loudest, but they were plenty loud enough!
These head phones have amazing sound at an incredible cost. Was not expecting such great quality for $10!!!!!

I bought this for my electric/digital piano (Korg), as I live below my landlord, and cant play over my amp. Not used to headphones, and liking the sound of the amp, I thought of this as an experiment. With budget being at the forefront of my mind in this experiment and with many expenses related to a move, I gave it a try, and to my surprise, am pretty impressed with them. What I was thinking, that the 'directness' of playing thru an amp' would not be equaled by a headphone, is actually not the case; the headphone puts me more in my piano world, to the exclusion of anything else, and in that way makes it even more direct.You cant really sing along with it but I knew I had to forego that with the landlord above me, so I do that elsewhere. Instead I focus on the piano parts. I chose this head-phone for the extra bass, as I like to hear the deep piano bass sounds akin to a grand, and it does deliver in that range as well. Considering the budget, and knowing there are probably better and way more expensive professional phones out there, I 'm very happy with this purchase.

Comfortable for extended use even though I have a larger sized head.
Sound is good and balanced for such a bargain price set of head phones.
Not bass heavy nor too bright with the highs, just a slightly over emphasized mind range.
So adjust the EQ on your player to suite your own taste. I set mine to boost the bass and treble.

Just don't expect audiophile quality from a $15 set of headphones and you will love these!
I use mine for listening to music on an ipod while landscaping and using power tools.
Perfect! No worries about spoiling an expensive set of headphones.

One caveat: volume levels are fine with my MP3 player or Tablet, but when used with my desktop computer
the volume levels are low. It maybe my computer set-up or sound card (ASUS Xonar DGX), but all my other
earbuds & headphones have good volume levels when used with the same computer. No problem for me
as I only use mine for listening to music on an ipod while landscaping and working with louder power tools.

Edit: 11/10/2015:
I found some settings in the Asus Xonar DGX sound card software that amplified the signal if using higher impedance headphones, so now I have good volume levels when using my computer as a source.

The quality of the sound is really just amazing. There is practically no difference between the quality of these sony headphones and a pair of Beats ones that cost a couple hundred bucks extra. If you're looking for inexpensive headphones with fantastic quality, look no further. You won't be disappointed!

For the price these are pretty great. (I paid $17 ) They have a good quality of sound, fit my larger head, and aren't uncomfortable to wear for a few hours in the office. The way they are built they also provide quite a bit of noise reduction/isolation. With the volume fairly low, it is easy to tune out the room around you.

These headphones are wonderful. Great balanced sound and comfortable to wear. I'm not one of those folks that can really tell if there is anything minutely wrong with the bass levels, etc. Just a regular person looking for a nice set of headphones that wont cost me 200 bucks,these did the trick. Bought another set in white to match my tablet ( yes, I'm that girly) -- BUT-- I will need to get an adaptor since the plug guage is different on my Samsung tablet. No biggy. Still will recommend these highly. Also, husband has been abusing them ( dropping, stepping and sitting on them ) and hardly a scratch .

these headphones have amazing sound for the price—like seriously. they felt. a little cheap at first, but after a day I found myself loving these headphones. yes—they do have extra bass—but it's just the right amount. it's nice to see Sony not using their brands name for some extra cash.

These are only $25 headphones so don't expect $200 headphone quality, but they sound good enough to get through the work day. The microphone works well. I still preferred my old JVC headphones that broke after 10 years but I just needed something cheap and quick for now

Disregard any negatives you've heard about these headphones, they're amazing, especially if you configure an EQ or equalizer (most media players should have EQ settings, and also some computer's audio drivers come with the EQ software already built-in that you can access through your audio settings) on your phone or pc or whatever device you use, because then you can customize the entire sound range of these headphones to which the output can actually surprise you. They're nice and compact and fold up nice and easy as well. I specifically got this version for the microphone so i can scream at people in online games and skype/ts. Although the mic isn't exactly the best quality, its quite decent still if you're looking for a bottom of the line mic thats cheap and wont quit on you. If you use a dual jack splitter you can plug both the two separate jacks into

Great basic headphones. They have a nice sound and are pretty durable. I have used them for almost a year now. Scony has always been a favorite of mine for headphones, going back to the ones with fuzzy ear muffs and a thin wire that went over your head. It is your duty to celebrate your independence not to have to use wireless headphones that need to be charged every few hours. So get these retro classics and enjoy music the way it was meant to be enjoyed.

Music sounds crisp but not as good as Bose headphones. I wouldn't use these for sleeping purposes there uncomfortable and bulky. The ear cushions fit perfectly for my somewhat large ears. As I said for the title, I have used them for gaming. I play a lot of destiny in Xbox one s. Destiny requires a lot of chatting to play especially for raids. The jack connection fits any Xbox one controller. Highly recommended.

These headphones are very comfortable but don't do much as far as blocking out sound going on around you. I can hear pretty much everything through these. I have small ears and these were not too big either. The top was not "tight" or constricting as with other reviews. Good fit. I use them when I am at the gym working out and after wearing them about 20-30 minutes they do make you sweat a little bit but it is not noticeable until you remove them. Not bad for the price but if you are looking for something to block out at least a little bit of sound these are not for you.

I have had these since Christmas and I can tell you, you wont be disappointed. I have used primarily for movies and video games. I work nights so the nights Im off I usually stay up late and don't want to wake the family with machine gun fire from my video games and movies. I plug directly into my receiver and Im amazed. Strong bass but not overpowering, the mids and high are fantastic. Music sounds great as well but my opinion its movies that really show off there potential. Would buy again in a heartbeat. Do your research Sony if you want great sound Beats if you want a B on the side of your ear.

It's hard to complain about a $20 pair of headphones but these are supposed to have "extra bass". They don't, in fact I think they may have less bass than any other headphones I've ever owned. These aren't the worse over ear headphones in the world, in fact they're not terrible, but if you're expecting the "extra bass" in the headline you'll be disappointed.

Decent headphones at a Huge savings over Hip Hop coolio beet box overpriced marketed to ding dongs headphones . Seriously, if you spent $200+ on a pair of headphones (unless you are a dj or work related--and you get a tax write off), you might want to go stick your finger in a light socket to remind your brain to function correctly. These work just fine... you can spend the difference on your college math class. Hey...you wanted my opinion.

I bought these headphones because my other pair of headphones, made by a different company, broke. When I received the headphones I wasn't that impressed, but then again these are $20 headphones. When I plugged it into my MP3 player I could barely hear my music unless I nearly maxed out the volume. My gummy earbuds have better sound quality than these. If I could, I'd return them but instead I bought a pair of Monster headphones and will keep these as a backup. As for the mic, it's pretty decent. When I first used it however, the other person on the phone kept complaining that they could not hear me. But now I think it is okay.

These headphones exceed their price in quality. I'm not an audiophile but I do know a thing or two. I used these Sony Extra Bass 110APs with an iPhone 6 playing 320kbps MP3s as well as a PS4 playing Destiny for voice chat and game sounds. The sound is very balanced and crisp for folk, country, rock, and punk with adequate bass for hip hop and EDM. More on gaming later.

I have a very large head, 7 3/4 hat size. These are just fine. They are very light and the headband extends beyond my needs.

I do not like noise canceling in any form as it contributes to artificial characteristics and I like being able to hear cars and pedestrians as I walk around the city. These headphones are great if you share my tastes. I wear these on the bus to and from work every day and while walking around downtown. The volume and audio mix blend well with ambience and they are light and fold up well into my bag.

For PS4/Destiny the sound was adequate but not particularly engaging. Voice audio was great and my friends reported my voice sounded better than the PS-VITA earbuds as well as the PS4-included chat earbud. The bass was underwhelming for game audio, however. Everything was crisp and detailed but I wanted more bass for explosions and gunfire.

To summarize, these are great for an iPhone commute but only fair for PS4/Destiny.

Really good headphones. Very simple, portable, and great quality for the price. Whenever I buy headphones, I make sure to buy the ones that go over the ear because I wear mine usually over the course of a couple hours per session. On-ear was a really bad idea, especially at the default configuration (I have a small head, I didn't bother changing the configuration because any bigger I thought it might slip). After about 20 minutes of wearing the headphones at the default configuration my ears started to ache and hurt, I couldn't spend too much time with them.

However, the sound that comes out of these beauties is absolutely amazing! Excellent resounding bass, not sub-woofer quality but a close second. The treble is very balanced, I can crank these up to high than I usually have and not have to worry about sharp cracks due to the audio track peaking at kicks and snare hits. On previous over-ear headphones the max i could set my overall volume was 25%, which at the time was good enough to hear just about everything. With these I can crank them past 50% and more and not have to worry about any sharp cracks. Truly a good pair of headphones for the price.

Regarding the tightness i felt earlier, I was able to adjust the length to fit my needs. The tightness lessened to the point I was able to wear them for extended periods of time, the pads are very much comfortable even if they appear thin. I still prefer over-ear headphones, which denotes the 4 star. That's just my bias.

These headphones are fold-able to fit comfortable and compactly in medium sized pockets or carrying slots. They will almost never tangle, as noted by the semi-circle shaped cords. Although when you first get them, it might take a while to straighten out the curls. Nice strong and thick cable. Lastly, regarding external noise. Most of the noise is largely contained within the headphones, at least within my experience.

[I'll post some pictures later to emphasize my points, although there are a good number of reviews that already showcase this.]

This is a good pair of inexpensive headphones. They are durable. I have bought both the black and white models - just not for myself. I prefer the white ones since they are easier to find in clutter. These can not touch my SONY V6 headphones, not even close. Of course, I don't want anyone to touch my SONY V6 headphones so these fill that gap nicely. After more than two years of use I was surprised that these did not fall apart. These are not that comfortable but that's not the point, these are nice for being $20. In this same price range I paid more than this for ear bud headphones, all of which fell apart. Most of my ear-bud headphones suffered the same fate of having their cables break on the inside.

it's not fare to compare these to more expensive headphones. If you are buying these for yourself and can afford it, of course get better ones.

These are perfect for me. I have small ears so the ear plugs most people use don't work for me. These fit nicely and are adjustable. The sound is good, even at ear popping volume. I haven't had a need to use the microphone yet, but I like having the option. There is no way you can use these for sports, but that is not their purpose, so I'm okay with that. I use them mainly to listen to my Amazon prime music on the iPad. Overall, I would say these are an excellent value. I would definitely buy them again if something happens to the current pair.

Overal this was a good purchase—until they broke only after a few months. for no apparent reason. The sound qaulity is great for the price but the durability of these headphones is very questionable did not expect this from Sony. I have had headphones from other brands for around the same price or cheaper and they have lasted a lot longer.

Mediocre Headphones. From the first day they kept acting up: slight and I mean SLIGHT pressure on the cord (specifically the L shaped part that plugs into your device), will cause songs to skip or pause. Doing that will also activate Google Voice for some odd reason. Imagine listening to your favorite song just to have it be interrupted by Google Voice 30 times, or have it skip to the next song before your favorite part comes on. I’ve purchased headphones from Sony in the past and I’m surprised that I received such a disappointing product.

The sound may not be as good as a sennheiser HD 202, but it sure can last longer. I bought these for my brother and it's been going strong ever since. My bro plays a lot of basketball so these headphones get exposed to a lot of heat and sweat. However, my sennheiser hd202, which I bought with these sonys, is losing sound on the left speaker. I didn't even use my hd202s that often.sony makes better headphones than sennheiser.

Don't let the price fool you, these headphones are in fact great! From deep house music to crunchy blues/jazz rock music, they deliver a good experience, and are awesome value for money for 15 bucks. The only issue I have is sound leakage - if you try to turn up the volume, people around you can hear a little bit and it might not be great in an office environment, but I guess you would have to go as high as at least 50% on the volume levels for noticeable leakage. Have had them for a week now and loving the experience.

These are great headphones. The sounds quality is ok, they aren't really noise cancelling but my husband loves them. We had a different pair that were very expensive and they broke after a few months. These have lasted a while now. The rope is thick and strong and we haven't had any breaking or anything like that which often happens. The ear pieces are comfortable to wear for extended listening time. I would really recommend and buy again.

I bought these headphones after reading various reviews and can fully endorse what other people have found. The sound from these has a very rich bass without compromising the higher end frequencies. They perform much better than the price suggest...they certainly aren't cheap and nasty in their sound quality. They seem to be really good at blocking out external sounds, and I'll be up-dating when I've been on a plane journey which is why, for now I've obly given 4 stars. With good sound deadening on a plane, I'll be up-dating to 5 stars. I'd recommend these to anyone except, obviously, those who are only concerned with being seen with some hugely expensive trendy brands of headphones which, in my experience, have worse higher frequency response at increased volumes.
Can't go wrong with these headphones. I don't listen to music enough via headphones to justify spending more than $25 so this was a perfect option for me. Build quality and sound quality are great.
Haven't used them yet. They look just fine. Nicely delivered intact and ready to use.
Had to throw them away as they lost sound on one ear. Didn't have them that long.

There's something wrong with the audio plug. Static or compromised sound, depending on how I turn it or reseat it in the port. Wish I'd tested these when they first arrived instead of waiting for my old pair to die.
The left side of the headphones does not work. I had to sent it overseas and now I am in a position where I cannot even return the item.
a lil bit uncomfortable to wear for long periods of times, but does the work
Great clarity, nice firm grip. The ear cushions are designed so I can still hear background noised, phone, secretary, front door, ect.

Incredible for the price I paid, 20 dollars. These headphones are very comfortable, and made of high quality plastics. You would never guess that these headphones were 20 dollars if you didn't buy them. Rich bass, clear sound and good volume- what more could you ask for?
Only thing that annoys me is the fact that these went on sale 1 week after purchasing.

The shipping was very fast and the audio is very good quality. The cord doesn't get easily tangled. And something that I didn't notice in the pictures (maybe it was in the description), is that the audio jack is the kind that is at a right angle, making it seem far more durable and long lasting. And I can appreciate that since my other headphones had retired after one or two years because the audio jack had gotten askew or even broken off after one fatal fall. My only concern is the joint where the headphone swivels because it feels a bit delicate but it has been holding up pretty well. For the price, I am beyond satisfied.

I love these. Great sound, very affordable, and super easy to use. I travel with these all over the world (they are very compact and fit into a nice zip bag). Comfortable (I usually have issues with headphones -- very sensitive ears). I even sleep with them lying down on the plane (in business). Sometimes they get a bit sweaty when I use them to work out in, but I just wipe them off with wet paper towel.

I bought these for my son and he loves them. They are comfortable with clear sound and "great bass". He especially likes that they fold easily and I love that they have survived being beaten up and abused in his backpack and are still going strong after three months.

I read a LOT of reviews before making this purchase and I REALLY wanted to love these headphones.. I mean, they're Sony's! I was looking for high quality Bass headphones. Sadly, these are not as good as my husband's Kanen i35 Headphones that he bought here on Amazon for under $20. First of all, they have a much looser fit than the Kanen's, so you can easily hear noise around you, preventing a fully enclosed feeling when it comes to listening to my music. The bass quality was also inferior to the Kanen's. I listened to a nice high, bass song like M83's "Midnight City and did a side-by-side comparison of the headphones and clearly, Kanen's sound came through very loud, clear and with a fuller bass. Had to make sure to share my experience so hopefully it will help someone out when they are trying to make a purchase decision. Good luck!

I really liked the price to sound quality ratio of these headphones HOWEVER the jack is very flimsy. I broke my first pair sitting down with my phone in my pocket. The jack bent, and from then on I had to hold the cord at a particular angle to get sound in both ears. I assumed the fault was mine and bought a second pair, but within a week the cord got caught on a doorknob I was walking past, and with very little force, the jack snapped right in half, leaving the metal part in my phone. I don't think I can afford to keep replacing these every month.

This is a really nice set of headphones for the money. I've never been able to get accustomed to those small earbuds most people use. After a few minutes they make my ears sore. I travel alot also, so I need headphones that will cancel some of the noise from the loudness of the airplane. I'm sure a big set of "noise cancelling" headphones would work a bit better in this regard, but for what they are, this set seems to do a fairly adeqaute job. The sound is really good, they are comfortable, and I absolutley love the "fold up" feature this model has to offer. These headphones will easily fold up, taking up minimal space in your carry on luggage. Glad I purchased!

Great sound quality , comfort, and volume. I have had these before and after 5 or more years they wore out from cleaning the pads.
Great Price and just bought 2 more. The only con you might find is the core is 4 feet. I have had a 8 foot extension for years so it doesn't bother me. Excellent purchase.

I was looking for something to replace my Sennheiser HD 201’s, the connection of which broke on one ear. I first tried the Sentey Warps based on all the glowing reviews, but the inadequate bass response deprived the music of real presence for me. These inexpensive Sony’s did not disappoint. The sounds are clear and smooth with reasonably good definition in all frequency ranges. The emphasized bass lets you feel the music without becoming overwhelming. Having said that I should point out that the higher frequencies and even some of the mids are more recessed as compared to other headphones that I own. That may bother some audiophiles. Nonetheless, I am very happy with my purchase – especially at this price point. I like the fact that I will be able to use them with my Android phone. Since these are worn on the ear and not over the ear, they do leak sound so they probably aren't the best for an airplane or other situations where others are nearby.

Sony's headphones never cease to amaze me. My last Sony MDRZX100 headphones (The older variant of these headphones) broke in one ear cup after using for a year and a half everyday. For only paying $35 for those headphones at the time, I opted to get this pair of newer and cheaper headphones. The sound is crisp, bass is rich, and mid-tones can be heard amazingly! For only $20, I got an extreme upgrade from the previous headphones. Sony is an amazing company to get cheap headphones for a GREAT PRICE!

These Sony Headphones are ideal for my use with a portable radio. The sound is clear and has good frequency response. They are a bargain at
this cost. There is one minor drawback: the separated wires from the phones to the spot where they combine on the cord twist up into little
"pigtails" that are annoying. I can't keep them straight. Otherwise, I recommend them. William
Not good sound quality, very low. The left ear blew within 2 days of use

I had bought 2 pair of these. Initially these were great, but after a couple of months both pair only produced sound from one ear.

Keeps my neighbors happy. Playing piano at night I can hear what the neighbors cannot. The quality is not high end, which I cannot afford. This is an OK solution. Cancels outside noise pretty good too.
used on plane, great for the price!

I am rather picky about my music and the quality of sound during playback. I can say without pause or hesitation that for the money I spent ($15 and change, no shipping) these headphones ROCK! They are tremendously comfortable - to the point of almost forgetting they're on! I bought these and a cord extension so I can get up and walk about a bit without taking off the headphones. I love them! Great sound, nice clarity, decent depth/bass response. I've tried headphones for two and three times as much money that weren't as good as these.

I like the fact I can use my head set for music and talking on my phone. However the headset is too big for my head and falls off. I wish Sony would make a headset that is a bit smaller. The volumes are not always clear or loud enough but I like the headset.

I bought these due to how often I need a headset on my laptop and phone. I actively used these (two different pair) for a few years.
During that time period I learned that the headset is HIGHLY prone to shorting out on one side. Sometimes the mic doesn't work after a good while of use. Sound quality isn't too great but the folding mechanism is wonderful for storage whether it's in a purse, backpack or just on your lap while you're waiting somewhere.
For the price-- if you need something fairly quick and don't mind replacing them often and are *only* needing them for your phone or light computer work-- I think this is okay. If you'd like better quality for voice and sound-- I wouldn't recommend these at all. If you'd like a product that's going to last over a year-- don't. Go look somewhere else and invest a little more money. I expect these to last for six months with heavy use.

Pros: The price is affordable. The headphone is lightweight and does not hurt your ears and the volume is decent.
Cons: The cord is too short and the volume cannot be adjusted. In summary I your looking for a very simple headphone with mic this is it..
These headphones have great sound quality, and feel very sturdy.I would recommend them
These are basic headphones, no Bluetooth and no mic for phone calls but if you're looking for an inexpensive great sounding pair of headphones, you found your product!

The headphones give good music, good sound. I only use them for an MP3 player while doing cardiovascular exercise, and they are suitable for that task. The way that the ear pieces fold means that they won't crack in a suitcase, which is nice.

They do the job. They don't do anything for noise cancellation and the cushion is rather FLAT not puffy like shown in the photos. They fold but every time I fold them I'm super careful because it just feels like it's going to break at any moment. It hasn't so far. Be delicate with them and they may last. I purchased them for a specific purpose and that was to be able to hear microphone levels for a specific project - so for that purpose they work great. They're not very tight on my head either, so that's a plus!

Love these headphones! I wanted to upgrade from my earbuds for grad school and these are serving me quite well! I like how they fold up which makes them easy to slip into my bag. I use them every day and they're a very good pair of headphones. I'm not some expert on different headphone specs, but I just use this with my iPhone, and occasionally my laptop when I'm working in my office, and I think they're fantastic.

We bought two headphone because we didn’t want to share. Best decision Ever. These are of excellent quality and the price is fine. We use them several times daily. They are very comfortable to wear for long periods of time.

I got this for $7.99 during the holiday season. I don't recall if these were a lightning deal or just a general sale but I guess that doesn't really matter much. I gotta say, they perform better than expected. I am by no means an expert on headphone-quality, but I know what I like and I like these headphones. They are sturdy and they sound great. I use them almost daily at work (going on two months now!) with no problems.

They may not be the fanciest headphones out there but if you just need a simple headphone set for casual use, you could do a lot worse than these.

These are just great for the price and then some. I bought these to replace the costco headphones that are battery assisted and where like 60 bucks. So those 60 dollar headphones broke at the dang cord, and cannot be replaced. This cord is the best you can buy and likely wont break the same way as it is protected and flexable.

Sound quality is awesome. The battery assisted ones could go a little louder, but after listening for hours like I usually do, my ears were sore. This is great sound right to the point where it is dangerous, but not hitting that line.

Very comfortable as well and very light. Dr. Dre can kiss it, I'm fine just using these great headphones, crazy good. Will buy a couple more and store them for gifts and extras.

I love these headphones. One has to look at their use type to determine their needs of course, but for likely 90% of people the goal is sound quality, comfort and reliability for the money and these Sony's really are fantastic for the price I paid ($20). I use these everywhere, including at the gym where they stay in place better than many earpiece units I've tried, on my mp3 player, tablet or computer for music or tv/movie watching, for audio books and for phone use. There is a slightly cheaper version of these that don't have the microphone but for hands free talk from my phone I can hear those I speak to very well and I also am told I can be heard well too. True these headphones don't have quite the ear hugging pads of some of the higher priced noise cancelling one's but they are still very good at blocking sound and are quite comfortable. These also have good extension for different sized noggins and while lightweight, they feel sturdy and well crafted. My kid has $200 Beats which take less abuse than my Sony's and in less than 3 months hers are already having sound issues while mine keep playing great. I'll be buying another pair of these just to put away, that's how much I like them.

My ears are very sensitive to the touch with any headphone, and ear buds usually do not stay in my ears, and if I can even get them in, they are quite painful, even long after taking them out. Most low-priced over the head ear phones are also uncomfortable on my head and ears, and the older ones never sounded good.
I've only used these once for a couple of hours, so I can not comment on how long they last. If things change, I will amend my review. With these, the sound was clear, left and right separated well, and did not press too hard on my ear. When I took them off after a couple of hours of use, my head around my ears was slightly sore/sensitive, but that did not last longer than 5 minutes. As I said, that area of my head is quite sensitive.
For $15 I highly recommend these.

I got these for under 8 dollars, so I wasn't expecting much. They turned out to be a good set of headphones. The sound quality is good. They are comfortable on the head and ears. The only minor complaint is the person sitting next to you can hear everything if the volume is turned up. And since one of the main reasons you wear headphones is to not bother anyone with your noise, it loses one star. The cord is short, but if you use them with your phone or laptop, it works out perfect. I bought these for a TV, so I might have to buy and extension. All in all, I would definitely recommend these.

First and foremost these are great headphones, especially for under $20.

I'm not an audiophile by any means, rather a fairly regular guy looking for a pair of headphones on a budget that will still do a good job delivering great sound quality. These are absolutely the headphones that will do that. Sound quality is excellent from fountains of Wayne's "Stacies Mom" to childish gambino's "Oakland." Comfort wise the headphones are also excellent, there is no pinch, they're very lightweight, and the ear cups are very comfortable.

The only reason I give these headphones 4 stars is the build materials. Because they are a low cost headphone they are made of a fairly run of the mill plastic, along with that the swivel design is something that I can forsee breaking in the future, it's not flimsy, rather just the mechanism is of it puts a pretty good deal of torque on a fairly small joint.

If you're looking for a pair of new headphones buy these. For the price they can't be matched, just remember you're buying them for less than $20 so don't expect any thing too crazy in the build materials and quality

Fairly good sound for the $20 price and comfortable enough for what I use them for. If you want perfect comfort and sound you should spend more money. I use it for music practice obout an hour at a time and it works well for that.

If you're looking for an inexpensive pair of headphones to binge watch Netflix or Hulu with, you can't go wrong. Just got them today, and thus far, I'm very happy! Something else that has nothing to do with quality. I'm legally blind, and have trouble seeing the little L and R written on the headphones to distinguish the left phone from the right. Well, the left phone has a tiny little bump on it that I can feel that the right does not. I have no idea if this was done intentionally, but it is EXTREMELY helpful to me.

They only fold up minimally, and they also don't come with a carrying bag or case (which for $17 is kind of expected.) If you're looking for on-ear headphones you should probably keep looking for something more comfortable.

I give these headphones a 5 star rating for sound quality and comfort. Sound quality is amazing and they are comfortable on my ears. Newer version for less amount of money. The only drawback is, if you have a desktop computer the cord isn't quite long enough. I had to end up pulling the computer tower out and closer so the cord wouldn't pull. I had expected the cord to be longer (like the old model) but other than that, no issues with these headphones.

I bought two of these, a black pair for my teenager and a white pair for me. She uses hers with a gadget that makes hers into bluetooth connectable. That means she can listen to her music (if that's what you want to call it) and watch t.v. (American Horror Story? No thank you.) and I don't have to hear it. We both love the comfortable fit and great sound. Of course, they don't have the same sound as much more expensive headphones but, they are well built and deliver good quality sound.

I bought these to replace other ear buds. I am the person that can not have ear buds in my ears for very long before my ears hurt badly. These work great and are very comfortable to wear, yes they are a bit bulky, but that is to be expected with this type of headphones. The sound is great, but it is nothing close to noise cancelling headphones. I didnt expect them to be for the cost of these. They are just what I expected them to be.
They are good but the inner part of those headphones gets damaged very soon. Same for all headphones of that kind. At least, those were not as expensive as disappointing and overrated Bose!

I am extremely pleased with this headset. I bought it for two main purposes, listening to music on an iPad and plugging into a headphone amp while I practice what I laughingly call my guitar playing. The headphones excel at both, sounding much better than the admittedly good iPad speaker and faithfully reproducing the guitar's tones. (Though that last isn't always doing me any favors.) The headphones sound every bit as good as my gaming headsets costing four times as much. The bass is strong without being overpowering or artificial or distorted, midrange and treble are equally pure and balanced.

One issue that is a plus for me but maybe not you - the cord is very short. Great for iPad and guitar, not so much for gaming or work.

The set we had broke after two months; the swiveling joint on the LH earpiece/speaker came apart on one side. I fixed it; just needed to find the small metal pin, reinsert it into the joint and screw everything back together. Unfortunately, it promptly broke again, so apparently ours was defective. I have been working with Sony Customer Service (not always an easy proposition- let's just say English is not the first language of their mostly otherwise helpful and courteous CS representatives) to get a replacement under the 90-day warranty. Had to call them twice in two weeks, then had to send the defective ones back at my expense to Sony. Quite frankly, not a stellar experience, there...
The design of the swiveling speakers is neat, and when it works, convenient for storage. Don't know if the issue we experienced is widespread or not. The headphones' electronics worked fine, and before we had the problem with the swivel joint coming apart, my daughter really loved them.

The sound is okay on these, which was expected- they are $15. I didn't expect fantastic sound. However, I was upset because the comparison chart said the headphones would be over the ear headphones and I definitely received on-ear headphones. I feel like that was really misleading and should be corrected. I originally got these headphones because of the great reviews and I was sick of the headphone jacks on my dollar stores headphones. I can honestly say that the jack on these headphones is even WORSE than dollar store headphones. If I move even the tiniest bit, and even when I haven't moved at all, the sound will come out of the laptop speakers instead of the headphones. I willing to put up with the fact that these are on-ear, but the jack is annoying me so much that I was moved to write a review. I never write reviews. I thought I was making a better investment with these headphones, but honestly I'd rather stick with the dollar store ones. I am extremely disappointed with these- do your research before you by them instead of being blindsided by the good reviews.

I was curious if there was a difference between these and a "higher class" set of headphones so I purchased these along side the
$70 Audio-Technica ATH-M30x. I first tried these Sony headphones on and was quite pleased. Nice bass response and good overall sound. I was satisfied.

But then I tried the ATH-M30x and noticed the difference immediately. These had much better dynamic range. The highs where a lot brighter and the lows were even lower and more defined. Most importantly the mid range (voices) sound much much clearer.

I tried these Sony headphones again and they sounded pretty bad now. I could really hear how bad the voices seemed muffled and all the treble I was missing.

I'm not suggesting to get the ATH-M30x, as I'm not sure if I'll keep those either (now I'm curious about a higher class headphones). I'm just saying when you compare the Sony's to other headphones they are actually not that good.

Good service by amazon. Item not damage during shipping. Item arrive mint in condition. Sound and voice quality is good. Great sony product with a good price point. Recommeded by my friend. But the downside is the wire is a bit fragile. The 2 wires below the the 2 ear cups on each side. If you set the headset down resting on those 2 cable connection to the ear cup. The wires will be easily damage. The weight of the headphone will be pressing down on the thin wire connection causing some static to the headset. Can be fix if you know how to open it and straighten the wire back. Got to be very careful how you set the headphone down. It's a Android headphone. If you want to use it with a PC, need to buy a audio mic splitter adapter like the creative had.

I hate these headphones They are not NEARLY as good as the previous version that Sony is obsolescing, the Sony MDRZX100. Here's how Sony is cheaping out in the new design:

1. no strain relief at wire and ear cap -- more likely to break, i.e. crappier
2. plastic design of housing is molded to be more lighter and more hollow, i.e. weaker and crappier
3. new hinging design seems to be quite weak, less smooth and more shear-y (it's this weird, crappy plastic-om-plastic bearing), gives the tactile feel of crappier quality.
4. wires to aux have a thinner casing -- i.e. are crappier

Darnit, Sony, stop cheaping out and obsolescing the old design.

I have this headphones permanently plugged to my computer at my office. I use a switcher to alternate between headphones and speakers whenever I need to keep the sound to myself. I work on video editing, so I use these ALL the time. After almost two years they are still going strong with nice and crisp sound. I do not hear any distortion or buzzing. It's true what other reviewers mention, they feel a little cheap, but guess what? They are! I bought them fully knowing that they would be everyday working headphones and not leisure or audiophile ones, for that I spent a lot more money and got much better sounding quality. Even so, I took them home a few nights ago (I used a good case protector) to use while at bed and while I could clearly hear the difference between this pair and the good ones, I could still listen to my tunes without issue. They stay on my head at all times.

For $15 these are as good as it gets. Totally recommend them. If they break it is absolutely worth it to buy a new pair, the newer model even has a microphone for less than what I paid originally.

It's not bad for the price, but has some pretty bad sound leak at higher volumes, and what is this quality?

The photo attached is HOW THE HEADPHONES CAME IN. This kind of build quality is not okay, that is what I would expect from a used pair of headphones, not from a new pair.

Pros:
- Easy to use
- Comfortable to wear
- Folds up for easy storage

Cons:
- Single layer cable, is not braided
- Terrible QA, see my picture
- So-so build quality
- Leaks audio at higher volumes
- Shorter cable
- Presses on your ears

All in all, I guess I would buy it again, but maybe next time I'll give the MDRZX100 a shot because those were the ones that everyone was recommending, but I saw these and got these instead. I do believe these are cheaper than the older model though, so I'm not entirely sure.

Just love these headphones. Even though they're less than $20 they wow my ears better than the generic ones for similar price, & they are sturdy to. Before these I was buying a new pair every couple of months. Top it off they're comfortable. I tend to forget they are there sometimes.

These are actually pretty good. I've been using this style of headphones for years now, and I usually buy in this price range, as they tend to break after about a year from normal wear and tear. These are one of my favourites in my price range.

Some of the things I like are the soft ear pieces. I wear glasses so generally after a while my ears will start to ache when I use headphone. I can wear these much longer than most. The sound quality is good, although I wouldn't call them totally noise cancelling. The folding parts aren't amazing, but it saves a bit of space.

All in all a great pair for the price.

Great Head Phones and The mic works great too. Bone Jaring bass clean highs and no muddled sound. These sound like they cost much more than they did. The mic will not work with a laptop or other computer, it's made for a small triple right connection like in a Cell Phone (look at the plug to see all 3 rings). Light weight great sound and great microphone = no complaints.
Wrapping the cord around them is a bit troublesome. They are quite comfortable. I sometimes use these with my head resting on it's side on a pillow, if that says anything.
Nice stereo son
Much better then my buds
It's not the "quality" Beats by Dre but it gets the job done. Sound is good. I primarily use it when working out. No issues.
Nice product...reasonably priced, good sound, nice fit. They withstand the abuse I give them...I use them at work so they get tugged on and snatched off frequently...no probs yet.
Not great volume.
Good value for the money

I had this product for one day and I left the headphones plugged into my iPad. I placed the iPad and headphones in my bag and placed the bag on a chair. The bag that it was in slipped out of the chair and fell to the ground and the headphone jack broke off in my iPad. I called Sony to explain what happened and they refused to give me a replacement. I would give everyone a word of caution. Buy at your own risk, because Sony will not replace or refund after having it for just one day.
great quality; foldable, will take little space when folded; great for travelers; probably the best quality you can get in this price range ($10 on Amazon)
quite comfortable
My daughter's father ordered these for me and I love them. Great sound for under $20, comfortable, and I like how they fold up and fit conveniently in my bag.
Got these for $10, sound great
Bought 2 pairs and both broke within a couple of months. Wiring disconnected from headphone jack. Very disappointed.
Cord always breaks. Replaced several times
The effect is good, the price is very appropriate
I these headphones for the money are great!
Bought these for my husband he loves the sound and the fact it works very nice with his Samsung 3 phone, I can't complain his happy.
These headphones are a steal! It's amazing how Sony can build such a high quality product and charge such a low price.
GREAT
They are excellent with music but I don't like where the microphone is. on them.
awesome deal, last pair lasted 4 years of hard use
Headphones met my expectations. I have had no problems and enjoy using them. I would recommend these headphones to anyone wanting good headphones at a great price.
Bought for my daughter May 1 and the right side stopped working within two weeks. That was quick smh
Good Headphones.
For the price they are perfect, great sound quality, very comfortable. I highly recommend these cans.
sounds very good
Great buy and price well made very happy.
Sturdy, non-tangle cord. Cord is just over 4' long. Surprisingly great sound for the price. Very comfortable for on ear headphones.
They're not loud enough. But hey, you get what you've paid for.
For the money, these headphones sound great. Definitely recommend these!
Incredible headphones at a great price. They sound like they cost much more. Pick these up if you need something affordable yet high quality.
Headphones met my expectations. I have had no problems and enjoy using them. I would recommend these headphones to anyone wanting good headphones at a great price.
Bought for my daughter May 1 and the right side stopped working within two weeks. That was quick smh
Good Headphones.
For the price they are perfect, great sound quality, very comfortable. I highly recommend these cans.
sounds very good
Great buy and price well made very happy.
Sturdy, non-tangle cord. Cord is just over 4' long. Surprisingly great sound for the price. Very comfortable for on ear headphones.
They're not loud enough. But hey, you get what you've paid for.
For the money, these headphones sound great. Definitely recommend these!
Incredible headphones at a great price. They sound like they cost much more. Pick these up if you need something affordable yet high quality.
Fast shipping, excellent product equal happy customer. For a affordable price these headphones are great. I'm glad I gave it a chance.

I gave it 5 stars because of the price and sound quality. If these cost $50 instead of $15 they would get maybe 2 or 3 stars. But with these I apply the 80/20 rule.....at 20% of the price of higher end headphones you still get 80% of the quality. With the 80/20 rule its the other 20% of quality that can really drive the price up :-)

Build Quality; Good enough, little cheapy/plasticy. The padded ear pieces are good enough, and the chord is a nice bonus as its thicker (less prone to damage and tangeling). One mark against them is I found the padding to be a little too much, making my ears a little warm after a couple hours. Some headphones have less padding and a more open design.

Sound; With brands like Bose and Beats I expect a bias in terms of sound profile (eg. too much hi/lo, too much bass, etc...). With the Sony's, the profile is pretty even from the low to mids to highs. Songs with heavier bass sounded fine, with the bass neither under or over emphasized. In terms of quality there's no noticeable distortion. Nice and clean.

If Sony built these with slightly better materials, and added more emphasis to the bass and treble, they could probably sell them for $50+. And, I'm sure they do.

For what they are, they deserve 5 stars. I'm more of a habitual user of earbuds, but I wanted a set that I use specifically and only for around my house. For the longest time, I used one pair of earbuds for everything, which led to me constantly having to go to my car or back into the house to get them. For starters, these headphones are very well built! The wires are relatively thick, but not obtrusively so, and the plastic feels very rugged and durable. They are extremely comfortable. I was skeptical of their comfort level considering they don't fit over the entire ear, but the cushy pads work very well. I have no problem wearing these for hours. The sound quality is quite nice. Now I will admit that my buds have a little more sonic depth, but don't worry 13 year old boys- this has good bass, the most important musical quality for anyone under 16. The sound quality is, at most, 4 stars, but I didn't expect perfection (nor did I intend on using these for my music player). These are perfect for watching movies, shows, or YouTube. The fact that they fold up is just a fun little bonus. If you just need a set of headphones for generalized computer use, I can't see you doing wrong with these.

I have been buying this particular style of headphones from Sony for no less than 5 years. We are a family of ten with a lot of gadgets and gizmos that require headphones. Plus several youngins' who need headphones for school. This latest adaptation is slightly different from the original in that the cords are flat. Performance though continues to be outstanding. We only ever need to replace these because they've been lost. In the no less than 5 years we have been purchasing these we've purchased other "top quality" brands that just do not offer the sound quality or comfort that these do. Frankly, the price is always right and as long as the product is able to withstand a family that includes and bunch of little ones we will continue to purchase well into the future. You will not go wrong buying these Sony headphones.

These headphones are the definition of "bang for your buck." I actually own their predecessor, the MDR-ZX100. There is a little more bass than the 100s, but it's not going to blow you away. The cans do a good job of delivering music at high volumes with no distortion. The jack is more slender than the 100s, and should fit into most iPhone cases (fits into mine with no problem). The inline mic picks up my voice just fine, but note there are no volume controls. Just one button to wake up Siri or to pause music. The 110s also fold up a little more nicely than the 100s, and they will fit nicely in my backpack while laying flat.

I suppose if there is a drawback, it's that Sony used a glossy plastic for the exterior of the cans. That means you'll have fingerprints visible. But that's all I can think of as as drawback.

Overall, if you are looking for a replacement for an aging set, even if they are the 100s, I'd say go for it. If the inline mic is not something you think you'll use, there's a version without one that will save you a few bucks.

Headphones worked well with my Android smartphone (Droid Maxx) and tablet (Nexus 9). However, when I switched to the iPhone 6S, the smartphone started to engage Voice Control for no reason and with no physical intervention. The Voice Control would occur randomly whenever the headphone plug is rotated, which would occur if you were exercising or just moving around. I had the iPhone 6S replaced per Apple warranty, and the same symptoms occurred with the second iPhone 6S. I then used a different headphone on my iPhone 6S, and it worked fine.

So be wary on using this headphone on an iPhone with headphone jack...

Just received these. I got them primarily for use on my computer, mostly just listening to videos but also to use with voice recognition software, so I got the one with the microphone..

I'm not an audiophile, but I did want decent sound in case I use them on a music player. They sound just fine, as you would expect from Sony, especially at this price point.

I'm quite happy that they work very well with Dragon NaturallySpeaking, which I'm using to dictate this, so the microphone is quite adequate.

What is nice is that the microphone is on one of the wires and it is not more than three or 4 inches from your mouth. Again quite happy with the fact that it works quite well with Dragon NaturallySpeaking.

I can't see me using this for telephone calls. For some reason I don't feel comfortable with over the ear headphones, or earbuds for calls. I don't get a real sense of feedback to be able to modulate my voice. For phone calls I prefer a single ear unit.

The big disappointment is that, like so many Sony headphones I've had in the past these things are so tight, it squeezes your head like a grapefruit. What I've done is take a hairdryer to the headband to heat up the plastic, and attempt to bend it a bit to loosen it up. I've had some success in making them more comfortable. At least this plastic is somewhat malleable, because I found that some of the other plastics are almost impossible to bend without breaking.

For me they'll do the job quite well for something under $20.

After wearing them now for just a few minutes I remember what I hate about most headphones. The vinyl earpiece cover always make your ears hot.
Now I'm on the search for foam or cotton cover to go over these.

These are some of the best headphones you can get this side of $50. Great sound, sturdy cable and connector, and very affordable. I got a pair for listening to Chopin at work and have been very happy with them. Comparing these against a set of bose on-ear headphones, the bose do have a noticeably better sound, especially if you're like me and prefer to listen to music in FLAC. Otherwise, on just mp3 these will fit the bill nicely. While these don't have noise cancelling, like the bose, they do get quite loud and don't have noticeable distortion. Lastly, while comfortable these do get uncomfortable if you're wearing them for more than 3 hours at a time.
