So that's you, the most comfortable headphones I've had were the bose in-ear buds due to the silicon inserts. However, those headphones died after two years because it had junky wiring and didn't hold up to getting tossed in a backpack the way these have. But at this price point, there's an incredible amount of value to these.

These are JUST what I was looking for: a budget set of commuter headphones. I need headphones that are closed, so as not to bother the people sitting next to me on the subway. Sound leakage on these is negligible. Thumbs up.

I need headphones that are smallish, and foldability is a plus. These are smallish and they fold easily. Another thumbs up.

They are lightweight, and feel a bit flimsy, so I would expect they will not stand up to much abuse. Luckily I have a headphone bag to keep them in when they're not on my ears or hanging around my neck.

I also wanted headphones that are not garish. These have a simple, classic and understated design that will not draw attention to themselves or look dated in a couple of years. Thumbs up.

The sound: so far, I'd say the sound is very good, especially for such inexpensive, closed phones. I'm listening to some Van Halen and the frequency range is good, with lots of punch and lots of presence. Another thumbs up.

Not sure I buy into the whole "burn-in" mantra, but I'm interested to see if they sound better in a week or two. Also curious as to how they'll handle other music styles (classical, jazz, etc).

So, first impressions: this is a GREAT set of budget commuter headphones. Superior, in my opinion, to ear-buds, which I can't stand.

EDIT: Ok, first real negative. The hard plastic headband is not comfortable after a little while. I'm going to have to superglue some padding to make them more comfortable.

This is a nice cheap set of wired headphones from Sony. The do what they're supposed to do, deliver sound in to your ears from whatever device you've plugged the 3.5mm audio jack in to. I use it to listen to audio from my laptop in bed when watching Netflix/TV/etc. while my spouse watches the regular TV. They are on-the-ear headphones so they probably won't be the most comfortable to wear for long periods of listening but they work just fine for me in short stints. I like that the jack is an L-shape so it doesn't just stick right straight out from whatever device it's plugged in to.

I have large ears but these probably won't fit over-the-ear as described on most people with normal size ears either. However, they will stay snug to your ears with loud and great sound regardless. I was really surprised that headphones this cheap could be this great. This is the first time any electronics have exceeded my expectations in decades since most companies purposely misrepresent, i.e. falsely advertise, their products like the Amazon Fire Stick that won't even work properly with Amazon Prime videos, let alone all the other streaming services. Let's see how long this review stays up after I just told everybody the Fire Stick is pathetic.

These are great headphones. I purchased these for people at my work trying to be able to block out noise and to be able to do online training. They are lightweight, not clunky at all, and work well. The sound quality is nice too. Don't be fooled by how cheap they are, they still are quality.
Not as comfortable to wear as suggested in the product description. Sound quality is very good but it is difficult to wear them for extended periods of time. Rather disappointed but am keeping them
I love that these fold up. I've had them for around 6 months now and they still work wonderfully! Great for if you need over ear headphones that won't break the bank.

I've had these things for a couple of years now. You honestly can't beat the quality for the price. They're comfortable, and they sound good enough for work headphones. I haven't had any durability issues despite a few drops.

The product is mostly not bad, but in just 18 months of use the right earphone stopped working, unless you jiggle the cord close to the plug in some special way. If you're listening to stereophonic music this is completely unacceptable. Nothing happened to this device; it just stopped working properly one day.

For the price - these are the best! They have a relatively flat response and they don't sound as good as other more expensive headphones like Beats. But they do the job well. I think they sound better with classical, blues, acoustic music than they do with bass-heavy styles like hip-hop.

They are very comfortable and look great.

Cheap as gas station headphones, but sound considerably better than the gas station ones.

Short, but sturdy, cable.

I have a giant head, but they fit ok when fully extended.

Won't be winning any contests with higher range headphones, tinny, they crack on rare occasion, but serviceable. I bought them primarily to bring to places where people might try to steal my headphones, like business trips.
Delivered as promised. Very satisfied with these headphones. I plan to use them on future plane trips, so the folding feature and ear coverage to help block out the ambient noise is very important.

Simple yet effective. Only thing that surprised me is how quiet these are at higher volume settings on my iphone. I don't need music super loud so I don't care too much about that. The single button w multi function works like a charm. They arnt too sturdy, but they fold flat which is great for backpacks etc. and for the price, you can't beat it.

For the price, you really can't beat these things. I have some really, REALLY nice studio headphones for when I'm doing audio mixing or I want to listen to something and make a really big thing about it, but they're much more bulky and I'm always afraid that I'll damage them somehow.

These headphones were meant to be a cheap alternative that I could use at home. They sound really nice! I got another pair for work as well.

they might be cheap but they're excellent. sony is my go-to for headphones and these don't disappoint. the sound is full and rich (maybe it's just my awesome music...), they're not too tight but don't feel like they're going to slip. they fold flat which will be handy for traveling. $15 is a great price for these. i'm almost happy my other ones got smashed. :)
great

Very surprised at how good these sound especially for the price point.

For years I have been enjoying my also inexpensive Koss Titanium Pro25 headphones. Cheap but good triumphs over excellent and expensive for me because I have many opportunities to lose my headphones.

These sound a bit "cleaner" to me, the music and spoken word are more distinct for some reason.

I recommend them to you!

My son uses for school-they use blended learning where the kids have some lessons on computers so he uses them several times a day. They block out outside noise and have good sound for cheap headphones. Plus they are not expensive so if they get broken, it's not a huge loss.

These are great sounding headphones. There is a ridiculous slew of endorsed, unbelievably overpriced, bad sounding headphones out there lately. Don't be silly and stick with the tried and true. If you need to pick a status symbol, pick something other than headphones.
How about a face tattoo? ...
Please do consider these things carefully.

These headphones are great! It's a good price for a great product. I have had these headphones for a few months now and they still work great, and I have even dropped them a couple times. The headphones are adjustable and very comfortable to wear. I was suprised by how clear the sound was a first, these are definitely high quality headphones, I would definitely recommend them.

Can't beat the sound for less than $18. Clear with just enough bass. Yes, you can spend more money. Yes, you might get better sound. You won't find better sound at this price. They are also solidly built. They flatten easily for storage and are comfortable to wear. I use these for recording. I can hear myself and my music clearly.

Comfortable and great sound! I bought these for my own 2nd grader, after my 7th grade students told me how much they loved them. The ones my students have been using have lasted well...and those kids aren’t always kind to them.

I've lost and left behind the more expensive ones over the years so I got these. They work just fine and sound very good. They fold up nicely and fit in my backpack easily for easy access. The cord seems to be more durable than my more expensive headphones. If I loose these I would not hesitate to purchase again.

I am a Sony loyalist. I am not an audiophile. I am rugged on the electronics I use (see clumsy and oafish.)
I have tried the other value brands of over the ear headphones.
You get more than you pay for with this product.
Or at least more durability.

these headphones have very mediocre sound quality, and are very quiet. These do not muffle any outside sounds, but they're comfortable enough. if you need a throwaway pair of headphones, these could work, they also feel very cheap. For a Sony product I would expect something better.

These are our favorite headphones for our children ages 12 and 5. We have three sets now. They fold up nicely and fit in the pocket behind the seats in the car so we always have them handy for traveling. My daughter also folds up a pair in her school bag to have for a long bus ride back and forth. I first bought them when they were on sale and then went back a few months later and bought another set at full price because I was so happy with the quality. My kids go through ear buds/headphones quickly as they are young and tough on them. We still have all three sets of these we working well close to a year later.
Decent headphones for the money for studying or listening to music when you want the sound to be more immersive and enveloping. There are way better headphone out there, but these do the job.

The sound quality of these headphones is absolutely amazing for the low price.
I bought these for my 10 year old son as basic headphones for school and using as handsfree with a cell phone, but listening to music he and I were both amazed - these sound much better than my $100 Monster Headphones.
I was so impressed I bought a 2nd pair for myself!
The treble is a bit light, so boosting treble in the music player gives an even better balanced sound, this is probably due to emphasis of the extra bass - the bass is great, full and thumping.
The sound stage detail is also excellent and expansive, you can really pick out each instrument and singer.
Enjoy!

These are ok for a set of headphones that you use casually. I needed them for studying in a noisy apartment and they worked pretty well. Needless to say, they are not high quality. They are a lightweight plasic and are rickety and cheap looking. They can be uncomfortable during long term wear but the sound is decent.

Its rare that I spend money on high dollar headphones. I have had great luck with Sony headphones. I needed a cheap set for my desk as work and have been extremely impressed. The sound quality from these headphones is on par with my previous $50 set from Sony so I am happy about that. My only complaint is the ear cups could havve slightly more cushioning to make me happy. For $17 i am extremely happy and certainly would purchase another set should i lose these on my commute home.

These are fantastic headphones. I bought two pair; one for work, one for home and I am very glad I did. The sound quality is very good and after the initial itchiness, of having something covering my ears, I find they are very comfortable. They do not block outside noises but I have no problems hearing my programs or music at low volume.
I highly recommend these headphones!!

I want to start off by saying that I'm a bit of a bass head. I like strong heavy bass that doesn't sound like the headphones are breaking. These headphones don't do that for me. They don't get loud enough for me to truly enjoy the music and though the bass is not terrible, I'm not able to enjoy it because of the low sound. But, if you aren't specific about sound I would still say don't get these, Sony has a pair for 10 bucks that is not bass boosted but sounds basically the same. You can enjoy your music just the same with the cheaper ones.
quality headphones at a real bargain price how could I let that get away? thank you for having just what I needed the old head phones were shot

Not sure if I just received a bad pair but the volume capability on these is somewhat low. I am currently listening to music on full blast (something I rarely do) and it still sounds fairly quiet. The overall quality is pretty good, though. The headphones are VERY comfortable and the microphone works well, too. My only real complaint is the volume, which is only about average, but adequate.

I am using these exclusively on my PS4 and they work beautifully. Game audio sounds great and my friends say my voice sounds super clear through the built-in mic. I'm glad I didn't get any real gaming headsets like Turtle Beaches because these Sony ones do the job just fine.

I also tried them on my Galaxy S5 for music with the Poweramp app and it also sounds great.

Other people compared this H.P. to beats and bose. I haven't heard to either one so no comment on that. I purchased it cause of that review.
I compared it to the unit I have the Koss Porta Pro. No comparison but of course it's not fair since Koss cost three times as much. For the price I think sony is good but I regret buying it.

Inexpensive but decent quality sound for under 20 bucks. Like the folding feature fits nicely in the backpack. A HUGE plus is the angled plug-its much more durable than the better sounding sanheisers but the sanheisers have a plug which plugs in perpendicular to the computer and fails after only a month or two making them totally useless.

These phones are a great deal for the money. I usually don't like Sony products but these are pretty good. I use them at work, plugged into either my computer or iPhone and they sound pretty good. Haven't had any complaints about the mic either. conversations are nice and clear and music sounds pretty good for a cheap pair of headphones.

I use this set of headphones exclusively for making phone calls on my iPhone 6s Plus. I could not hear on my phone and others couldn't hear me, but this set of headphones eliminates that problem. This mic seems to be just the right sensitivity and the sound is great for calls and music. The price is great too!

I don't know much about the technical stuff, I just know that these work well and the sound is great. I also appreciate that they will fit my head! My head is kind of small and many headsets will not adjust small enough. They work well for my husband, too. (He's got a normal head. :-p)

I really like these headphones, i wanted something I could occasionally watch movies on my PS4, and play PS4 games with, this did the trick perfectly, You can really hear the stereo surround sound in action movies and anime, and the microphone works great talking to other players while gaming, it is real clear and crisp. It's comfortable for me for a couple of hours, after that it can get a little uncomfortable but I'm not complaining because that can be said for any headphones since they are made to be worn on your head over your ears. I'm glad I didn't spend $100 on an expensive pair, because these sound just as good to me.

A replacement item for my 70 something year old mother. She liked her original one so much that she asked for another one. She tells me that it's the only headset she has tried that she can hear the news reporter clearly.
Bought for my sons birthday and a month later 1 side of the headphone fell off! And of course it has been little over a month and they wont accept returns.

Definitely can recommend this headphones! For the price you pay you get good quality. Pay attention: have to use them as you receive them because you might get by mistake a pair that malfunctions, like I received in the dirt place. The replacement was very simple and easy tot do, and very fast.
These work great. They're comfortable to wear, have a nice sound, and fold up nicely. Total 5 star except my kids thought so too and now I have no idea where they are. 4 stars for you Sony.

These are decent for what they are. They tend to hurt the top of my head after just an hour of having. Loosening them up doesn't help, because the weight of them slide back down your head. The actual sound produced by them is pretty good, and the cord is a cord that doesn't get stuck easily with other cords because of how smoothy and not grippy it is. I would recommend them for a cheap temporary replacement set of headphones.

I've been waiting for a decent pair of headphones since 1978. :) This is first one with well designed plug connection - sturdy and not likely to break or fray the wire with use; the slight angle of the speakers over the ears fit the natural shape of your head comfortably, the sturdy design, without bulky size or protrusions of the head band, and the apparently few parts show great attention to detail in design and manufacture. Best bargain for about $10 bucks I've had.The loss of bass audio signal in most headphones of past seems perfectly compensated for (I don't know if they acutally use a signal boost, or just great enclosure design over the ear). Good work Sony. - Great, timely service and delivery from Amazon marketplace vendor too.
These are a great back up headphones while I’m waiting for my replacement wireless headphones to be sent to me , good sound

I've had this headphones for about seven months now and they have yet to give out on me. I'm surprised, usually my headphones wear out quickly but not these ones. Worth the buy, especially for the price.

We have three boys ages 9 to 13. I was tired of ear buds that stop working after a few uses or get tangled and broken. Also my 9 year old has one ear canal that's smaller so he can't wear ear buds. No way was I spending $$$ for some of the other brands. These have been great! They've been using them for almost 6 months and all three pairs are still working great!

Right out of the box, the wiring was faulty at the jack end of the cable. If I keep the cable still, it's not a problem, but if the cable moves in any way the sound is compromised. The cable thickness seems pretty cheap, so maybe that has something to do with it. If the cable wasn't an issue, I'd give the headphones a 4 out of 5. At times, the bass seems to slightly overwhelm the sound contrast, but it's not bad, and the headphones are fairly comfortable.
Can't beat them for the price. Not studio quality, but I didn't expect them to be at this price. I would recommend these.
Sleek design and great sound.. It's well worth the price since I didn't want to buy a headset that was $100 for a preteen.

I bought these on December 18, 2014. Using them literally EVERY DAY 24/7 (school, gaming, listening to music, sleeping)
dropping them
yanking the wire by accident
etc.

These headphones are unreal for the value.
They broke on July 6th, 2016 when one side stopped working.
I use them to play on my home console and they do the job perfectly. Sound is great for music, games and movies with everything being fairly balanced.

Perfect for young ones that are careless and toss things around Bought 6 months ago and still same new condition. Clean flat EQ is perfect for kids also so that extra bass does not damage their young still developing ears, and still hear their cartoons/movies/music clearly.

As long as you don't want to hear classical music at full super-ultra high fidelity to be able to hear the baby rattle used in the back of the orchestra or bang your head with heavy metal and become deaf in the process, these headphones will to the job.

These work great for listening to sound board mix. Also works great for gaming.

They have a very good response range, lots of bass up into high frequency response.

Very impressed for the price!

This is the best Sony product I've bought in a few years!

These are a great pair of headphones considering the price. They won't sound as good as a pair of Bose or similar high end headphones, but at this price, you can't expect it to. That being said, the sound quality is quite good, they don't sound tinny on the high end, and on the low end, they've got some real bass. Build quality also seems to be good, they feel pretty solid, but if you're rough with them, I'm sure they wouldn't last. They are also very comfortable, I'm pretty picky on comfort, but these feel good. All in all, I would say these feel and sound like a $30 or $40 pair of headphones, so at the price of around $15, just order a pair, you won't regret it.

I bought these headphones to listen to music on my mp3 and phone...very happy with them. They have a excellent clear, rich sound and very comfortable to wear !
You can not beat them for the price. I have had more expensive headphones that are not as good. You won't be disappointed with these. I highly recommend!

A little heavy, but long term wear (gaming) is not an issue. I really like the clarity (I am not big on spending tons of money to listen to music... so 'good' is enough for me) and these are very clear and have a good range.. highs and lows.

I also use this in my guitar amp and works well (Peavey Vypyr VP-20) clear and loud.

For the price its a good buy.

Arrived fast, plugged them in and they sound great. They have a major draw back for me and it might only be for me but they are extremely hot against the outside of my ear. It became uncomfortable within 30 seconds. It's like wearing ear muffs in the winter. Going back to an inner ear bud model.

I am a nerd when it comes to sound. These headphones SHOCKED me at how well they sound and work with my SmartPhone. The mic is even clearer than my previous OEM set from Samsung. Worth the cash, and believe me I was prepared to throw these away if they sucked. They are AWESOME! I am so happy I took a chance on these bad boys.

I purchased this headset based on previous reviews. I am very pleased with this headset. The sound quality is very good. For the price these can not be beat. I only occasionally wear headsets to listen to my music so I am not an audiophile buff. For my listening these are very good.

Despite the other reviewers hype, these are just OK headphones. I have a big head and find them tight and uncomfortable. The "natural" position for these headphones is about 1.5" apart, which means for every inch you stretch it around your head, the tighter it gets. The sound quality is muddled and has little sparkle or clarity to the highs. The bass is OK in the mid bass range, but sub bass is very poor. I won't bother to return them, for $15 bucks it's not worth it. Don't misunderstand, they are fine for the price...I understand these are not $300 headphones, but my Audio Technica's are relatively cheap too and blow these out of the water.

These have lasted me along time. They are comfortable and the sound is great. I would and did buy these again. Now my daughter uses a pair of these. She was going through headphones at least once a month because hers kept breaking. She has been using these for a few months now with no problems.

Sound quality is a little dull but can be compensated for using the windows equalizer. Only first in one direction, and the headband could really use some padding at the top to prevent soreness over long periods. That said, it met my expectations for a cheap pair of headphones for the office. Adding a volume switch to the cord would rate it another star.
These headphones are most excellent! I had my previous pair for 5 years before they started to deteriorate, so I bought these updated ones, and am completely satisfied with their quality!

Bought these for my kids to use on their iPads. Can't beat the price and they work perfectly, no complaints. Good quality and I am not worried about them breaking or getting lost because they are so cheap. Would buy again. Perfect for small children on their electronic devices. Standard headphones, nothing fancy, no bells and whistles, just what we were looking for.

I have several sets of the MDRZX100 phones, but wanted one with a mic for my cell because I do a lot of conference calls. These sound every bit as good as the zx100s and fit my pumpkin head nicely. Happy Customer. I dont need 250.00 headphones to leave in the car or out where the small grandkids can get them. THese work and I believe will work fine for all but the most discerning (or Brand-conscious) user. Studio quality sound? No. Perfectly listenable sound for most people? Yes.

The cord is way too short. I can't sit at my desk and have it plugged in to my tower and type without it pulling out of the jack. Additionally, it needs padding under the top of the headband (or whatever that part is called). I had a headache within moments of wear and I don't have a large head! That said, the sound was fine. I didn't want to mess with getting an extension cord, so these are going back.
Audio quality wasn't as good as the previous Sony headphones I used which I misplaced. Good enough for the kids.

I am a professional video guy. I use these for hand- held shooting and/or situations where my $140 Sony headphones might get damaged or lost. These phones sound great and have the perfect cord for camera use. They fold up and slam into the camera bag no problem.

very good headset. good price too. I did a lot of research online about headset. I did not want to pay $200 for a noise cancellation headset from other brands. This one works really good and has good sound quality. It is small than my whole ears, so it is not a studio type headset. This would be a very good travel headset for me because it folds very well. I wish it had included a protective casing which it does not. If Sony could include a protective box for no additional cost, this product would really rock!

Just got these and plugged them into my phone right away. Mad impressed. I’m a music recording and mix engineer so I’m picky about my sound. These headphones are loud but still keep a solid frequency response. Crisp treble and bass heavy (not too heavy, it’s juuuust below perfect). I’m going to be using them at the gym so style and fit were important, they look great and fit really nice and snug. Overall fantastic headlines.
I use these for guitar practice. They sound great and I don't think they are distorting the sound with any bass bias. Love the price.
Arrived as described and quickly! I ordered two pairs for my sons to use at school. They fit perfect and the quality is great. Great deal for the price.

Perfect! Bought for a special needs child is rough on anything with a cable connected to it. He goes through headphones life face wipes. These hold up great and they don't get too loud. Normally headphones last him a few weeks. This model lasted a year. Saw them here and got them for better price than the local store has them for.

I purchased these for my child who really enjoys using them. My children don't really like to use earbuds since they don't really fit a child's ear. Although these are bigger than earbuds, they work a lot better for this purpose. When our kids were younger we used to listen to audiobooks on long road trips and the content of the audiobooks wasn't always the most appropriate for children. These would be great at blocking up the "grown up" material while the kids watch movies or listen to music or their own audiobooks on their tablets.

I bought these to wear at work and I liked that they were smaller "profile". I work in an office, so I can't wear big, imposing headphones since people expect me to be available when they stop by. I have a small head and these fit comfortably on my ears and across my head where the plastic band sits. Most importantly, they have good sound quality.
I noticed the material on the ear pads looks as if they'll tear easily. I hope these hold up for at least a few years. I would suggest that you don't have earrings in when you wear them.

They have great sound quality for the price and are decently comfortable but they broke after 6 months.

Edit: I replaced them with a pair of MDRZX310's I got on sale for $14 (so actually a bit less than these 110's are atm) the price as of now has gone up to $22. I would very highly recommend spending a little more to get them. The build quality feels much better, they're more comfortable, and there's a noticeable improvement in audio quality. If for whatever reason you're stuck in the $15 range I'd recommend the Amazon Basics headphones for $14.99. The audio quality is identical to these 110's but they're noticeably more comfortable and have a superior build quality.
had an older model but stepped in them. good sound and durability, definitely worth the money I have another pair as a back up but don't see needing them any time soon. Good sound!
Comfortable and light, just as good as more expensive headphones. They are durable. I bought a set for my son and he likes them very much.
I find these give me clear sounding music and audio books on my iPhone. But after an hour or two I find these headphones are applying a bit to much pressure to my ears for comfort. YMMV.

These come in perfect. Especially when you want to play your music and other's are sleeping and don't want to hear your type of music. Great to have if you're not near a radio to play music. 30 hours of playing time.
Nothing super special about them but they work perfectly fine. They meet my expectations, so what more can you truly ask for. Haven't had any issues so I'm happy about this buy

Younger enthusiasts have no idea how fortunate they are to be able to enjoy true high fidelity stereophonic sound at such a low price. Back in 1980 my favorite phones were a pair of Koss that were so heavy on my head I referred to it as a boat anchor. They sounded great...but set me back $50...(That's 1980 dollars..two days wages for many back then) But they didn't sound any better than these light and comfy Sony's...and less than 20 bucks which is..what.. $5 in 1980??

I ordered these for my son's iPad mini which has a lifeproof cover. The piece is too short and doesn't stay in the earphone jack. It is loose and falls right out. So it doesn't work for us. Waste of money.
My son uses these with his ipad. The work well and fold up for easy portability. Wish they had a volume control on the chord.

Oh goodness if these aren't my most used item. I bought these without much thought. I needed a pair. But I love these. They are comfortable and durable and they stand up to my devil make care way of life. Tough little guys, I'm not easy on my things at all.
It will work in a pinch. Not a Bose. Not a Sennheiser. They are comfortable and does NOT squeeze the head like a vice grip after ten minutes. Low volume.
I love the sound quality and its lightness. It is also glasses-friendly: wearing them with glasses do not hurt my ears.

These are great sound for the price. They're stylish and have a clear sound. The reason I gave it 4 and not 5 is because they hurt my ears after a few hours. It's not a huge deal. I still recommend these

my all time favorite pair of headphones!! these work like a charm! just the right amount of bass, treble, middle-tone, and comfort most othes only claim, and this is a SONY! these even fold-in nicely on themselves after use. just right for my panasonic SA-AKK-330 stereo-system. which still works just great!

Not sure why people are whining about the sound quality.... I think they sound good. Are they $200 BOSE headphones, of course not, and that's why they don't sound like them. Excellent for the money.

My only complaint is they are fairly quiet with my Galaxy Note, I don't have a volume issue with any other headphones

These are nice headphones for the price. They sound good have quality lows and highs; not boomy or tinny. I recommend these against anything in their price range. I have three other sets of headphones that cost a lot more from other manufacturers that sound terrible compared to these.

I was a little disappointed with the construction. I am sure they will last for years. I have an older pair of Sony MDR-V202 these are replacing. The older set sounds a little better, but not much difference. The new construction has no cushion on the head piece and the ear pieces are hollow. The cushion doesn't matter much unless you're bald like me, but the ear pieces give a hollow clank noise if they or the wire is bumped against something.

These headphones are amazing for their price. Super stoked. Would buy again! I'm a musician and avid music listener, I bought these for around the house listening and potential gym going.

Update, 11-6-16: The cord is short as hell. Just FYI.
They are ok, not wonderful, but just ok. Sound is acceptable, and they are somehow comfortable, besides they are a little too warm.
These offer excellent sound quality for headphones that cost so little. I was extremely impressed.
These headphones seem to sound ok for the price. The cord is somewhat short, so whatever you plug it into cannot be too far away.

I didn't realise the ears fold in. That's not a major issue, however.

What IS an issue as that there seems to be a problem in the cord or jack. Many times, I can only hear it out of one side. Not what I expected from Sony brand.

I'm just going to go back to my Grumpy Cat earphones

Excellent sound, noise canceling and easy to fold. Product came with perfect features just like the descriptions. I recommend it for everyone looking to use a mine headphones everyday. I use it everyday to ride the NYC train and from work. Simply the best Sony products. Thank you amazon prime👌😎!

Yes! Finally I can watch my Amazon Prime shows in bed. The sound quality is amazing and they are very comfortable on my ears! I am not an ear bud person unless I have to use them at the gym...so these are right up my alley!

This is exactly what I've been looking for. These headphones are light and comfortable with good sound quality. I can wear them for hours with no discomfort at all. They don't squeeze my head, make my ears sweat or do any of those unpleasant things other headphones have done. My only complaint is that people can't hear me very well through the microphone. I find I have to quickly pull the headphones out if someone calls me while I'm listening.

FYI The cable is about 3 feet long.

But as I bought these primary to listen to music I'm only taking one star off.

This review is based on my first impressions with the "110's" on a number of mp3 player, and a number of "100's" (the previous model https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004WODP20/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1 ) that I have had and used over the years.

Pro - Sound Quality
So far I DO notice more bass in these new (my first pair of the "110's") pair of headphones and unlike prior experience with Sony (and other companies too ...) earbuds where the "new great model" .. didn't sound as good as the prior ones did ...

These 110's just add enough to the bass and possibly treble too, that makes it definitely sound better then the 100's though it doesn't fall into the trap I described above, when sometimes they add "more bass" and it turns out the bass is so strong, that it drowns everything else out. I have to say that this is not really a knock on the 100's .. I do still like them but for the same price on either ... I'd go with the 110's but if there is a "good deal" on the 100's and I was getting them again ... I am not against getting another pair of the 100's either.

Yes these are "cheap" headphones and probably not as good quality wise as a really expensive pair though I do recall some reviews saying they tried these along side a pair of "$200 Beats" and while the did say their friend's Beats did sound better ... they personally would rather get maybe two or three pair of these and still have say $150 left over ... meaning "they do not sound price-vs-quality of the sound" .. 'that much better'

Pro/Con - Build quality
These ARE plastic headphones of course, though I do not agree with those that say "oh its like they are from the Dollar store ... the plastic is horrible ..etc etc"... just if your going to buy a much more expensive pair of headphones ... your will probably get better quality too

The one downside that ... I admit I see in these, and are a problem in the pair of "the 100's" that was 100% caused by me ... AND EVEN THEN that exact pair, needed fixing but still sounds great ... I am using THEM while typing this review, is the part where the 100's and the 110's ear-cups move. I am not sure "how it could be made better" but that was the exact point of failure for my long-used pair (again 100% my fault for HOW the break,happened) .. note that if it wasn't for me they would still be fine and that is after 3+ years of HEAVY use and they still work ... so maybe it's fine for being able to fold (in both models I mean)

Pro - Fit
I am not sure if i can say one way or the other "I have a big head" (100% not a small head) but they fit fine .. even out of the box. Heck after that DIY type of repair I did on my broke pair .. .I had to flip them backwards and .. they for the most part still fit great ... these 110's are no different.

By the way I have glasses (regular and sunglasses used when wearing these) and just like the 100's, these are nice and comfy ... not too tight or too lose, if you ask me

??? - The cord
The cord looks different from the 100's I have and I like the cord ... basically I think some of the cords on others are way way too small and that always leads to the problem of one of the two sides going out for good ... The cord on the 110's looks a tad smaller diameter wise but really if that doesn't mean that issue I just described DOESN'T happen .. I do not really care... I just want the headphones to work for a long time ... if the cord is different but there are no issues ... this change is fine by me.

Plug - I will keep this review updated IF there is a change but I have no had these for long enough to comment on some of the reviews who keep having issues with the plug breaking ... NOT on this pair but my other pair of the 100's get plugged into and unplugged from stuff for over three years now and often too ... never had a problem .. but then again I cant comment on these. for now.

Summary

I would recommend these no question ... though if your expecting a super high end sound (aka are an "audiophile") you MAY BE disappointed though as someone who loves his music ... I think the sound with the right equalizer settings, on the device or program your using... I do LOVE the sound of these.

Update - After using a new pair of the "100's" ... aka the prior model

Really ... the 110's do have the slightly higher bass and that is not a bad thing either .... the new pair of the 100's I am using I actually thought were the 110's (I just forgot what headphones I was using)... THE POINT? ... they both have great bass and I think the pair that I use to wear daily (the broken pair that still works great.... just doesn't fit perfectly anymore)'s fit actually effects the bass ... that old pair I hold the earcups closer to my ears than how they "sit" now .. .and I hear alot more bass.

Between the 100s and 110's ... if the way each one of them fold doesn't matter to you for say fitting them into a caring case .... I recommend both 1000% (no typo) ... find the best deal ... if you can get one a little cheaper than the other ...cool ... there is more bass by a little bit on the 110's but do not think I am saying a new pair of the 100's are weak in that department.

My old headset has been around a while, and maybe that's what makes these feel "off." The fit is a bit on the snug side (which seems common with many headsets). The sound also seemed a bit "heavy." Maybe it's just me. After lowering the volume control a little, the sound quality improved, so perhaps I just grew accustomed to the old headset I've been using. Overall, for the price, the quality is very good. Headset cord could have been longer. I use these for gaming, so I really need to watch if I want to get up to reach for something as I don't have several feet of excess cord to work with.

* UPDATE *

Had to drop my rating to two stars. Nice headphones, but my pair had the left speaker start to fail not even a month after they arrived, and they didn't see much use. I expect better quality from Sony. :-(

The sound quality is GOOD. The product quality is GOOD. My issue is more personal and might not be an issue for you but I find that these hurt my ears. They don't squeeze 'hard' but apparently my ears are just sensitive to ANY pressure on them. I wish I had gone for the "over the ears" version instead of the "on the ear" style these represent. If your ears aren't sensitive, the build quality and sound quality is very good and you should buy them. If your ears don't like 'pressure' on them, get the OVER the ear or IN the ear versions.

I own several pairs of headphones and a pair of ear buds for travel. I spent a good amount of money on my travelling ear buds because I use them a lot, and I want them to sound good. For my home headphones, though, I really don't want much. I just want something that sounds clear at a low volume and will last.

None of the other pairs of headphones I have owned have lasted. They'd develop a short in the wiring somewhere, and the sound would be horrible. So far, these things have outshined any of the other "cheap" headphones I have purchased. In fact, for the price point that these things have, I would venture to use the word "amazing" to describe them, much to the chagrin of Louis CK.

These do not sound as good as my travel ear buds, but I paid five times as much for those. For $20, though, this is as good as it gets for headphones.

I needed these for work. No microphone, just wired headphones. I was gonna get the Amazon Basics one but they were the same price so I opted with Sony. I see lots of people with these for music. I don't use them for music, primarily so I can't say too much about sound quality although I'm confident they're fine for the average user. Good design, foldable, comfortable, and adjustable. No complaints.

This is a good set of headphones to throw around and not worry too much if I break it given its cost. The plastic headband started to weaken and spread quite a lot only after a few weeks of light use, but again, given the cost I am not too worried if I break it - but I'm knocking a star off for it. I wouldn't buy another one pair if the band breaks because I don't have a large head and the band stretching this much shouldn't happen for an average sided noggin. The stretched band also results in a looser fit which means a reduced seal with the ear that lets in ambient noise. The ear pads are comfortable despite sitting on the ears for hours some days - maybe that's due to the spread headband. The set is pretty light. The cord is on the longish side if you just use this with your cell phone.

The lows frequencies are almost nonexistent. There's just enough to let you know there's a drummer pounding the bass, but it's definitely nothing overpowering and not punchy or boomy - it's just barely there. The mids are recessed and slightly veiled and the highs are just meh - I don't think there's much reach on the high end. But really, this is nitpicking because these sound so much better than a $200 seat of Beats and an outstanding value at $15 which is what I paid for mine. I think these go as low as $10 on occasion. For the cost of a set of winter ear muffs, I have a decent set of headphones that play music well enough for mass transit commuting - and also keeps my ears warm ;)

My better set is Audio Technica's ATH-A900x which are probably on low end of the high end, but those are too unwieldy to take outside imho. So comparing these two headphones, I can easily say the set of Sony's has great price to performance ratio.

Why are headphones $300? I understand that certain people are discerning, but I suspect that i's just a status symbol. Especially after hearing the clear and rich quality of these headphones. I've always trusted Sony as a brand and they have yet to let me down. These headphones are comfortable, have a great high end and a nice (not overly thumping) bass. Why would I pay more? I was a little skeptical about the folding design, but in practice, the natural shape of the head stops them from folding accidentally.

Part of the reason I am giving these headphones a five-star rating is the incredible price I got them for on amazon - $10! For just $10, these are excellent headphones! I picked up a couple pairs so that my kids can use them in the van on long car rides when they want to watch a movie on the portable DVD player. We used them over our Christmas holiday travels, and my wife has been taking them to the gym with her, too, for use with the treadmill monitor. (We both despise earbuds and consider them one of the worst inventions of the century!)

Hopefully, these will last a lot longer than the no-name discount headphones my wife purchased at the local drugstore last year. Those were more expensive than these and we had problems with those after only six months of use. Both of those have gone into the garbage can and have been replace with these Sony headphones. Definitely an upgrade!

I got these to replace Sony MDREX86LP in-ear earbuds, which I had for 5+ years and still sounded good, but I now found myself needing something that was not inside my ear. I need headphones that have great sound across my very eclectic music collection-- mainly classical, opera and classic rock, but occasionally some jazz, country or pop-- and are comfortable, because I listen all day while I am working. Price was also a significant consideration-- I can no longer see my way clear to paying $50+ for a set of headphones. These deliver on all accounts! The sound is rich, vocals and instruments come across very clearly and distinctly, and bass response is excellent without being overly "thumpy". The pads are comfortable on my ears for all-day listening, and these are also very lightweight. The appearance is basic, classic, and not at all flashy, so they can pass for a professional appearance at work. The cord is thick and sturdy, and the size is widely adjustable. The folding feature is neat, but these stay at the office all the time so not that important for me. I can see it being convenient for traveling. All in all, I would buy these again and again if I were to lose them or break them, and I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for an excellent set of headphones at a very decent price.

Plastic is a little cheap feeling and I could see it easily breaking within a short while. But at this price range it is expected. These have nice cushy ear pads that rest ON-EAR. They also have a mic and can work with Iphone/Android for calls. All and all a nice pair of cans for a lil over $20

These headphones for the price and size are very impressive. I am very particular about the sound of headphones, and the overall range they provide, and these are awesome, for the size and weight. They fold nicely to fit in a pack or bag and don't hurt your head after hours of use.

I have a few expensive pairs of headphones but I came back to these because they are the most comfortable. The other brands are heavier and the ear pieces make my ears hot. The sound quality is excellent. If you do not need heavy bass from your headphones these are well worth a try.

First of all i want to say I made my purchase of these headphones on the 11th of March and I recived them on the 16th of March. Im Kind of upset about this because I payed for priority shipping. Now about the quality of sound for me though For some reson I put the volume on my celphone on full and yet it sounds like its only on medium or low low medium if that makes sense. But u get what u pay for. All in all they are very confortable I can see me using these at home all the time. Not when I go out because they take up space and are not as easy to just pop in your purse never mind a pocket as earbuds are of course. I do recomend them thought if u dont mind that the volume isnt as loud. Then again guess thats a good thing and your eardrums will thank you.

OK for a computer but don't waste your dough for music. If you want a GREAT inexpensive set for music that gives you sounds you never heard, buy a set of SONY RP-HTF600 SONY headphones for $26. They are OUTSTANDING and better than the $300 with a guys name on them brand!
I gave it two stars not for sound quality but for the exoanding. They do not welk at all and hurt my ears.

Got these for my husband, who is bedridden and spends a lot of time on his Kindle. He completely gets lost into what he's doing with these on. Think you can hear outside of the headphones if you want to, but he doesn't, so they more or less cancel any outside noise if you want them too.

As far as sound goes these were great, they did a pretty decent job canceling out noise on the airplane. I returned them because they didn't stay over my ears/were a bit uncomfortable. They're a good value for the money but I would rather have ones that cover my ears rather than sit on top uncomfortably.

Got these for my Fiance, he is a musician so quality sound is very important to him. He didn't like the Bose that we tried and HATES those Beats by Dre headphones but he loves how these sounds, and when I told him how much they cost compared to those he almost fell out of his chair. I guess I found his new set for the future.
These are the best headphones on the market for the price. I am replacing an old set that I wore the earmuffs out on.

Headphones work pretty nicely. I paid a very low amount for the headphones that I got. My only complaint is how cheap they feel. I'd suggest paying a little more and getting better quality but if you're trying to low-dough it or just needing a pair of headphones, get these.

I purchased these for my ten year old daughter, who has a tendency to drop, toss and/or leave electronics in dangers way. Many reviews said these are terrible, I highly disagree. I have listened to a variety of music using the headphones, including classical instrumentals, they have a great sound considering the inexpensive cost. A lot of bang for your buck.

These headphones are comfortable, adjustable and sound great. The cable doesn't tangle easily and is thick enough that I don't have to worry about my cats chewing through it. However, I wish there was a way to make it fit more tightly, as it is very apparent that they could sound even better if not for the relaxed fit.

Decent headphones. Nice to talk on the phone with. Problem is when you have the headphones off your ears and resting them around your neck, you cant turn you head very well. It's uncomfortable and annoying to have them around your neck. The collapsible feature is pointless. They should have used the resources to allow the headphones to lay flat when they are resting around your neck.
Great basic headphones. Great Mic as well for using on phone calls. Soft on the ears.
Bought these for my daughter to replace the Sony headphones that broke on her previously. These headphones were great at first but now they have a short in the left ear and you hear nothing.

I ordered this set for myself and my daughter borrowed them and begged to keep them. I ordered another pair and my son took them over. Guess it's time to order me another set! They are affordable and the sound quality is excellent. I use them to watch a movie or listen to music on my Kindle.

Sent 1st one I received back bc when the jack swiveled it created a lot of static. The replacement was much better but still had a little static with significant swiveling but kept it. Good sound quality and plenty of bass. Reasonably comfortable. Great for the price.

These headphones are high quality. I was looking for new headphones when I found these. The sound quality is excellent. I rarely have my volume turned up more than half way. They cancel out outside noise pretty well. They are very sturdy and the foam pieces are very comfortable on the ears. The mic picks up great. I use these for Skype all the time and people never have problem hearing me. These are some of the best and cheapest head phones I have gotten. I love these!
Sound quality is good but not great, they don't get very loud. i had been using the 20 dollar sony headphones and they are much better at a similar price point.

Inexpensive, yet excellent sound. Because the price was so low, I wasn't sure how the quality would be. I'll never buy another expensive set of headphones unless I have to. These are great, but I would prefer a bit more ear coverage.
Great headphones to replace an older version of the same. The sound is nice for the price and since this is my second pair, I'd obviously recommend.

The sound quality of these headphones is pretty good. However, I found them to be intolerable to use in noisy environments. Of course, they are not considered to be noise isolating headphones. However, their acoustics seem to magnify environmental sounds. I used them on the bus, and road noise sounded worse with them on my ears than it did when I removed them entirely. I returned them for a refund.
Thank you! These are perfect! The sound quality is amazing. I feel like I'm at a concert wearing these XD

I have an average size head and these fit well. I use them for an hour or two after everyone else in the house has gone to sleep. And for the hour or two of use they are comfortable. After a couple hours they start to press against my temples. Did I mention that I wear eyeglasses? Anyway, these seem like they may work for train travel, which is what I got them for. The great thing about train travel is that you don't need noise cancellation like you need on a stinking old aeroplane. If you need a reasonably priced set of headphones for home or train, get these.

Great headphones for a youth! I ordered these for my little brother and he loves them! They have good sound, are light, can take a lot of damage. If you want some durable headphones for a preteen/young child, these are good. Otherwise if you just want a good cheap pair of headphones, these are for you.
typical sony quality.

It is one of the better cheaper headphones available. Might be ideal for travelling as it folds flat. Clamping force is about on par with a sony MDR-V6. I honestly wished it sounded like my V6 though. It seems to emphasize the midrange over the other frequencies. The price point however makes it easier to overlook its deficiencies. The cord is a bit thicker than the cords available on competitors products. Overall a good product for the price.
We love this headphone for our kids!! So durable for them!! We have them in Black now and had White ones..

They sound slightly dark. Overall they are timbrically correct and articulated. Worth every penny. I usually listen with AKG 701, Sony MDR D77 and Beyerdynamic DT990 pro. These little Sony hold their own.
These are really a good value! I had to replace these for someone else and for the price it was great
Use these every night while my husband is asleep to watch YouTube videos and not disturb him. Comfortable, fairly lightweight given their bulky look, can't complain.
Good price and good product. I got these for a gift and they were great. Good sound and easy to set up. Just plug in and use. No problems at all. I would buy from this seller again.

The sound quality is good for cheap headphones it is rather impressive, less impressed that the jack broke off inside my phone in my pocket after a few weeks, I had a pair of these for over 3 years so not sure if I did something particularly strenuous or if it was the quality of the headphones but either way if you are looking for cheap headphones go for it but be careful not very rugged.
These headphones are my absolute go-to! They're very good quality and extremely durable for their price.

These headphones work well and the sound quality is great. They have decent bass as well. They aren't nose canceling, and while they are comfortable at first, they get uncomfortable after an hour or so. They don't usually leave my desk at work, so I haven't been rough on them, but they seem reasonably sturdy for the price. Good buy.
Good headphone at this price. I use it in m bedroom so no worries about noise. It is adjustable so I can use it for a long time.

I bought two pairs of these for Christmas 2014 gifts...one for my mother-in-law and one for my husband. They are both extremely pleased with this product. My husband can't stand using ear buds but loves his new headphones! They have terrific sound quality and are tangle resistant. A great product at a very reasonable price.

Purchased these for my son as a Christmas gift, but his others died, so he got them early. He says that they're better than his old ones (same make, different model), so I am very happy with this purchase :-)

Great sound and comfortable for inexpensive headphones. I had a previous pair for at least 4 years and accidentally turned the ear piece the wrong way in the dark and it broke off. These should last a long time.
Excellent value. Work well and don't have to panic if you can't find them at this price!
Superb sound coming from my small CD player using these phones. Thanks!

These fit weird. They seem like they should be over the ear headphones, but they aren't quite. They are not the most comfortable headphones in the world. As a matter of fact, I would say that Amazon Basics ones I bought are much more comfortable.

Having said that, the sound quality is excellent. Good bass, true sound without static.
My husband love his head phones for his computer. Great price and works great.

Bought these as "fill-in" Xmas gifts for my 12 and 8 year old sons to use on their tablets and the home PC. Sound great, look slick and fold up to fit better in their backpacks. At 10 bucks a pop... Money well spent! And Amazon shipping continues to amaze. I ordered on 12/22 at about 8pm, selected free 5-8 day shipping knowing they'd be here after Xmas, delivered to my door at 2pm 12/24. This is why I only buy TP and detergent at walmart. Bravo Amazon!

The Sony MDR-ZX110 stereo headphones are well worth the money: bottom line – these are nearly a match for more expensive headphones. Sony advertises a frequency range of 12-22,000 hz but does not quantify it. I made my own measurements, with an accuracy of +/- 0.5 db from 15 hz to 18,000 hz, that show these headphones provide nearly flat response, within +/- 2 db from 30 hz to 11,000 hz. Many expensive headphones do not perform as well, although their build quality and listening comfort may be better.
Evaluations are usually subjective and each person has his own hearing response function and preferences. Since I am an engineer, I like to see data. There are a number of frequency response graphs made by Headroom that you can find for reference. I have a studio-quality Sony MDR-V6 and found a chart for it by Headroom. I made my own measurements and got very good agreement with Headroom’s results, +/- 1 db. The V6 has nearly flat response, mostly within +/- 2 db from 15 hz to 11,000 hz. Sony advertises a frequency range of 5-30,000 hz. The Headroom graph also shows a sharp dip around 6000 hz. I see the dip at loud signal levels above 100 db but it nearly goes away at comfortable listening levels of 80 db or less. The Sony MDR-ZX110 has a very similar frequency response to the V6 at comfortable listening levels, but develops enhanced bass and high frequency dips and spikes at loud listening levels. At comfortable listening levels there is little difference between the two headphones. In the 25+ years since the V6 was introduced there have been a number of improvements in headphones so that an inexpensive model like the ZX110 can produce nearly comparable results.

Use these on BART and they don't really block sound out very well. I know they're not advertised as noise isolation, but it's almost as if they should really be advertised as Open back headphones since so much ambient noise is allowed to bleed through. Also the extra bass isn't at all noticeable, the mic quality is on par with the included in ear headphones that came with my Galaxy S3, which weren't very good to begin with.

For the price you can't beat these headsets. They fit nice and don't feel heavy or make my ears hurt. Sound quality is good and I like the way they fold up so they don't bump out of by computer case and run the risk of smashing them. If your looking for a good headset at a fair price you won't go wrong with these. The seller delivered earlier than expected and the packaging was very good. Would buy from them again no problem. Very Satisfied.
Loud them since the first gen . Cheap great sound no so much volumen.

Bought it for my father and he loves them. He is a big fan of Sony and their headphones. He says that both the quality and the price is great and that he doesn't know any better headphones when it comes to this 2 things.

Amazing, Amazing. Indeed it is, and I'm not referring to its price...only. Its light, gently on the ear, and enjoyable is the sound it generates. Its performance is encouraging, and its difficult not to neglect other things listening to this headphone. Another is being purchased to ensure consistency with this inexpensive, but delightfully enjoyed headphones. Its worth it....get two.

Great for the price. I paid $8.55 including shipping. They sound amazing. Wish the lightning deal allowed more than one purchase.
Sure they have no padding on top, but they are still worth much more than I paid and I think all reviews need to take price into consideration so these are easily 5 stars.

Naturally, they won't compare to a $60 or more pair, but for the price point I've never heard a better set of headphones. Design-wise they're a little small and plastic-y (as one would expect for the money) but the overall audio fidelity can't be beat for the price point.

I just wanted a pair of headphones for the occasional plane flight, because I hate sticking ear buds in my ears. I wasn't into spending $200 on a pair of fancy headphones. I didn't expect much from these, but I was pleasantly surprised. They aren't noise canceling, but they are comfortable, fold up for packing, and do the job. WAY better than ear buds.

These arrived quickly, they fit OK, but they only worked about 10-14 hrs and then stopped for not obvious reason. Amazon as always made right. Not sure what happened with them since the reviews are reasonable I assume I just got a bad pair.
nice!

No real complaints but I guess I was looking for something a bit different. I have in the ear headphones for when I work out and see many folks with over the ear headphones doing the same. The sound quality of the Sony phones is just fine but I was unable that I would be able to hear so much outside noise. Guess I should have tried a pair before I bought them. I now use them when I am on my computer and they work just fine....much less noise in those surroundings. I guess I could give them 4 stars but I am deducting a star for my own stupidity for not checking them out better before I bought!

Feels comfortable but the cord is very short! Use this if the audio port is close, like in a laptop, but not when the desktop is under your table, etc. Should have read the specifics. Cord is about 3/4 meter or 30 inches long (or short). Decent sound by the way.

The ear pieces never sit quite flat on my (large) head. My daughter has the same issue, despite having a smaller head.
The sound is good, but not exceptional. After a month of regular use, I have noticed no problems with reliability.

Decent value for the price.

Just got these today. They sound fantastic. Way better than a similar, more expensive pair of sony headphones that I got a few years ago at Target. unbelievable price. Would be nice if they came with an adapter for 1/4 inch jack, but then they would have to charge more.

Like others have said, the fact that these are less than $20 is fantastic. It's not the best sound quality i've ever had, but I was just looking for over the ear headphones for work when i need to be recording calls from another in-ear microphone. These fit the bill well, have a microphone on the line and are comfortable. They don't completely cover the ears like some headphones do but they work quite well. They don't come with a case, which is a shame, but not the worst thing in the world. I also like that the chords don't get all tangled like iphone headphones do.
Pleasantly surprised, especially at this price point (paid 13).

Sounds quality is A Ok for less than $20. Been using it for at least 3 mos 3x a week but the right cups doesn't work anymore. Suddenly, just stop working while i was listening to my music... I chech all possible scenario but it just gave up..

They work ok for the price.. I thought they would be bigger and cover my whole ear, but they just go on top of your ear.. I would try the Amazon brand before these next time.. But they are ok for budget headphones and fold up nicely to hang on the wall.
My 14 year old grandson was born with autism. He loves the computer but we had to remind him to turn the volume down. With the headphones we no longer have to be at him to turn it down. We love them.
Great affordable headphones used on the plane. Would advise.

I bought these during a flash sale for $7.99. I mainly use them for listening to music on my phone and for late night gaming on a PS4 when I don't want to wake up the wife and kids.

These are a sturdy pair of headphones. Most headphones under $20 are flimsy and cheap feeling but these are very solid. I wish there was a head pad though since the plastic is a little too hard for me.

The sound quality is great for the price point. These are perfect for basic every day use. Initially I thought the sound quality was poor but it was caused by me being used to the in ear buds I've been using. Once I was accustomed to the new headphones the sound was great. Although, one thing I don't like is that these headphones are quiet. On my phone, I have to turn the volume up almost to the max. This just might be my personal preference though since I like to tune out all outside noise when listening to music.

These are not a high end pair of Bose or Beats so don't expect perfect quality. These are a great pair of solid headphones that are more than adequate for every day use. As long as you keep expectations realistic you'll thoroughly enjoy these headphones.

I bought these primarily for my new smartphone (LG tracfone). The music quality is good and they are comfortable and quite adjustable. My complaint is with the control button. The instructions suggest the Smart Key app. The app is configurable for 1, 2 and 3 presses. For example, press once for Pause, twice for skip to next track, three times for previous track. No matter how many times I press it it only does start/pause. In addition if I am playing iHeart radio it will jump to Google Play. I have not tried the control using the phone yet.
Heavy on the low frequencies with the result that mods and highs are lost. Ok if you are listening to YouTube music because the quality of the source is usually awful.
These headphones are awesome for the price. I have bought 3 sets because I leave them in hotels or my kids step on them. At the low price, it's not a big deal to replace them.

These are pretty good headphones for what they are. If you're looking for a pair of low priced, decent quality headphones, then get these. I was pretty surprised at how nice the sound played through these. I just got them today, and the first thing i noticed when i put them on was how comfortable they were. They have a nice, tight fit, and they cover both your years completely. They also do a nice job drowning out back ground noise. I was listening to music at a pretty soft volume, and i could barley hear my sister calling my name from right outside the door. They also fold in, so they're nice and portable. They are definetley not a disappointment. After all, they are made by sony, so you can't go wrong with them.
Just what i was looking for ..Great price and fast shipping
Bought these over a year ago and still use them every single day. Comfy, great sound and I've dropped them quite often. Durable and well worth the price.

I have used Sony over-ear headphones for many years because they are an unbelievable value. I'm pleased to say the tradition continues. These sound great and are comfortable. I bought a few pairs for the kids to use at school and plan on buying a few more for around the house.

These Sony MDRZX110AP ZX Series Extra Bass Smartphone headphones are fantastic when it comes to the great sound coming out of them. I wasn't to sure what I was going to get from them. The name Sony stands for quality and so you expect to pay a higher price for them and that was ok. But these headphones were not expensive at all. These headphones are everything you'd expect from a well-known company that everybody has owned some electronic product with their name on it........... S O N Y!!
these are wonderfully comfortable for a person like myself who watches tv all night next to a normal sleeping person. I really think they are GREAT!
Good headphones for the price. I use them for audiobooks so I can't address their suitability for music. I can wear them for hours at a time with no discomfort. I would buy again.
Very pleased! Sound is great! Very comfortable and nice looking! Folding makes it easy for storage and worth the price!
The sound is great but only as long as the outside isn't super loud. It will hurt your ears after a few hours but overall it fits snug!
It's okay, but not great. However, it does serve the purpose while exercising.
Good headphones for the price, bought these as an extra set, I've used them with my iPad, iPod and MP3, they're comfortable and have adaquate sound.
Works great when I have conference calls on my cell phone.

Keeping in mind that these headphones are less than $20, they are very good. I wear them when on my computer so that I don't bother the family. They are on ear headphones, but still reduce outside noise to the point where I can't hear my wife in the next room (oops...). I am not an audiophile, but the quality is good enough for me. For the price, I think they are one of the best pairs on the market.
The headphone set works great... except that the voice could be a little bit more crisp/clear.

These headphones provide both comfort and high quality sound. They are easy to adjust and very comfortable to wear for long periods of time. The sound quality is clear and consistent. They conveniently fold-up for storage and the cords are sturdier than average headphone cords and don't kink.

These headphones are really comfy on my ears. And I wear a lot of stud earrings so that's pretty important to me :) Also, the inline play/pause button is always crucial to me so I don't have to dig out my phone and have somebody repeat what they just said to me. I like that they fold too. I've never used the mic feature so I can't really say yay or nay about it but overall I'm happy with this purchase.

I bought these for my son as a present last Christmas. They have good sound and very comfortable to wear. He'd been wearing these all the time until I gave him a set Bluetooth headphones recently. These Sony headphones still work great as his backup.
Awesome product. I will order more. When you use the earphones all noise is block out.
These headphones are great. Highly recommend. Comfortable fit. Great sound. Quality all around.

Great headphones to quiet the kids in the car. Bought some sets for a long car ride while on vacation and the kids never complained about them hurting and they sounded good. I wish it was a single wire model but for the price these are great.
Not bad headphones, but very low noise isolation from surround. When I put it on I hear what's going on around me without any attenuation.

Just ok.
They're far too tight on my head, and I can't even bend them much to loosen the vice-like grip. Also they cut out even if I only move my head a tiny bit. I'm guessing the connections are very weak.

Someday when I can afford it, I'll buy some nice headphones to help block noise at work.
Great headphones. Works with all my gear. Great sound, Great price. As expected from Amazon and Sony.
My kids love these headphones! They are inexpensive but fairly durable. They are comfortable on the head and ears.
Great at containing the noise so others aren't disturbed by it. Decent sound, too. I've heard $300 sound systems with less clarity for frequencies made by electric guitars.

Bought these for my husband; he loves them. He says they fit well, are comfortable, and have a great sound. We usually sit on the loveseat together; and, if he uses them on his laptop, I cannot hear a thing. So, they are apparently well insulated.

These headphones are great. The bass is clean with a stereo sound you will enjoy. The music comes alive with every beat from the drums, every strum from the guitar and every note from the wind instruments. Light and easy on the head and ears, you will love these as much as I do! I recommend these not only for the quality but the price is easy on the pocket.

My first pair of these headphones survived over 2.5 years of heavy use without any problems. In contrast, I have had similar cheap headphones break in under a year. These sound good enough for casual use and are quite comfortable to wear, even with glasses. Given the price, I am quite happy with these.

I really like these headphone. I got these along with a long cord extension to watch tv at night in the bedroom without disturbing my wife. I used wireless for quite a while but found the short battery life starting to become annoying. The sound quality of these headphone is great! I have no qualms about recommending them.

I'm extremely happy with them. Very well balanced, and the most comfortable over-ear headphones I've ever had. I feel like this was a STEAL.

The microphone works very well, no one can tell I'm not on my phone. The Smartkey App was not impressive, but I don't really care.

Wow! I have headphones from several top makes, Grado, Ultrasone, and the Sony MR-1. They all retail 10-15 times this set but the difference in sound is much closer. They are crisp, punchy and refreshing. Almost can’t tell you are wearing them. The mic works fine too. I use them with my iPad and PS4. Don’t hesitate, you won’t be disappointed.

These headphones are the best I have ever bought. I'm not a big fan of earbuds, so I am constantly looking for good Headphones to get. These have been amazing! For the price, you get what you want and so much more. They are so durable as well, I've had them for 2 years and they are still rocking!
I love Sony and its quality products. I totally recommend these for anyone who wants to get good things at a lower price :)

i've had these for almost 2 years. my cat played with them, and they were still working fine afterward despite them being frayed where he chewed on it. now the line that connects to the right ear pad is finally completely torn off as a result of his chewing. but they are still working otherwise on the left side. i've tried skull candy headphones and earphones which hv never lasted me more than 6 months...and for $40/pair they've lost my business. so i gotta say i am quite happy with how long these Sony headphones have held up despite getting beat up by my cat. In addition, i like how these headphones don't apply much pressure to my head and are comfortable. i've tried other headphones that have nice cushions on the ears but felt too tight and got my head to hurt. Also, i like how these headphones (and over the ear headphones in general) don't make that squishy sound in your ears like the silicon earbuds do when you walk or run.

These headphones are comfortable. I love the over the ear design because they do somewhat block out the other sounds in the room. I'm not an audiophile but I think the sound produced by these headphones is perfect for the discerning listener. The price was better than I could find anywhere else. Around $15. They are lightweight so they are easy on your head and easy to carry around.

This is my second Sony headphone. The clarity and comfort is great. The padding on the ear pieces are soft. For the price I can buy 10 instead of the more expensive over priced ones. Great quality for good price. Very happy with my purchase.

Someone said these headphones were great for people who wear glasses.

I wore them for 10 hours when I accidentally beat the entirely of soul reaver 2 on twitch stream. (I got caught up in the story..I love that game)

None of that behind the ear ache that you get with other headphones. Nothing like that.

Very light weight headphones. No surround sound though, so if you want that you'll have to look elsewhere. otherwise they're perfect.

Look, I have a pair of Sony MDR V6 headphones that are hard to match even by big names like Bose, and are way better than those expensive brands that are just made for looks. Compared to them, the sound of these is just OK. Even so, even these modest Sony are better than a lot of other more expensive products out there. So, it's a matter of what kind of use you are planning for them. I have them for use at the office connected to my phone. They do the job while I do mine... and we get along fine. Besides, they allow you to take calls. The sound is clear on my end, and so far nobody has noticed that I am wearing headphones when I take a call. Conclusion: if you are looking for inexpensive headphones that do the job, this is a good choice

Just a heads-up: do not leave your headphones out where your little black kitty can find them. Tests have shown that little black kitties are extremely naughty and, for some strange reason, they think that headphone cords taste just like beef jerky. Oh, by the way, this pair was a replacement set.

I bought these to replace my favorite Sony Walkman headphones, which are hard to find these days. Plus, I don't like earbuds. I use these in an office environment connected to a smart phone for listening to streaming talk radio, music and podcasts. They are comfortable and sound crisp with nice bass. The cord is thicker and more durable than what is found on other lightweight headphones. I can plug the jack into my phone without having to remove my phone case. As an added bonus, they work well at blocking out co-workers' conversations. At this price, it won't be a disaster of they got damaged or stolen. I recommend these headphones.

The other reviews that say you don't need to buy expensive headphones to get a good, responsive sound are spot on.

I bought these as a replacement for computer some JVC computer headphones on my work computer that fell apart after years of use.

The sound is amazing. The headphones boost the low frequencies bringing the base forward, but the upper frequencies remain clear and distinctive.
