Using them for playback from the Amazon Cloud Player app on my iPad, to my ears the higher frequencies while clearer than the old headphones, could have been brought forward a little bit more. However they remained exceedingly clear. This preference (again to my ears) is easily adjusted with any playback application that contains a graphic equalizer.

With or without a graphic equalizer, the Sony headphones brought out portions of the music tracks making it almost like listening to music with an upgraded quality. I actually bought a second pair for use at home.

Perhaps the more expensive headphones are worth it to audiophiles, but for the money these are by far the best headphones I have come across.
Nice headphones for the price. They work great for casual use and are comfortable to wear. They don't isolate outside noise very well but do sound good for the price.

I am very happy with these! I've had them for a while now and they're still doing great. The sound is wonderful, and the headphones are easy on my ears. I have psoriasis in my ears so they're usually very sore, which is why I can't use earbud type headphones. these are very comfy. They stay put without squeezing my head!

They sound great and work well with my galaxy s3 and my old portable CD player. It works well for taking phone calls. FWIW, I'm not using the Sony app for the headphones. Only con is that they make your ears sweat a lot when working out. Comfortable while wearing glasses.

After using it for a while, I am going to give it a 4 for the price and build. the missing star is for the sound quality.
I had better expectation before i purchased it because it is a Sony. I got a free basic headphone when i bought a MD player many years ago. Although the headphone is a "kit" that comes with the MD player, it serves me well through the year. I thought I might get better quality by "purchasing" a new better one from Sony. after comparison, I found the sound quality to be pretty much the same or not as good as my old kit. the sound quality doesn't feel "full"
Very happy with these for the price. My son has the $100+ version, and of course, they are better (more noise reduction, larger ear cover). But these fit my needs just fine.

They are OK. Kinda flimsy, don't feel that secure on my head. (A woman's reg sized head). Sound quality is alright, nothing amazing. An ok pair of cheap headphones if your not depending on them for too much.
There's no way the ear cups are fitting over your ears. They have to be some of the smallest I've ever seen
I've owned these for over a year. Work great! Sound is well balanced and clear. I mostly use this headphone for skype and can wear it for hours at a time. Great value for the price, would buy again.

The Sony MDRZX110AP ZX headphones will not disappoint. They look great and feel great. The sound on these headphones really surprised me - in a good way. They have pretty good sound for 16$!! The mic also works wonderfully. It worked on my Xbox One but I had to change a few settings so the sound from the headset wouldn't echo in parties. The ability to fold these headphones is a really cool feature, because it makes them easier to carry around. The headset has a button on the wire that can pause and play content. Overall, these headphones do not disappoint.
Works great, love how they fold up, I put them in my center console and pull them out when I need to use them.
Love, love, love these!!!! I bought another pair just for my daughter because she keeps taking mine! I'm going to buy another pair for when I travel. <3 <3 Definitely recommend these!
Very high quality build and extrem lightweight! The bases could be a little bit deeper, but for that price and if you like on-ear headphones, go for them!
These are awesome, used the speakers to install a stereo in my motorcycle helmet, sound quality is very good and loud and the foam ear covers limit noise nicely.

Pretty good budget headphones. I've bought a few pair of theses over the last couple of years. My daughter uses them daily. They won't last you forever with heavy use but very affordable so I don't mind having to buy again.
They're okay. The cord is easily damaged.
This is as awesome product for the price. I got it for 18 bucks and I love listening to music. Its adjustable and easy to carry. I use it for my daily walking and sometimes in gym. Not too heavy.

Sound, is great comfort, can wear them for several hours at a time without any discomfort. My generation still prefers this style to earbuds. I personally prefer wired instead of bluetooth. Will buy these again if and when my current pair wears out.

I wouldn't say these are the BEST headphones, as they feel very plasticy and like they could break if mistreated... but these stay at my desk and are used for listening to music in the background while I'm working on things so they don't have to be top-notch. Well worth what I paid for them.

I just started working from home and needed something to help block out external noise (children) and something comfortable to wear for long periods of time while working on my computer. Very comfortable to wear, easy to adjust to my big head, good clear sound (I listen mostly to podcasts and comedy bits...not much music). Good price point and very comfortable to wear. Would recommend.

I was pleasantly surprised with the whole purchase experience. In fact, it was one of the most satisfied experiences in a long time. The order itself only took 24 hours to reach me and the product was a very good condition. I have been looking for a foldable headset for my phone for a long time and I always like Sony in my entire life. This didn't disappoint me at all. I highly recommend this product and seller on Amazon.

We were very happy with these headphones at first - good sound quality, great price. However, the headphones fell apart in under a year. On one pair, the cord broke at the connector piece. One another pair the plastic headband piece broke. We were not hard on these at all and they never left our house, so there was no reason for them to break. Very disappointed.
Great headphones for the price, fit nice, sound good!

I ordered these for my kids in elementary school. I was tired of the cheap headphones breaking all the time. They work great and sound good. The angled plug in jack is awkward with protector cases but it works. The cord is really thick and I like that.

These are fine headphones. They feel great on my head, and sound is ok. For low range headphones they are just ok, because they are better headphones out there for the same price. The sound was not as loud as other headphones of the same price. The end of these headphones came when they fell from my desk and the pin that let the headphones to fold in pop out. Making them useless.
Ok. The head phones volume is very low need to boost the volume on my sony receiver. Not really that great for mobiles.

These are tremendous headphones. The sound quality is excellent. I have a pair of "Beats" that were $150 bucks....this pair sounds just as good as the beats for a fraction of the price! The bass is full and rich and the sound reproduction in the mid-range and high range is crisp and clear. Overall, the sound reproduction is super. Very realistic. These headphones are well made, and had a nice, "solid" feel. These headphones are excellent and I would say "stop looking, buy these." Completely excellent value. Great product!!
For the price you can't go wrong. Sounds great and the cord is long enough to sit my table on the end table and rest comfortably in the chair watching a movie.
Works great for my daughter who is in kindergarten hasn’t broken them yet

Perfect for what I needed. I bought some other old skool headphones that did not block out the noise on the plane, these did. That's all I wanted was to watch movies and not hear the noise. I bought two pairs, one for my kid.
It a hearty pair of headphones , it last really long even with the roughness of everyday life( exercising , getting tangles, getting pulled,rain,etc.) and it sounds great.
I bought these for my son a while back. He absolutely LOVES these headphones! After buying Skullcandy and being utterly disappointed, these headphones are STILL going strong.

Ear piece connecting to the headband broke after four day of usage. It's cheap, so that quality is cheap. The sound quality is cheeeeeaper yet. I am surprise Sony would put out such a junk. For this low price and low quality of junk, I didn't even bother to get it exchanged.
This is the second one and I still like it
Work well, use them to listen to movies on my iPad. Good bargain.
The sound is good, but there's is a 2.5, headphones 🎧 Jack.. And the 3.5 jacks, on my phone doesn't fit in really well…..

Bought for my wife to use with phone and laptop. Excellent for the price. The sound quality is very good and the microphone very clear on calls. I don't think you'll find a better pair of headphones for the price.

Great for the money. They are very inexpensive and sound great.

They also fold flat, which is nice when traveling with a backpack/messenger bag.
Great price for what my husband wanted to listen to his You-Tube.

My daughter started using this headphone and within a week she was complaining that she couldn't hear well. The volume would go up and down by it self or she could only hear on one side, if at all.
Update: LilGadgets just reached out to us and figured out the problem, a faulty cable. They'll be sending a new one to replace the bad one.

Daughter was psyched to have these to feed her Nivana cravings...broken minijack 2 months later...good sound while it lasted wouldn't buy a second time...need headphones that can stand up to a pre-teen.
These were good while they lasted, but they broke after just under a year of usage.
Decent sound at the price point. Not for audiophiles who sit on amazon all day spanking their ear lobes to sennheisers.

I had my old Sony 100's for over 5 years..The only thing was the ear pads got a bit worn,sound great as ever.
My old Sony headphones broke a few days ago..How? My shoe got caught under the headphone wire
and they broke...I was going to get the same pair of Sony headphones like I had before,But after reading
great views on these Sony 110 ZX I said why not..Well I Love them fits great on my ears and the music is
crisp and the sound perfect!!

Most reviews were right for this headphone If you are needing a headphone for light use. Just don't expect the same quality audio as one to three hundred priced headphones. I bought these to use occasionally at work, and mainly to listen to talk radio. They fit well, and there is enough material or cushion that should satisfy most. Good value.

Bought this for my PS4 and it plugs in directly to the control and works with the mic. Online friends never complain about the mic quality. Saved me money on buying more expensive gear. Durability is good too as long as you take care of it. Very comfortable too.

These headphones by Sony do not meet my expectations. First, the headware's stereo field is severely lacking in my opinion. They do not provide the amount of stereo quality/depth which I expect. Additionally, I find the product uncomfortable to wear for long periods. I suggest that Amazon customers purchase headphones by another manufacturer.

The sound is great. Took forever to get them. I deducted two stars because they are quite large...pictures can be deceiving. I was looking for the smaller earpieces because I use these to travel with. My other ones just plain wore out!

the volume is a bit low on these, however easily compensated for by just jacking the vol way up on your device, otherwise perfect, incredible sound, separation, and great soundstage, bass is not overpowering (thank god!"
Very good head phones fit great

Just what I was looking for. They are perfect for everyday listening and are comfortable. I love that they fold up for easy travel and storage. The ear pieces are well padded and help cancel out extra noise.

Was hoping for a better product, but will find a use for them. I have a cheaper set of these that I bought at Walgreens and can hardly tell a difference. There is slightly more bass but higher frequencies disappointing.

Perfect Budget headphones for anyone who is on the go. They fold up quite nicely and are actually around my neck at this very moment!

Pros : Good jack length, fold nicely, surprisingly good audio quality, cheap

Cons: Not too comfortable

Overall : I'd recommend this product for anyone who needs a set of headphones that do their job without all the extra cost.

Very good set of headphones for the price. I bought this 6 months ago, and is just as durable now as the first time I put them on. Sony has always been a brand I really trusted, so this was a no brainer for an affordable replacement. Sound quality is pretty good, and got a pretty good deal on them.

I bought two pairs of these. Great value for the money. The cable could be a foot longer, but they are the length as advertised. I think a lot of thought went into making these, and they're made well.

This headphones work awesome, the audio quality for the price is excellent. The materials feels very resistant also the cable. It's easy to carry because of the compact design and the folding function. I totally recommend this headphones for the price.
They sound good but they are definitely not as loud as any of my other ones. I wouldn't order them again
Good sound, but poor volume compare with others headphones I had. Maybe is because of the price.
These work really well. I bought them for a long international flight. They fit easily into my backpack.

Bought there after I refunded the Amazon over the ear basic earphones for my brothers birthday. He had the same pair years ago but snapped the cord when the warranty expired. He uses them on his IPhone 6 and on out Lenovo computer with no problem.

I'm actually kind of surprised by all of the 5 star reviews for these, these headphones are really muffled sounding, almost like listening to things through a pillow. They're very comfortable and nicely made, but there are much better sounding headphones in this price range. I bought these instead of another pair of Sennheiser HD201s (which I've since given away) because the Sennheisers were a little bit uncomfortable, but I think I'd rather have the sound quality of the HD201s than the comfort of these headphones.
Nice solid pair of headphones great sound great price. Great alternative to wearing earbuds

The sound quality is alright but I'd prefer that the sound wouldn't resonate outside the headphones. The bass quality is acceptable. I bought them because of the reviews' claim about them being just as good as Beats Headphones. At that point, I was fairly intrigued. Once I tried them, I knew to be much wary of the reviews from now on. Some people don't know what they're talking about.
great price, sound, and blocks out outside noise.
Good product, Good price.
These should really get 4.5 stars. They aren't audiophile sound quality, but for $13, they are completely useable for most listening tasks.

These were really nice headphones. They fit comfortably, and were easily adjustable, a great pair for the price. Until they broke less than 6 weeks later. I've had $5 headphones last me longer than these did, and when I tried contacting both Sony and Amazon for support to get them replaced, I was told by Amazon that since it was past 30 days, they wouldn't refund or replace them and Sony never responded to various requests for help. My advice: save your money and pick a different set of headphones.

Love the ear pads. I can hear my music clearly but doesn't bother anyone else. The microphone was just an added bonus for me. Rarely use it to make calls but when I do the person on the other end hears me clear as a bell. I recommend.
Excellent sounding headphones and the price is more than fair.
Perfect for mobile phone and Mac for conference calls and Webex. Bluetooth ones might NOT be stable.I wish SONY could use thicker wires though.
VERY GOOD HEADPHONES CAN HEAR MUSIC GREAT

I purchased these for my son & he is just thrilled with them. Due to ear infections, the doctor insists he use over the ear phones rather than ear buds when he listens to his music or watches a DVD. These have been perfect. They arrived quickly & were very reasonably priced. They fit his head well & give great sound. Hopefully they will last a long time.
Not a bad replacement for my poor Sennheisers that fell victim to my cat, good sound quality, comfortable fit.

Was skeptical how well it sounds given the purchase was close $10.00. I am pleasantly suprised at how rich the sound is and the bass is perfect. Not overbearing and not tinny. The only downside which is the comfort for over the ear phones. This is true with every other over-the-ear phone I tried and so not knocking the star for Sony.

After trying many other brands, so far my experience is Sony Headphones is top-notch. Will love it if I can find over the year one with same quality and affordability from Sony.

One of the two I have used. And that one has a loose connection. I am always having to push the connector in the phone. I am scare to see if I wasted money on the other one. I am never negative and can find positives. This one I am still searching.
They work. They sound fine. They're sturdy enough and can extend. They also make my ears uncomfortable after an hour. Not recommended if you want great headphones.
I love these headphones. Not too expensive, great noise cancelling, and are a great fit.

they are great. After using them for a couple of hours they are not super comfy .

You are getting what you pay for. Dirt cheap headset for casual use. If you are looking to do some heavy gaming look somewhere else. It is sufficient for me, but it may not be for you. Worth the money to an extent.

Sony's MDR-ZX series is the gold standard of cheap headphones. Good build quality, with excellent sound for the price make this a prime choice for a budget-conscious consumer. The -110 series feels a bit flimsier then the -100, and lacks the coloring to distinguish the right cup at a glance, but the cups fold up to the headband for more compact storage.

Great headphones for the price. Nice clean look and comfortable cushions. For someone with a smaller head it is a perfect fit but if you have a larger head it may be a little small or uncomfortable. Sound quality is average depending on the device. My phone does not pick up the sound quite as well as my mac desktop. But all in all great pair and can't beat the price.
Perfect for travel.
My husband loves these earphones. The cushions on ear pieces are nice when wearing for long periods & the band is flexible for adjusting to desired tightness on head.

My purchase was based on the many 4-5 star reviews and I was disappointed. I used these as soon as i received them and I was not satisfied. They do what their supposed to do but nothing special, they also feel cheaply made but for $20 they are alright.

Was very excited to get these because of all the great reviews! I immediately plugged them into my phone, and no sound came out from the right speaker. Very disappointed. I checked my connections and song choices with no change. Had to return. I want to buy another pair but afraid to waste my time.

basic backup headset. the headset is really cheaply made and not ready cozy to have on head for long time, like watching movie. Sound is some what OK but not great. I would say you can do better with other brands for the price.

I bought these for my son because he can't stand the earbud style. These are comfortable to wear, have great sound, and still pack easily in a small pocket of his book bag. He's used them nearly every day for 6 months and they are still in great condition.

Lightweight and compact so they're perfect for travel. I take them everywhere in my backpack. They add almost no weight and fold up nicely to stay out of the way.

They won't blow you away but the sound is sufficient for the average listener. Very clean, clear and crisp mid and highs. Bass response tends to flatten out at higher volumes, but tweaking the equalizer in my audio player overcomes that easily.

The cord is a little annoying as it is susceptible to tangling. I use a simple tie to keep the cable neat while packed away.

Overall I'm happy with the purchase. Great value for the price.
Really hated it!
Not working after 1 year!
It was working alright for 3 months and suddenly one side stopped working. No idea of what happened. Something wrong with the product
These are good headphones. They have survived my 8 year old son so far.
I got these to wear while working and they work great.
Kids liked them
Pretty darn good considering the price.

The sound seems really good on these headphones. I plan on using them mostly for an electronic keyboard we own, and the sound coming through the headphones sounds fantastic -- better than the sound that comes through the external speakers on the keyboard itself (which still sounds decent). The only thing I'd dock a star for is that they feel a little tight. I haven't worn them for very long yet, but it seems like the tightness might be a small issue, and I think there's nothing you can do to adjust them from side-to-side (i.e. width-wise instead of length-wise). Otherwise, they seem great.

For the price, these are really spectacular headphones. They have good strong bass, clear sound, and decent noise-canceling ability. Like all over-the-ear phones they squeeze the head a bit, but you could pay a lot more and get a lot less than the quality of these headphones.
My kiddo loves them - just as described.
Big fan of Sony quality.

VERY uncomfortable to wear for more than 10-15 minutes at a time. The audio quality is on par with just about any other headset, but I'd forego these in favor of more expensive/more comfortable ones next time.

My favorite "library" headphones. I use them to listen to CDs from iTunes on my MBPR. They don't muffle out all outside sounds (so what), but they do prevent others from being bothered with my musical choices.
Excellent quality, especially at the price point. I listen to lots of newer jazz (D. Holland, D. Douglas, B. Stenson. W. Leo-Smith, W. Parker, D.S. Ware, B. Frisell) - throw in some U2, Cowboy junkies, N.Young, B. Laswell etc - NO complaints.
You can wear these for hours without notice, even with reading glasses.
At the price they are easily replaceable if lost, broken, whereas having to replace. say, a pair of HD598 CS might get me pissed off.

The headphones do indeed do their job as expected and I am generally happy with the result. There is one warning that prevents me from giving this product five stars. It makes a lot of static noises upon first usage. This problem did naturally go away over time as I used them more and more, but it does seem like an issue that could possibly cause a customer to demand a refund if he is not willing to wait out the sound. Other than that issue, the product is great. The cord is a reasonable distance and the sound comes out nicely. It is not extremely comfortable and sort of lacks smooth adjustment maneuvers for the head size, but it gets the job done perfectly, especially for the cheap price it sells for.

I'd recommend the head set coming with a small package of the restrainers that it comes with upon opening. I'm sure I'm not the only person who treats wrapping up his headphones nicely as a big deal, but often lose the restrainer. Doing this might send a hidden message to the customer that the seller expects this thing to last a good while as long as it is taken care of.

Ordered these to replace a pair with the exact same model number.
The new ones are much more "cheap" looking and uncomfortable and the sound quality is definitely not near as good as the old pair.
Either the pair I got was a cheap knock off or Sony quality standards have went down

I bought these headphones because I wanted something more substantial than the ubiquitous white earbuds that came with my iPhone. They're not uncomfortable to wear and they fold up to a good size that isn't burdensome when travelling. The sound quality they deliver is great for the price, but for me what's really important is the clear signal they send to the chatty person sitting next to me on the airplane that I really don't want to hear about your grandkids for the next 3 hours.

I needed a good pair of headphones (as I can't use earbuds because they really hurt my ears because they do not fit properly due to the shape of them) so that I can listen to my instructors lectures on line and hear them clearly, and to listen to music while doing homework and my daughter even uses them to watch her DVD player in the car or her tablet in the home. They've been wonderful and have an excellent quality of sound that's very crisp. They're also incredibly comfortable! You won't go wrong, especially for the money! It's such an excellence deal for such a wonderful quality product.

Love the headphone/set, very good sound for the price.
Mic function works perfect.
It lacks other buttons such as music controls, mute, etc.
But for the price it is expected.
They are good of short to medium listening.

***Note: As other reviewers have stated,
The head band does feel tight and you feel discomfort after 1hr or so of continuous listening.
I recommend to use a hair drier to heat the plastic headband.
This will let the plastic get heated so you can stretch the headband a bit to make loose as you see fit.

I needed some headphones to listen to audio books during my next business trip. Maybe I'm getting old, but I was sick of the in-ear buds that my cell phone came with, and wanted some comfort in my life. I purchased these after reading the reviews that they're comparable to the Beats headphones. I don't have a magical ear, but these sound great to me, certainly better than I'd expect $20 headphone to sound. And if you're picky enough to want the sound of $250 headphones, then go buy some $250 headphones--simple, right? I did not want to spend more that $20, and I did not want something that looked ridiculous. These feel amazing on my ears, and don't look odd on my head. I wore them for 8 hours during my plan ride, and felt great. I also like that these can be pulled off my ear and sit on my neck. In-ear buds always got caught in my purse, or fell on the floor (yuck).

I've only had these a day now, but I can say WOW. The bass is amazing! Music on these is way richer than my MDRZX100. However, everything else seems to be drowned out on these vs the 100. TV shows feel like they have way too much bass. For music, I'd recommend the 110 to anyone but for all-around good sound, I'd have to fall back to the 100. Also, the 110's swivel is much more fragile than the 100's and I feel like it won't last long. My 100's have been dropped, kicked, stomped, and generally manhandled by my kids and they still work just as good as they did the day I bought them.

The Sony MDRZX110 stereo headphones are often lauded for their amazing sound quality, elegant design, and, most of all, stellar price. I wanted to test out these headphones to see if they were worthy of that praise, and (maybe) snap up some cheap backup headphones in the process.

These headphones sport a clean, minimal design, which I honestly appreciate. Though Beats headphones may look classy to you, I prefer the subtle, understated look Sony accomplished here. There are two models, Black and White (I chose the Black, but I was also able to have some hands-on time with my brother's White model). Each one features a matte finish on most of the body, which looks great; there is also a nice glossy portion on the backs of each "earphone" that accentuates the matte well. In terms of ports, the 3.5mm headphone jack is especially convenient, allowing you to connect straight to your phone if you'd like to kick back and listen to podcasts, movies, and, of course, music. There is another variant with a microphone built in, but I did not purchase this model and thus, I will not offer my opinion on it. Overall, build quality and design is excellent, but the top portion that sits atop your head feels a little flimsy, and though I appreciate the fact that the "earphones" fold inwards to create a compact package, I feel as though I will break them every time I try. Additionally, they're not completely comfortable, but I found that, during hours-long jam sessions, I never noticed them or had a reason to take them off and stop listening.

In terms of sound quality, Sony absolutely nailed it here. I concur with the other reviewers on this point - it's a nice, balanced sound. You get solid bass and great quality across the spectrum. I honestly think that these headphones could replace your Beats or more expensive equivalent if necessary. Sure, you won't get the complete range in crystal-clear quality and you won't feel as though you're in the recording studio (which is OK because pretty much no modern pair of headphones can achieve that), but (and this is a common theme throughout my review) for a starting price of fifteen bucks, it is a little difficult to nitpick here.

For the price, it's absolutely one of the best products I've had the pleasure of using. These Sony ZX series headphones pack a serious, bass-filled punch. They sport a modern and minimal design and sound quality is remarkable. Sure, the latest pair of top-of-the-line headphones will probably sound quite a bit better than these, and the build quality is weak in some areas, but again - consider the price and you'll be in awe of their performance. Absolute joy to use.

I had a (similar) pair of these before, so I ordered these thinking it was the same pair. I was a little surprised when I opened them and saw how small they are. The ones I had before were over the ear, not on ear, so were slightly bigger. These are fine though. They're comfortable and fit well. I gave them 4 stars because they're not very loud. I can put my music on max volume and still afford to go louder. This is my personal preference, of course, so I'm sure anyone who prefers to listen to music at normal levels won't notice.

For budget headphones, they are fine.

I like that they are comfortable to wear, look streamlined and reasonably attractive, and anyone can purchase these without breaking the bank.

The downfall is that the quality of the audio will never be anything more than mediocre.
There is no sharpness, no depth, no fineness that comes through. The volume doesn't reach high levels.

All in all, these are fine if you don't care to catch detail in what you listen to, and you don't need to listen at a high volume.

Have gifted 4 or 5 pair of these headphones to people. Great, quality sound in both the high end and low end range. Great cord with a good length and comfortable ear pieces. Hard to beat for the price.

For the money you wouldn't expect much, but was very surprised on the sound. I read what other comments were made on them and they sounded good to me, so I decided to try them,and very glad I did. I also found them comfortable on my head. Nice find !!

I got these for my mother as her old headphones, older model of these, ear pads were peeling and leaving plastic white peelings on her ears and on her clothes after use. No pealing with these and the sound quality sounds better than the previous model.

For the price these headphones are incredible. Compared to my sons Beats, they are not far behind. They deliver a great sound quality, look fashionable, have nice quality of manufacture, and provide the right level of isolation from ambient noise.
Bought this headphones for my 10 year old because he needed them for computer lab in school. He loves them.
Bought them for my 11 year old son to use on his cell phone. He enjoys them. The sound quality is good for the price! The microphone feature is great.
Works great!
Fit fine and sound good. I do wish the cord was a tiny bit longer.
Ah, Sony. :) What else is there to say? I try not to buy any other brand for sound when I can help it. This one is a happy addition to the collection.
Great headphones, while they lasted - which was about 6 months.
good noise cancellation.
Very disappointed!! Has a very tiney sound, and the bass response is pitiful. Cannot listen to it loudly, because instead of rich full body sound, it hurts your ears.

I just got these today. They sound okay not as good as Colby brand. I gave them one star because they're very very uncomfortable they hurt within a few minutes or more. They sound just ok nothing big and not loud enough for me.
Good audio quality, decent fit for my pumpkin head. I wish they had better range, but there's enough bass, not booming but acceptable.
Great quality for a great price
VERY comfortable, light-weight, and convenient to pack since they fold flat.
My favorite brand of $20 headphones.

After 6 months of light usage (3 times a week), the headphones did end up snapping, proving also not to be as reliable as my last similarly priced Sony headphones.
good price and quality
I've only used this lnot even 20 times and the male aux plug is acting up, other than that it's a good product
LOVE THESE, THEY EVEN BLOCKED OUT THE NOISE FROM THE AIRPLANE
Bought these for my children for Christmas. Comfortable on the ears. My 18-year old daughter said the sound quality is great and that they are great alternatives to the Beats headphones.
wonderful
For the price this is a very good seth of phones. I would definitely purchase them again!

The headphone is good for daily use and this is our second buy. First one is running for last two years.

But my love for these headphone made me purchase two of them this year. Thanks for a great product Sony.

Excellent headphones! Compact and portable, too, as they fold. They only fit one way on the ears, so no switching around to see which side/ way fits. Very comfy on the ears, and make for a great sound seal. Great purchase!
Cheap and simple but do the job, but look and sound great.

These headphones sound great. The in-line mic is awesome! However they also fell apart in a matter of weeks. The audio/mic quality was expected of Sony, the build quality was not. I was definitely disappointed in this purchase.
Decent product but I have to have the volume all the way up to hear anything and the bass is lacking. Also they right headphone went out in less than 3 months.

it worked very well at first, 3 month later, I found there's statics on the left ear when the bass is strong.

Not a great product. This headphone is okay to the price it is available. One thing I liked it has got the Microphone hence you can use the same headphone for the call as well. Music sound is Sound is okay and as expected with 30mm driver.
Decent sound quality. The headphones are comfortable and block out a lot of noise. Perfect for listening to audio books.

I really like these headphones. Great sound and very comfortable. However, the shipping kinda sucked. Labeled as prime. I ordered on a monday and it still hadnt shipped by thursday... so I cancelled and reordered. Got em three days later.
Not what I expected, but I should have known for just $20 !!
Good

Meh. I ended up giving these to my daughter to use at school, which is fine for her at school use. I wanted to use them at work and the quality was not up to par for that.

These were great, but then the cord frayed after 4 months of normal use and the seller has not responded to requests for a refund/exchange. If they are reading this, I would appreciate either a refund or exchange! I do not plan to order again unless I hear from the seller.

The price is great and the sound is good enough. My only complaint is that it hurts my ears after prolong use. It could be that I have large ears that stick out a bit. So if you have large ears and will be using these headphones for longer than 20 to 40 min it could hurt.

These things work great. Even worked perfectly fine when I use to play xbox one and would plug them into my controller. I was able to play without waking up the baby. Also great use for my laptop. Still use them to this day.
Love the sound and love the microphone feature. They are very comfortable, even with quite a few piercings, and even keep my ears warm on cold walks to work. Would recommend for sure!
These sound suprisingly good for such inexpensive headphones but I don't use them much because they are uncomfortable to wear. I only busy them out for special listening sessions.
Sure beat ear buds.

Very good headphones at a great price. The sound quality is very good for its value.

It does not cover the ears, however feel good. They are very comfortable.

Obviously no noise cancellation. Its design is really convenient.

Nothing to envy to other headphones that can be expensive and poor sound quality.
Great for the price, but a little too muddy sounding. Not as crisp as I would like. But then again, they are inexpensive and quality seems well built.
I really like these headphones! The sound is very good in them.
Simple headset that folds flat AND surprisingly gives great sound! Perfect for taking with you on-the-go.
For the price these are great! I thought they would be too good to be true at the price point, but I've been pleasantly surprised.

I have a set of MDR-V150's that I got 6 years ago (for $15) and used basically every day since. They can take a beating but I didn't want to keep dragging them back and forth to work, so I decided to pick up another similar pair, expecting similar robustness from Sony.

The sound quality is what I expect from $16 headphones, but the design is lacking, compared to the MDR-V150:
- The folding part does not have a strong detent so it is easy to collapse, even just picking them up off a desk.
- The made the "left side indicator" (for tactile-y recognizing left-right) very small on the band, instead of on the back of the driver,
- There are no labels for increments on the adjustable size band. The MDR-V150 has numbers for reading the size of the band, these do not, no lines or anything to check size before you put it on your head.

I'll tough this out and use them, but I have my doubts that these will last long, and i definitely will look further

The sound quality was good, but they have already developed a short in the plug after only a month of light use. I can't say anything good about a product that is this delicate. It's really a shame because they are good headphones otherwise.
After buying a few off brands, I went to a brand I know. In the past few weeks, this has been a great headset. Sony has delivered on quality. I'll let you know if anything changes.

Great sound - nice deep bass - very comfortable to wear - works with my Computer - S4 Galaxy and digital voice recorders. I can hear sounds with these I can not hear with my old head phones or my ear buds.

great sound good quality
lasted my kids over a year so that's saying something
great for the money. for this price, these are by far the best headphones I have ever heard. they fit comfortably as well. the item came as ordered and was delivered promptly.

I don't write very many reviews, but these sound terrific. I originally purchased these simply to listen to some tunes while mowing the lawn, but I find myself plugging them in and zoning out with a favorite album like I used to when I was younger. I imagine more pitch perfect audiophiles might gripe about depth of sound, but these little cheapies really produce a nice crisp sound with a layered multichannel feel. They really do a great job at articulating each instrument in even fairly complex pieces of music. A great buy.
Superb sound quality. While I am not an audiophile, I think these cheap headphones sound great and there is no distortion.
Works as expected

This headphone is not same with Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX. One with the mic has low quality cable, plug and material. I had a same white headphone and I thought I am going to get the same black headphone with a mic, but disappointed!

Decent quality and decent sound, nothing mind blowing. I am using this as a travel set and it has survived without issue in my back pack. Sounds OK in a casio px150 (bass is too strong), unsurprisingly sounds better when streaming music. Sound isolation is surprisingly good.

As basic headphones, these worked great at first. But after less than two months of use, I started getting scratchy sounds during audio playback. Now I'm lucky if I make it through one song or video file without picking up serious distortion. These are not 4.5/5 star headphones, contrary to what the Amazon rating implies. I'll be seeking a refund, given how quickly it took my headphones to malfunction.

Before I got these, I was using the ear buds from a 10 year old iPod, the sound was tinny and I had to hold the wire a certain way to hear it in both ears. These are way better. They have a very full, rich sound. I hear things in songs that I never knew were there before. My only complaint is that they make the tops of my ears hurt if I wear them for a long time, but I think I'll get used to that eventually. Maybe I am not the best person to review headphones.
Father in law loves them.

These headphones are finally dying out after 2 years and hundreds if not thousands of hours of use and punishment they made it through a winter storm, getting soaking wet, and being dropped off a 5th story balcony before succumbing and they have great sound and fit comfortable as well. i would buy another pair anytime great value.
Don't expect high quality but it works fine.

Great product, good quality

BOY THESE SURE SOUND GREAT I KNOW I"LOVE THIS

This headset is just what I wanted. Sound is amazing (I've had Beats by Dre and I cannot tell one from the other) . I've had this product for almost a year now and I still get compliments on the street about how cool my headset looks.
Fits small heads and works amazing on my daily skype with my SO.
Granddaughter loved these and says everything sounds great with them!! They were definitely a hit and for great price too! Would recommend!

These are great! I highly recommend, and I'm really surprised at how much I enjoy listening to music and audio books with them. It is like I'm in my own little world. At the price, it's an amazing value.
love it. old head phones broke after 3 years.
Slow Shipping! Sound was Good. But Headphone had a Marred Finish in Several Places. Probably a Store Return Headphone. I did not Return the Headphones, to much Hassle..

I do video recording and need to check sound on location. I also do home recording with GarageBand, so I need a reliable set of headphones. These are great for the price. I recommend them. Can't go wrong with Sony.
Awesome sound quality for a very reasonable price.

Excellent headphones -- I use them at work to play instrumental (Zen) music to drown out the co-worker talk and office noise. They have a very good sound, are flexible enough to fit my big head, and the price was excellent.

I was just looking for some fairly simple headphones to drown out some of the noise at work... I didn't really need a microphone and wasn't really intending to use them with my phone, but the version with the mic was only about $5 more, and I figured it wouldn't hurt to keep my options open.

They work great for their intended purpose. I listen to an assortment of streaming music throughout the day and it sounds great. I'm no audiophile and I don't have the vocabulary to to properly express things like tone and range - but the music I'm listening to sounds good. At least as good as any other speakers or headphones I've used.

The addition of the mic is actually pretty nice, even when I'm not really using it. There's a button on the cord that (when plugged into a device that supports it) serves to mute and unmute the microphone when it's in-use... But it also serves to mute and unmute music when it's just playing music. That's additional functionality that I hadn't expected, and I'm quite happy with it.

The cable is a little bit on the short side - only about four feet long. That's more than long enough to reach my phone or computer, but both of those are sitting atop my desk. If I were trying to plug into something tucked away inside a cabinet or down on the floor I'd be having a hard time.

The headphones fold up for travel. They don't get especially compact... But simply rotating the earphones flat makes transportation much easier.

They're a little creaky. Nothing horrible... But if I move just right there's some creaking in my ears. It isn't a big issue since I'm typically using them at my desk, but I'm sure it'd be more noticeable if I were wearing them while doing something more active - running or something like that.

This is a great pair of headphones for the price. I have had this headphones for years (it has lasted very long), and it has traveled all over the world with me. I loved it so much that i purchased it again.

Perfect earphones at a reasonable price. I'm a drummer and these phones are perfect in filtering out unwanted noise. So good in fact, I bought a 2nd pair with a splitter so I and a partner can work together.

The only reason I didn't give the headphones 5 stars was because they lack some bass. Other than that they are great. I am using the headphones with my Ps4 and the mic works great in chat. The sound quality is good it could be a bit better, but for the price these are great. I've owned these headphones for months now and I think they are great. My friend has a set of Bose headphones and I think my headphones are almost as good.

Excellent headphones, especially for the price. I love the folding design; makes it easy to carry in my backpack. The bass is nice, not too strong or overpowering. Overall, sound quality is great, seems pretty durable, and only for $20.
Quality product. Did exactly what I needed it to. Great product and a great price! Works as well as the high end models. Would recommend to a friend.

Honestly amazing sound for the price. They shipped fast and arrived in two days thanks to Amazon Prime. The packaging is fairly plane, but adequate and doesn't really convey the quality of the sound in the headset. I have a big head (wear about a size 8 hat) and my wife has a small head (she wears an adult small helmet) and the headphones fit us both perfectly. I plugged it into our Android phones and listened to music for several hours, then into a computer and again listened to music for several hours. The sound, frequency response, and bass was impressive. I'm not usually one to listen to loud music or heavy base, but these sounded so good I couldn't take them off.

FYI, we purchased these in preparation for a long flight but I see them getting a lot of use. My son has already taken my pair, so I will be ordering more.

Sony MDRZX110 ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black) Seems like we never have enough sets of these headphones because everyone loves using them and I love the price!
These are inexpensive headphones with a great sound quality. The sound is very clear and detailed and the bass was surprisingly better than another brand we have.
Comfortable to wear with nice clear sound and mic that is easy to use.
We have a few pairs of these for the teens in the household to keep on hand for when they have friends over and and are playing their computer games together. One thing I like is the kids can actually hear me say something to them when they have these on.
I also like these for the kids when they travel then I do not have to worry if they break them or lose them compared to some higher end ones we have.

My grandson likes these headphones and sound good for the price. Most headphones are way overpriced and I have owned numerous ones and have had cheap units sound as good as the high priced ones. Sometimes I think at an expensive headphone influences a person to believe that it sounds much better that it really does. Not to say that some expensive sets can't sound great, just that some cheaper sets can also sound very good too. These are not bad sounding Sony headphones that are holding up well to be hauled around in a kids backpack.

These work great as a PS4 headset. They are light and actually a little more comfortable than some of the big expensive gaming headsets. My son unplugs them from the PS4 and straight into his iPhone for music and phone calls. The multifunction button on the cord controls phone functions and the microphone picks up well. Sound quality is very good for this price level. If you need a good sounding cheap worry-free pair of headphones and not a flashy status symbol, these are for you. You can buy 10 or 12 of these for the price of one set of those colorful popular headsets. Helps avoid that sick feeling one gets when expensive headsets go missing.

There is a No-Mic option which is cool because I really prefer to have just the headphone. Initially, bought for the kids - the sound quality is decent and for the price, I could not complain. Sony is always a go-to brand name for good sound quality. You could probably find similar quality from competing options, but Sony doesn't typically let me down. (Meanwhile, other brands could leave some to be desired in quality, comfort-ability and value.)

After some time with the kids, they are still in-tact, so if you were worried about durability, these fit the bill. (Because you know the kids left them down for the baby to get a hold of, and they are still okay!)

I was looking for a pair of head phones to wear at the gym. I can't find a single pair of ear buds that will stay in my ear while running. I have tried the normal style and the sport ones that loop behind each ear. I was trying to avoid the style of these headphones due to how bulky I suspected they would be but to my surprise they aren't that bad. They do stay put on your head well even while running on the treadmill. The sound quality for a pair of headphones of this price is great. These aren't beats or bose headphones so dont expect that caliber of sound quality. But even so, I was happy with how my music sounded. Good buy.

I have always bought Sony headphones, my current set has had its last speaker pod superglued-taped back into place.. 10 years was a good run from them.. This set of MDRZX110 ZX sounds every bit as good as the set it replaced.. The Bass is great for a set of this size, punchy and great middle/high tone definition.. Maybe these will last until 2029

The sound is good. They weren't comfortable when they arrived but now they are. When they arrived they were wide and flat across the top of my head, they dug into the top of my pointy head but they didn't hug my ears. In fact they slid off my head when I was hoping to listen lying down. I had to squeeze them together and put a couple of rubber bands on it to hold it together and to bend it so it would be more like the shape of my head. I kept the rubber bands on for an entire day. So if your head shape is more oval than round they may not fit you either, but they seem to be okay now! I've only had they a short time but now I'm enjoying them and I'm happy I got them, especially as the price fits my budget.

Ordered these for my son, needed over ear headphones for 1st grade. They fit his head and didn't squeeze his ears! Sound was pretty good for the price! Thr only issue was the plug jack if touched or jiggled at all would static out. Pretty good unless you want to move around with them

These headphones are terrible. I did not expect the sound quality to be so bad. I made a mistake in believing a Sony product would mean I would be getting a product of superior quality, I was wrong. I have seven dollar headphones that sound much better. They should not be charging more than five dollars for these, due to terrible sound quality. Shame on Sony, I no longer trust the brand.
I have had three pairs of these. I like them but the skinny cords are a problem as I have cats. The cats are somehow attracted to them, and one bite is all it takes.

I love these Sony headphones. They are very comfortable to wear and adjust easily for different sizes of heads. They are nicely padded to be comfortable to the ear and produce quality sound. They have a folding feature that allows them to fold flat for easy storage. The price is great and so is the product. We already have two of these in our household, and I sure we will purchase more in the future!
Bought as a gift, they said the sound quality is very nice and loves the fold up feature.
Good considering the price. Mediocre sound. The wires in phone of right ear's speaker crapped out after about a year's worth of semi-regular use.
Very good budget headphone for iPod or tablet...not really suited for hi-fi or movie watching but will do in a pinch. For less than 10.00 a pretty good bargain.
Pretty good sound for the price and way better than the Behringer cheap phones.
They broke! I had the previous Sony headphones lasted for years. But these just came off after only a few months
Good enough to replace ear buds. High impedance so don't expect a big sound.
Amazon Basics are better. I will just used these as back up....Dont bother....
Sound is OK, however I sent back after I found the Amazon Basics headphones.
great sound quality and pretty comfortable headphones I'm pretty happy with this purchase!
Great sound,sturdier than most brands, nice has not too deep. Excellent buy.
Great for kids -- they are cheap, durable and have a long cord for car media players, etc...I go through a few each year.

Quality sound. Nice range. Sound isn't too low on my pair, but then again I don't blow my brains out like I used to. These fit on the ear, not over the ear. You'd need to have ears the size of a fifty cent piece for the headphones to fit over them.

Received an item that was damaged AUX cord was messed up. Item was refunded. Bought a second pair.

These headphones are your best bet for cheap headphones the sound is very good for the price and they are very comfortable on your ears.
Item was purchased at an excellent price and were purchased as a gift for a 10 year old. Headphones sounded great for the price. Very satisfied.

Bought these headphones for my kids and it works great. Kids are very rough on headphones and these are still in perfect condition after a lot of use. I also like the fact that its cheap and easy to replace if needed
great
My order was dated June 9th, 2015. Product stopped working on July 29th, 2015. Past time for return. Now, if I can only get warranty info from SONY. Link to seller's warranty is useless.
Love these headphones. Bought a pair for myself, then my wife took them... So this one if for me. Great sound. Was shocked at how good bass comes across. By far worth the price.

Either these are broken or they need better instructions. When I plug them in to tablet, laptop, or phone, nada. The packaging was so hard to open I have no idea how to even return them, but I will try. They're nice looking and comfortable. I expected better of a Sony product.
Great headphones. Note that the mic does not have volume control that you might assume is standard on similar headphones.
Squeezes my temple. The sounds is slightly better that what you would get from cheap earbuds. Thank about it. This is not a steal. It's adequate for the price.
thanks

The sound quality is fine, especially for the price. However, I was dismayed to find that the cord is incredibly short and that I will need to return these headphones if I cannot find an inexpensive extender. Which could introduce static. So count me dissatisfied. I should have just bought another pair of Sennheisers. You probably should too. I've had two pairs of Sennheisers, each lasted several years of almost daily use, and they are an excellent value.
It's a OK headphone, suitable for kid use in the school.
Good pair.
Working great. Sound is not impressive.
Ordered a second pair because the first ones accidentally got stepped on. My daughter used these to practice piano benchmarks on a keyboard all last year. She is a music major.

I really wanted to love these with all the great reviews. I have a small head so they are lose around my head, but squish my ears which is uncomfortable after awhile.. Maybe after some wear they will let up...
Love it
Very comfortable with noise cancellation, a good value for the money

This was great for my 6 year old at first but not even 2 months later it stopped working. My son mainly used this for the desktop computer and his tablet to watch movies. Sucks its wasted money. Save yourself the hassle and get something better quality than this

It's a good product for the price. They work well in my computer (I use skype a lot, and I'm always watching videos), in my ipad mini and even in my iphone 4s. They are really comfortable (but you need to pay attention in R and L signs and put in the right ears).
SONY Un beatable quality I love it

These were given as a gift to an avid musician and at first I was a little concerned considering the price-point wasn't near the studio quality headphones. To my surprise they work great, are very comfortable, and the person prefers these over the bulky high-end phones for most recordings or everyday listening.
These worked great when I first bought them for my son. They lasted all of 5 months, sorry to say they don't work anymore. My son is very disappointed. What can you expect for $15 these days.
Live them comfortable and happy
To be nitpicky, even after adjusting, they feel tight on my ears. But it's not such a big deal, as the sound quality can't be beat at the price.
The worst headphones I ever bought! They're so fragile that they broke in a couple of days! I bought 4 of these headphones and all broke so fast.
I just received these headphones just three days after I ordered.I used them with my laptop and I was blown away.Great clear sound ,nice bass tone.I really love it!.Thank you guys very much!
Great headphones. Great at noise cancellation and at last, a cord that stays tangle free! Highly recommend.
The headphone broke within a week. The earpiece broke off. Bad design.
Very Good
The cord is too short and this pair of headphones really needs an amplifier for any application.
great
Circumference of ear pads is small. Rests uncomfortably on your ears even if you have a small head and ears.

The cable was shorting out - it only worked if you held the cable still at the insertion point in the device you were using. We are returning them. They were comfortable, however and we liked that they folded.

I bought these for a friend but I tried them out before I gave them to him. They sounded great but could be a little louder with voice audio like podcasts and YouTube videos. They felt ok and a bit flimsy but he's been using them for over a week at the gym and they have held up so far.

These are okay but not as loud as they should be compared to my previous headphones. They have a clear sound sound and are comfortable to wear. The "extra bass" is not there and what bass there is is slightly distorted.
Great for the $!
I have only used these 2 times, and today was the first day using at the gym, and I am thoroughly dissappointed. The "muffs will not stay tight to the head, so the sound is not strong.

First of, let me say that for the price, these are fantastic!

The sound that comes out is good, and for the price I am impressed. The bass is good, and impressive for these headphones.

These headphones are also pretty comfortable, not great for long term use, but doable.

My only real complaint is that the cord is a little short for me, but that is just a personal thing and I just end up using an extension.
Really really good headphones for the money.

So, I was a bit harsh on my first review because I did not feel they were a comfortable pair of headphones. However, any company that reads my review and responds to me personally definately gets a thumbs up for customer service. Honestly, these headphones are fine for the money. While I still feel the Sennheiser 202's are a more comfortable fit, they dont fold or have the track change like the sony's. So in the end, I bumped it up to 3 stars.
They work well.

Good headphones with mic at this price range. I thought I would wear these while working out but they get uncomfortable when your ears start to sweat. Sound quality is good. Of course at this price point there is no noise reduction capability and if you have the volume up, the people around you can hear what you are listening too. Overall not a bad choice for some inexpensive over the ear headphones with mic to take calls on.

Even thought it didn't say they were noise cancelling, I thought they would be and they are not. I use them to listen to music on the bus and I can still hear all the bus noise unless I turn the volume way up on my music. They are much more comfortable than earbuds though!
I gave it 5 stars just because of it's value. They're not going to knock your socks off, but I mean we paid like $20 for them. They work great, sound good and the mic works really well too.

These are a very good pair of headphones for the price. The bass is really good quality and gets really close to being like the more expensive Bose and Beats products in terms of sound quality. The downside is that they are not the must comfortable, especially if you wear glasses, and sit on the ear.
Just as described and perfect for back to school shopping!
this is my second pair, I loved the first pair so much I bought my dad a pair
Product gets way to hot with usage. Even after only a few minutes.
great headphones! The kids use this all day long and toss it around, still durable!

This is where I would say ''music reproduction'' should be if
you want to begin to rate any headphone...so it is at the very
bottom of the scale....that is 1 thru 10.

Of course I have listened to other brands like Koss and
JVC which are even worse but i call those ''garbage''
since they do not even reproduce music at all that
could be considered music...just musical static....
And while knocking down is not my goal, JVC is of
course guilty of making pure junk. Shame on them.

So this Sony is at the bottom..barely able to be called
a headphone. The 199 dollar Sony's are nice. So they
do know how to do it right but choose to make inferior
quality headphones...again Shame on Sony.

Buy Sennheiser 202 for a ok budget minded sound.
Buy other Sennheiser's for an even better sound.
Buy Klipsch Image One for a great pure sound. Fair price.
Buy Beyer for a spatially awesome sound.
Buy Bose for a really nice but expensive as hell amazing sound.
Don't buy Beats because it's like a 2 pound boombox on your head.
Buy Polk if your a studio engineer.
Buy other super expensive models if your super rich.
Good value for the price. Folds up nicely. I would buy again.
Cheap.
good sound, comfortable and heavy duty wires which should last longer than the normal thin ones.
I am a stereo nut. These headphones are not a disappointment. Great bass I have no fatigue from wearing the headphones. The sound is excellent also on my ear buds. Enjoy
Excellent sound!

For the money, these are an excellent value. Very satisfied with sound quality and the bass sounds nice and deep.

I compared these to my brother's Beats Solo 2 headphones and I think the only difference is that the Solos create a better seal over your ear.

Sound quality is very close and these can't be beat in terms of value!
I thought the cord would be longer. Length is as advertised, but it's not as long as you would think. Functional headphones
Already broke.
Use daily

I have had these for over a month and I am by no means gentle with my headphones but they have not failed me. The sound is bass heavy like I wanted it to be. These go to the gym with me, get thrown in my backpack, thrown on futon or dropped quite often and they have held up just fine. So I have no questions about its durability.
This is the 2nd pair of Sony headphones we purchased for my 13 yr old who listen to music all the time. One side failed this time, first ones the connector wires broke. They didn't even last 1 year.
great gift

These sound great for the price. I have some high end Sennheisers that I keep downstairs with my stereo. I wanted a second pair to use in bed with my iPhone or Kindle and these are great. Comfortable, fold away nicely. No idea how they make something of this quality for the price.
Both pairs that I ordered were broken after a few months.
Awesome sound.. Great price and product. Sony never disappoints..
My daughter loves these headphones and it helps me from being exposed to the boy bands of today, priceless!
GREAT

These work really well. The extra bass can be a broblem with some music so I adjust the EQ on my phone but otherwise they do everything they are supposed to and they do it really well. They even have a mic and a button that work with my Iphone!
It's ok.
perfect!
doesn't match the volume level expected, SONY is usually so much better than this.
Broke within three months.

I am not highly technical or picky on headphones but these definetly are good headphones for someone who is not looking for expensive ones that are good. These are not noise cancelling but they have a good range of mids and the bass is not as the Beats Headphones but are distinctive and can still be felt as a thump; its like they took the speakers from an iPhone 5s and put it in these headphones...that is exactly what it sounds like
I purchased the previous version about two years ago and these are much better. They're much louder and less bulky due to the folding feature.
Great for the $$. Hope the headphones don't start flaking bits og black vinyl like my last pair.

These aren't bad headphones. The sound quality and range are actually very impressive considering the price. My problem with them is that they just don't get loud enough. For some people this might not be an issue. I however, tend to listen to heavy metal with a side of punk so it's obviously a huge issue for people like me. If you aren't hellbent on blowing your eardrums out then by all means buy them, but otherwise I'd suggest spending a few dollars more on something louder.
Good.

The SONY ZX-Series Monitor foldable headphones maximizes your personal audio experience.

These SONY ZX-Series Monitor headphones are perfect for those on the go.

Its unique swivel, folding design collapses the unit so it can be easily stored in the smallest backpack pocket.

Listen to a rich, full-frequency sound that is usually found in Beats or Bose headphones.

Tangle-free cables resists snags so you can get caught up in your music – not your cord.

These foldable headphones include a hidden microphone – seamlessly interfacing with your smartphone.

And the best part is the price – these under-$20 foldable headphones could easily sell for 10 times the price.

Here are the benefits and advantages of these Sony foldable headphones:

– Amazing sound… especially for the super low price… delivers nice solid bass and good clean mids and highs…
– Swivel, folding design is so compact it fits in the smallest part of any backpack…
– Adjustable to fit virtually any size head…
– On-the-ear 30mm dome type headphones are surprisingly comfortable…
– Perfect length cord (almost 4 feet long)… and easily add an extender (see below)…
– Tangle-free cables…
– Tough as nails construction (with soft, cushioned material for our ears)…
– Works on any device with a 1/8″ 3.5 mm CTIA output jack (a.k.a. the “pointy” connector)…
– Employs passive noise cancelling… these foldable headphones shave 15 to 20 decibels (dB) off room noise… cuts about 30% of the noise inside a jet…
– Microphone works on any four-conductor stereo mini plug… works perfectly with Skype/Google Hangouts – even Siri and Google Voice…
– More accurate dictation than using built-in computer microphones…
– Works on any device supporting a Y-type / Plug: L-shaped stereo mini plug…
– The impedance is 24 Ω at 1 kHz.

Here are the downsides of these Sony foldable headphones:

– No in-line volume control (instead relies on device’s volume controls)…
– Too loose and bulky to use for intense workouts (or jogging).

There are a few accessories you might consider buying with the Sony MDRZX110 ZX Series Stereo Headphones:

Cosmos ® PU Leather Protection Carrying Box for LG Electronics Tone LG HBS730 / HBS-750 / HBS-760 / HBS-800 Stereo Wireless Bluetooth Headset - Black
If you are looking to protect your headphones while traveling, this Cosmos hard-shell carrying case is a great – especially as an under-$10 solution.

TRIPP LITE P318-006-MF 3.5mm Mini Stereo Audio 4 Position Headset Extension Cable
To extend the length of these headphones, a 4-pole, mini-stereo plug is needed to work with Sony’s foldable headphones with microphone.

IMPORTANT: Plug in your headphones into the extension cable BEFORE plugging the extension cable into your computer or mobile device. This helps to ensure proper hardware detection.

Sony MDRZX110 ZX Series Stereo Headphones (White)
Finally, if you prefer white foldable Sony headphones, you can order them here (but they do not include a microphone option).

DISCLAIMER:
While lots of companies want to send me free stuff to review, I always pay full price for it here on Amazon.com...

This way, I get to review the product without any pressure.

And I only review the most valuable and joyful products... because I make unboxing videos (then give them away to one lucky person - every day on my website).

I only give 4- and 5- star reviews. If a product does not make the cut, I do not review it here.

Finally, if you found my review helpful, please click "Yes."
These headphones are great! Reasonably comfortable, quality sound, respectable volume, and a good price. I have used these before, and there is a reason they are so popular.

Came in the mail today, and was exactly what i expected. They are great earphones for the price, and pretty light. If you don't want any huge these headphones these are perfect for you. They're on-ear headphones and work great. Would definitely recommend to anyone who needs some cheap light headphones.
My boys love them. No more complaining about sore ears from ear buds.

Love these. For the price I paid the sound is great. I use them on plane rides and at home casually. These are not noise cancelling, but they do seem to work well on the plane to drown out the engine noise.

Very inferior to other headphone set. The sound is weak and the bass is mediocre. There are others out there that's built much better with better sound quality. One for example is the Intone I60 Lightweight Folding 3.5mm Stereo Over-ear Headphones Portable Stretch Headsets Earphones Leather Earpad with Build-in Microphone and Control Button for All Smartphones,laptops,tablets,pc,mp3/mp4,psp,ipod. It's only for a few dollars more but you'll see that the quality is there and the sound is much richer with better bass. My biggest problem I have with this Sony headphone is the built quality. It's very flimsy and just feel very cheap(well, granted it is inexpensive) but there are others out there that's better. I'm really let down by the brand Sony. The packaging is inadequate as well, a simple plastic cover over a thin cardboard and a plastic mold holding the headset. You'll see what I mean if you still decide to order one after reading this review. I really think a customer can do much better than this headphone. Don't buy it just because of brand loyalty because you'll only be disappointed. Sony is a great company with many great superior products but unfortunately this one is not one of them.

You get what you pay for. The jacks on these headphones are terrible. The first time my jack stopped delivering sound I attributed it to me being tough on them - but this was after six months of everyday use. But when the next pair crapped out after only two months I'm pretty sure the problem is the product - not me.

WOW ... I'm blown away about how great these sound. Super comfortable and the mic also works well. My freinds say I sound better on the mic than I do talking directly on my iphone! haha ... I'm going to look into more sony headphones now. These are amazing.

I used to have the earlier version of these headphones where you couldn't speak into them, now I can do every thing. I wear them all the time. I can't wear earbuds and these fit just like the old one did. No problems.
I had a pair of other headphones like these but the fit gave me a headache. These were great.

Inexpensive with good sound and material quality. They aren't the same quality as Beats but then again these headphones aren't over $100 either. If you want a decent set of headphones and don't want to spend a ton of money then these are a great bargain. You can wear them to the gym and if they grow legs or get damaged then you won't be too upset. They look good and are comfortable to wear. They have held up to normal use with no signs of wear. I'd definitely recommend these headphones.

Works great! I listen to music, class lectures, and netflix with this thing! I've read other reviews saying the quality isn't great, but the people writing those reviews are either musicians, singers, or were using these headphones in a professional setting. Those people have higher expectations and probably need to look for a more professional headphone, but if you just want to listen to youtube videos, spotify, pandora, netflix, this is the headphone for you.

These work great. I use them to watch movies/video on my mac when the family is watching tv in the same room. I'm not an audiophile so I'm not looking for superior sound. I hear bass and treble clearly and thats good enough for me. The fit is comfortable even during long periods of use. The length is perfect for desktop use and I have enough slack to turn around or sitback when watching a movie. I've had these for over a year and a half and am still happy with my purchase. They work and look like they did when I first bought them.

Are you kidding me?! At this price, these are unbeatable. Folding design, distinct mellow base, and excellent sound. Compared to my daughter's Beats by Dre and the Beats have better clarity and treble and they block outside sound better, but at about 10x the cost, these are a far better value. Very enjoyable...buy a pair of these for low cost and then see how you like on ear headphones BEFORE you buy the Beats or Bose units. Undoubtedly the Beats/Bose are far superior, but these are really good and you will get a good idea of whether an upgrade is really the way you want to go. Awesome deal!

Best sub-$25 headphones you can possibly get. The sound is even and full.

Pros:
- Cheap (price)
- Good solid bass
- Easy to drive from a phone or iPod
- Look halfway decent

Cons:
- Cheap (construction), my son has gone through like 3 pairs in the past 2 years. The plugs always wear out.
- Mediocre soundstage (for $15-$20, what are you expecting, these aren't Sennheisers)

Honestly, if you need cheap headphones for a teenager or for your second set - just get them. You won't regret it.

Very comfortable headphones that provide excellent sound quality. I like how the cord is long so you can use these even when you are on the treadmill. Music comes through very clearly, and your ears are not compressed to the point of discomfort.

Most of the time, when something is this inexpensive, the product probably sucks. But not this time-- I highly recommend these affordable, comfortable headphones from Sony.

Great fit on these very comfortable headphones! I can wear them for hours and have no problems with pressure on my ears or head. The sound is perfect! Strong bass and clear instrumentals and vocals. Its easy to press the button on the microphone and answer calls without digging your phone our of your pocket. It is also great for plugging into game console controllers to use as a microphone for gaming.

I used them daily, but didn't treat them roughly and I had an older pair of headphones that looked like these that lasted for years without these problems. Still for the price, I don't know if you'd expect more!

I was going to order the same ones, but opted for these instead because of the mic option. My mom often calls me in the morning during my gym session, so having to take off my headphones to talk on the phone was an inconvenience and threw off my entire workout. The sound quality is excellent; once I turn my music loud, I can't hear or see anyone else. These are definitely worth the money. BEATS WHO????

Between the earbud and this over ear, i must admit the earbuds are much better sounding for music. But these $20 over ear headphones are a great balance of great music sound and phenomenal phone voice quality sound. A nice touch is the ample and not to much length of the cord. Its just the right length. Thats where these earphones edge out my $23 inearbud set. Both are a great buy worth your time and every penny.

I don't know if the expensive ones get around this problem somehow. Also, I bought these rather than earbuds because I don't like sticking loud music directly up against my ear drums. I purchased Sony MDRZX110AP ZX Series Extra Bass Smartphone Headset with Mic to listen to music from my phone at work. I've owned this for about a week now, and for my intents and purposes, I love this headset. However, for my personal audio preferences, not so much.

PROS:
1. Lightweight - This headset is very light comparing to other headsets that I owned.
2. Mic - Since I connect this headset to my phone, it is useful to have the mic to also be able to answer incoming phone calls without taking my headset off.
3. Compact - The earpieces folds really nicely into a flat shape (unlike the Sony MDR7506 or Audio-Technica ATH-M50 which are still bulky even when folded).
4. $20 - It is a very cheap headset. No argument there.

CONS:
1. Sound quality - Rather than "extra bass", it feels to me more like "weak mid and high". Everything feels mumbled.
2. Comfort - I use this headset at work (which means this thing sticks on my ear for a long period of time in a day, everyday), and on-ear headsets aren't the most comfortable headset.

All things considered, this is a very low price for a headset, but if audio quality and comfort is more important to you, I'd suggest putting in an extra $4.50 for something like the Sennheiser HD 202 II (I use these personally at home for music editing, and at time of writing this review it's sold for $24.50 at Amazon). For my use at the office, however, these MDRZX110AP ZX works perfectly.
