Sound - Well, it's nothing for an audiophile, but it's great for just about anyone else! Sound quality is crisp, smooth, no static or anything, just overall perfect. The bass isn't anything compared to iBeats but it's much better compared to Apple iPod earphones, and it's pretty good for $10.

Comparisons/Durability - 4.5 - I put these through a lot of abuse, wearing them pretty much 9-12 hours a day. This includes constant yanking out of the laptop, (they are so well-fitted in my ear, that its nearly impossible for them to yank out of my ear, thank god.), bending the wire, listening to music on-the-go (while running/walking), stepping on them, and so much more. The longest pair I had lasted about 5 months, until I accidentally dropped them in a bucket of water for hours. When I took them out, only the right side worked. The next pair I had lasted for 4 months, until my foot got caught on the wire and the left wire was disconnected from the earphone, so only the right side worked. Alongside that 2nd pair, I had purchased Skullcandy Ink'd Earbuds, which cost considerably more than these. I am not a fan of earbuds like those, and the fit was terrible regardless of which earbud size I used. The sound quality was also very poor. And alongside the Ink'd and my broken 2nd pair of Sony's, I had some JVC earphones. The sound quality was much better than Ink'd, although not as good as Sony's. Alas, the fit was rather uncomfortable. Which led me to buy yet another pair of Sony MDRE9LP Ear buds. My 3rd pair, the one I am now, is about a week old and I love them Another thing I likeabout them is how simple they look, and the colors/design of them. I've had blue, purple and now black. They are great earphones and I recommend them to anyone.

Comfortable - 5/5 - They fit great on my ears, with or without the earpads they supply.(In general, I tend to rip the earpads after a few days, but regardless of that, they are still comfy.) They have never come out so far. Regardless of how many times they've been yanked, they've always managed to stay in. It's a lightweight design and it's enough that if I don't have music playing, I'll even forget that I'm wearing them. They're not a bother and I can wear them for very long stretches at a time, the longest I've worn them being about 8-10 hours.

I recommend these to pretty much everyone, from the lightweight music listener to the diehard teenager.

These suck. A few years ago, I bought the Sony MDRE10LP (note the slight difference in model number) and they were the best! Now, it seems like Sony doesn't make those anymore, and this is their replacement.

This new iteration is so much worse. I'm using the former model as my basis for comparison, since both were around the same price. What I did was to listen to a song with the old ones, and then play exactly the same song but using the new pair. In comparison, the bass is non-existent and the treble is weak. Sound quality is low and lacks depth. With the switch, the music sounds like the bit rate was halved.

If someone knows of a good pair of affordable ear buds that are equivalent in quality to the former MDRE10LP, please let me know.

Let's be real, these are inexpensive earbuds that do not have an in-ear design. If you want a pair of buds to take to the gym, go running or biking in, then these are great. When you are running or biking out in the city or outside of a gym in general, for safety reasons, you don't want earbuds that go inside your ear canal to create that "soundproof seal" that blocks all outside noise. If I am sitting on a subway or at home or on a treadmill then the situation is different and in-ear buds that create that seal are what I prefer over these ones. I use these mostly for listening to music and podcasts during exercise. They sound decent and if they get sweaty they are cheap so no big deal so they fit my needs perfectly.

UPDATE 4/14/17: These headphones are still going strong! Still have good sound even though I use them for hours every day. The occasional crackling still happens, but it goes away if wiggle them around in the jack a bit.

There are two things I really like about these headphones: 1) the type of wire casing they use. On a lot of headphones (*cough*Apple*cough*) the rubber casing disconnects/rips exposing the wires, which I HATE. These headphones are a bit more old school in that the wires are fully encased in the tight, flexible plastic-y rubber, the kind that lasts forever. 2) the type of bud. I hate the elongated rubbery buds you have to shove deep into your ear canal. They don't fit my ears well, and are uncomfortable to use if you're laying on your side. Since I usually fall asleep with my headphones in, that's a major issue for me. These ones fit a little looser and fall out occasionally, but they're much more comfortable for me.
This is my second pair of this brand of headphones. The old ones lasted almost a year-and-a-half (wearing them daily for a majority of the day), which I found very impressive. The sound in the buds grew slowly fainter until finally one of the buds gave out. If this pair lasts as long, I will be satisfied.
The only annoying thing about these is that occasionally they crackle. That's not a deal breaker for me, though.

In the less than $15 headphones arena, this is the winner! I've used Gummy, Philips, and all of the headphones in the price range, even the newest Apple headphones and a few of the pricier ones. Maybe it's just the way my ears are shaped, but these are the most comfortable earbuds I've ever owned. I've easily had them in my ears for eight to ten hours at a time without any pain whatsoever. They are so comfortable, I frequently forget that I am wearing them.

While most other earbuds come with silicon padding, these don't, and that's why I love them. I absolutely despise earbud padding; I frequently eat while watching videos with my earbuds in. Earbuds with padding amplify the sounds in my head so the sounds of chewing are louder than whatever I'm listening to. Not with these. With these, you can eat whatever you want with these in and you'll never hear yourself chew.

These are definitely the best earbuds you can buy for less than $10.

Other things that are just personal preference: these don't come with a volume control and some would say that the bass isn't very strong. Both of these things make me very happy. A volume control is unnecessary, as everything I plug these earbuds into has its own volume control, and I prefer low bass so that I can actually hear what I'm listening to.

My only complaint is that the cord could stand to be a bit longer, but that's almost never an issue for me.

Great price. They work well. Nice and long for you tall folks.

I wanted to write an update. I've now had these earbuds almost two years and I want to change
my review to 5 stars! They still work GREAT! These earbuds have far outlasted any I've had before

I have bought Sony earbuds for years for my iPod because of the quality of sound.This is my last time. They have already fallen apart and lasted a very short time. I don't expect them to last forever but 6 months to a year I think is reasonable. The sound is fine but the wires are thin and flimsy.. It comes apart at the earbud and it can't be put back together. I am now going to try another brand.

Well, seeing the decent reviews of this product—and trusting the Sony brand—I thought I'd give them a shot. Mistake. I thought I was plugging them in incorrectly or something. Nope: the problem is that there is no bass response in these earbuds. I switched them back and forth between the Apple EarPods and there is NO comparison. The EarPods blow them away.

I can't wear the "in ear" type earphones that plug the canal (too dangerous for me to block out all external sound), so I guess I'll spend the thirty bucks for the real Apple deal. Maybe there's a similarly performing non-Apple product around the fifteen or twenty range? Anyway, do yourself a favor and skip these if you care at all about hearing the lower half of your music. If you only listen to lectures and don't care about natural sound, maybe you'll be fine.

The headphones are durable and will last for years if well taken care of .The sound is sharp. I have had 3 pairs not because they broke but rather because I lost them . Great but for the money. I got them for $8 bucks via Amazon . I even spent $10 which is still a good buy

Quality that can be expected of a brand like SONY. They are really great top notch cheapos. Dont spend less than about $10 for a pair of buds and dont trust other no-name companies. These wont beat say a $30 pair of SONY's but they do work the sound is good and so is the base. Good for the everyday car ride/train/ commute. But obviously if you need better quality spend more money. But for me, these are just right. Cant blast them all the way up to max or you'll get a perma static and they will start to die. So as I said, top notch cheapos but if you need real high quality .. still go for SONY (I like them) or other brand and just spend more money. But my headphones take a bit of punishment over time. Yanking by mistake or taking them off when Im on pc and dropping them to the ground, not tossing carelessly but I dont really bother to set them down with the utmost care. So these are good for runners and people who work out and they might last a few months, maybe I'll update when they go dead but I dont think itll be soon as SONY does make good quality stuff. Buy them! For $10 its good bang for the buck. I will be buying again or I might move up to buying $20 SONY's, $20 SONY's are a real safe bet in terms of bang and buck.

The earbuds themselves don't have the best-quality sound, but for $10 earbuds, you can't really expect that. However, if you're looking for something cheap that will last a long time, look no further!

When I first plugged them into my iPod and listened, I was taken by quick surprise. WHAT'S WRONG WITH THESE EARBUDS?

The sound quality was terrible. The song didn't sound good at all; there was no bass coming from these earbuds. This resulted in a tinny, weak sound. I'm not an audiophile by any means, but I can tell the difference between my old earbuds and these (and I compared them by switching them out back and forth; noticeable difference).

I wouldn't recommend these earbuds at all. Luckily, I had ordered two different pairs of earbuds from Amazon at the same time. I think you really get what you pay for. I don't like those earbuds that stick deep into your ear, so I tend to get this less intrusive form factor. If you want to stick with SONY, I'd recommend the earbuds with the case, model No. MDR-E828LP. The case isn't necessary, but the earbuds are much better. I've bought them multiple times, and they happen to be the second pair I bought along with these bad ones here. Using those right now and I'm satisfied. It costs a bit more, but it's worth the quality in my opinion. However, if you want to stick around this price range, or you want a white-based earbud, I'd go with the JVC Gummys. They have good sound quality for this form factor, and I've used them a couple times. I don't think they last very long though, as I bought these new SONY earbuds because my JVC burnt out on the left earbud. But they're cheap, and once again, you get what you pay for. Just in the case of these SONY MDRE9LPs, it's not even worth $8.

These are my default go-to headphones. This is my second time purchasing them. My previous ones didn't break but I'd lost them (I'd had them for almost 4 years at that point). I'm not an expert in ear buds and don't know anything about the sound quality that other people have been talking about, but these are good for day to day use; I'm a grad student and they're great to listening to lectures, watching videos or listening to music while studying. Sometimes I even go to sleep listening music and after sleeping on them, they're still working great.
Works well, doesn't fall out of my ears, very durable, and good sound quality. My friends have also had their same ones for over 2 years!

I have a genetic hearing impairment & I am also a radio buff, (big time) In the past, have tried various other Brands but, continue to stay with Sony as these offer the best clarity. I currently own the Sony Mdr-E10Lp earbuds, and have re-purchased them several times (have been my favorite for years). Now that it has been over a year with my current pair it was time to get a new pair. I found that the Sony Mdr-E9Lp were the newer version of favorite earbuds, and i was expecting at least quality equal to that of the older version.

When i got the earbuds, i had nothing to complain about the packaging and product design is almost identical to the Sony Mdr-E10Lp, except the stem on the earbud itself is much shorter than its predecessor. Everything seemed fine, until i pressed play on the music with these. The sound was a disaster. There is no bass, volume of sound is dramatically decreased, sound is muffled. Even with different music and video players, there was no improvement. I was so disappointed. I don't know if i received a defective pair of earbuds or if this is what the product is. I would not recommend these, even for just music traveling needs.

Now to the hopes that I can continue to purchase the Sony Mdr-E10Lp earbuds, which offer a much better, impressive sound quality.

Pretty sure these are counterfeit. I ordered MDRE9LP/BLK Earbuds. Instead of the normal Sony packaging they came in a weird little ziplock bag kind of thing with the text "Original high quality best accessories".On the back is the text "Accessories There is no best only better products. Enjoy the best quality Made in China". No mention of Sony on the packaging they came in anywhere. There is a label stuck on the back that says Sony black MADE IN CHINA. I opened them up and there are white earbuds inside, not black. They actually look more like MDRE9LP/GRAY. However, the printing on the side is so faint you can barely even see it and the parts don't seem to have a good fit. I actually had to put reading glasses on to read the logo. Sony is usually pretty good about making sure you can see their logo on their products and I don't think they usually ship them in a bag that says Best Accessories, Original High quality. I am actually not totally against cheap Chinese products when I know that is what I am buying, but I shouldn't have to worry about buying counterfeit merchandise from Amazon. That is what ebay is for.

I have used a variety of ear buds and I can honestly say these are just 'meh.' The main issue I have with these is the design of the wires going into the ear bud. If you look at the photo below you see the wire is on a rail system, however they added a gap just big enough to make the wires to the ear buds have the ability to move up and down. Because of this mobility the wire actually creates this popping sound if you move your head up and down or side to side. At first I thought it was something wrong with the audio or maybe I had my speakers too high. I tested it and on the lowest setting pops still remained if I barely moved my head. Sound overall is pleasant nothing to write home about, but it gets the job done. I must say if I had the choice of buying these again I would on the condition they fix that gap problem. Guess I will be looking for some new headphones for the new year.

pros:
---comfortable enough for any ear = curve / size
---very surprising bass response, and detailed mid's (a tin bit muffled - must be EQ 250-300 hz should be lowered down )
----Can be compared or even compete with x5 overpriced Sennheiser CX 300 II Precision, however only if dressed in a foam pads, included with this Sony earbuds, otherwise bass would be much weaker!!!
---stereo-phonics / pan spectrum pretty interesting,entertaining enough
---L shape 3 mm connector
cons:
---as always wires can be tangled easily, though compering to Sennheiser they are not transmit any noise from touching your cloth/body

The good thing about these headphones are that they look great and are very very comfortable. The bad thing about these headphones is pretty much everything else. The sound quality of these is absolute garbage. There is no bass whatsoever and music sounds tinny. I've had to replace at least 5 of these before I realized I was stupid for buying them after I suffered the same issue with each pair. I originally bought these from my local Target which carries a lot of these in stock. The problem with these earbuds is that the cable connecting the earbuds and the 3.5mm jack is flimsy. All of my previous pairs of these earbuds died because the sound in one of the earbuds would just stop working effectively making this an earbud for only one of your ears. This is because over time, the cable would stretch and break a connection to one of the earbuds. I know what you're thinking, but I don't recklessly yank or pull my earbud cables either. I've been babying my last few pairs to try to make them last as long as possible, but each of them inevitably dies on me. In addition, the foam padding that is included in the packaging that would be used to cover the earbuds for comfort would always become loose and eventually fall out. To be honest, if you need a cheap set of earbuds, you could look literally anywhere else. BUT I would highly recommend that if you wanted to buy comfortable earbuds that look good and sound good too, invest in a pair of Apple earbuds. Just be careful of buying them online because there's a lot of fake ones around. I'm not an Apple fanboy but I can't deny that my Apple earbuds are pretty good sounding and comfortable too.

These are a good choice for a cheap set of earbuds. I use them for audio books for long spans. The quality/price is great for that application. I break/replace them every few months, but it is not a design flaw. The have broken when I stepped on them in work boots, dropped them in the sink while doing dishes, smashed them in the car door.... I am really tough on earbuds. I've owned 8-9 brands over the years, and these are the only ones that seem to break only under tough abuse. I've had other brands that break if you drop them, or the cord frays under normal usage, etc. A good buy if you looking for basic, tough earbuds.

This is my second purchase. I bought Jose 4 years ago and they are great. Loud and clear just the way I like it. I just found out (5 min ago) that my cat chewed on my old ones and they stopped working. But they are great!!

I have a Sony MP3 player & the headsets that came with it broke. I thought Sony earbuds should sound the same as the broken ones I had right? WRONG! These are HORRIBLE!!!!!! No bass & no devision between right & left side! Garbage ONLY & should be avoided at all cost!!!! Spend a few dollars more & get a better quality set because you will totally waste your money, like I did, on these!!!!!

I gave this item 1 star because I had to send it back. Now, I will make this clear that I could have easily received a defective item, however, I do not go back to a design from a particular brand if I don't get one working the way I want it to from the get-go.

These had excellent sound, however, even with the power off these earphones would make a plastic "clink" sound. If I gave the wires slack, no noise. Any tension on there and it would make a noise that crackled in my ear. I use these at the gym and hearing that noise was incredibly annoying.

As always, Amazon refunded 100% of the cost which is why I continue to buy from them.

I've gotten earphones that sound better from the dollar store. They're not very loud & have no bass at all. The music sounds hollow. The only reason I kept them is because it makes no sense to return them since they're cheap. I've only used them once since I bought them. Do not recommend.

I'm giving these 2 stars just because of the price. I ordered the pink ones, that say Sony on them. What I received were black earbuds and I don't even know if they are Sony. They look completely different than even the black ones pictured when choosing which color you wanted. The plain white box they came in had a tiny sticker that said Pink and I think it also said Sony on it...but they sure weren't pink. And they weren't even wrapped in plastic or anything, just thrown in the box with some bubble wrap on top. I understand that they came from a company with Overstock in their name, but honestly they could have taken a little more care with these.
It's more of a hassle to worry about returning them so I'm going to keep them, although the sound quality isn't that great. But as they say, you get what you pay for. But I am very disappointed that they weren't pink.

So, these earbuds aren't the most impressive looking I've ever seen but they have one thing going for them that all the nice headphones I've owned have not: they are incredibly durable for cheap earbuds. I tend to fall asleep every night watching something on my phone, which is a compromise I made with my partner who cannot stand having the TV on when falling asleep. This means that I have destroyed at least a dozen pairs of earbuds from just the jostling and stretching of the cord that happens over the course of a night. Without fail, I would always get a good two or three weeks of usage before they one earbud would cease working, and then another week before both earbuds were broken.

I don't even remember how I originally got these earbuds, but after a year of using them without the slightest loss in sound quality (n.b. the quality is perfectly fine for this price point, though not necessarily groundbreaking), I felt I needed to order a second set in case I ever lose them.

Now, since not everyone is odd enough to think it's fine to sleep with earbuds so you can watch Cheers until you fall asleep, this durability does pay off in other ways, specifically in surviving being in a pocket or getting twisted during a workout.

I've bought three of these so far. One set did die and another (the oldest) is getting a little crackly... But they seem to hold up for a while (2 or more years). For the price, I'm certainly pleased.

These fit my ears well, but I'm a smaller guy. If you have bigger ears, these might not hold well.

My previous Panasonic earbuds lasted me 4 years and I decided to go with these Sony earphones since the reviews were good, but these did not hold up to their rating. These are super cheap and are not worth the money I paid. I can't even return them either. Do not waste your money on these headphones. They feel cheap and the plastic is not comfortable in your ears. I tried these out and the sound quality is not clear. You can hear this faint static, or hertz hum. These earbuds are not worth $8, do not buy these.
I love these headphones; they are quality and have lasted a long time. They are still kicking almost a year later, and I use them every day for hours.

I use my earbuds on my lunch break at work, every day. They get a LOT of use, and
even went through the washer a time or two, and work like new. These are great!

They fit in my ear not too tight and not too loose ! i recomend these, THERE LOUD!!!! Blocks out everything els and i hear my music PERFECT :D THEY SHIPPED TO MY HOUSE FAST! in 4 DAYS! Thank Youuu :3 Must Have!!!

Disappointed!
I'm very disappointed with these ear buds, as I got them to replace my old worn out sony ear buds.
The wires are very thin and the sound is terrible compared to my old ones.
I would think the newer ones would have better sound given the technology advances but NO.
If these would have costed more I would have returned them. But they were only a few bucks so I threw them in my junk drawer.
DO NOT buy!

This is the second pair that I've broken in under 2 weeks. You can't just leave them in your pockets, or pull them haphazardly out of your purse because the speaker covers just pop off leaving the little copper interior and wiring hanging out. Plus the sound quality isn't very good. I know they're cheap- but for me they've been highly expensive. I just paid $10/week for bad sound quality.

These earbuds are very similar to the Apple ones (I don't own any Apple products, but I love their earbuds). I love that they sit securely in my ears without having that little bit that extends into your ear canal. I'm not an audiophile, but the sound quality sounds fine to me. I only wish that the cord was a bit shorter (it's standard length, but that always seems a bit too long to me).

I bought a pair of SONY earbuds about 6 years ago and I've had the same pair ever since. I've used this pair nearly every day. I've anticipated them to break, but they haven't, so I decided to order this pair in anticipation for the sad day the crap out on me & I have to put them to rest. The new pair seems quite a bit cheaper from the cord to the plastic on buds. I've noticed with my iPhone the cord has static when the cord is moved around. Have not tried with other sources. Not as good as my other pair so took a few stars off for cheapness of quality.

I have a couple pairs of these i use for my PC for gaming and videos and for my mp3 player when i want to be able to hear whats going on around me. They sound good but more importantly they are very very comfortable. Can easily wear them all day long and barely notice them at all. They are cheap and well worth it buy a couple pairs then if you ruin a pair or lose a pair you have a backup. They are more then cheap enough. I dont use the little foam covers that come with them not sure why anyone would bother with them. When these die i will get another pair just like them or maybe in a different color just for a change.

The Work... That's about all the good I can say. Horrible sound quality. Even for the cheap price the sound quality is not something I can ever imagining Sony putting its name on. There are literally 50 different Ear Buds for the same price here on amazon. Try any one of those before buying these. I wish I had.

When one of the headphones does not work, it is difficult to give it more than 1 star. We have purchased these, or ones like them, in the past and have found them to be just fine. We prefer the "buds" that just sit in your ear over the "in ear" type that never like to stay "in" our ears. We will try again and change the review if both headphones work.

Works great, I have always stuck with this brand. They're comfortable, tangle resistant, and affordable. They usually last me 2-5 years depending on I treat them; if they do break--it's probably because I yanked from far too often from the cracks of my bed frame. Otherwise it's usually human errors.

I bought this model a few years back and loved them. I needed a new set now because I kept dropping my left ear bud into my coffee. Brilliant, I know. So as to decaffeinate my ears, I purchased these. I just did a comparison of my old, coffee-swimming version (which still work), and these new ones. The results: this set's sound quality is horrible. I don't know what the difference is between the set I bought previously and this purchase (model numbers are the same). What I do know is that I won't buy these from this seller again and I will continue to use the set that has one bud dunked in coffee and slightly dampened sound. I can't recommend.

I tend to listen to goof quality of music not FAC or WAV, but acceptable MP3 and this earbuds have been the best, I can listen from Film scores orchestra to some groove metal and the sound does not have any distorsion.

These are the best earbuds i have ever used. I have had many different types, from many different brands, and I simply cant part with these. I often have problems with headphones sounding like im listening to a 1940s radio, and there has not been a single time these have sounded like that. They are durable (Ive put them through the wash on several occasions by accident, no damage done.), they are long lasting (i can use these for month after month after month without the breaking), and they are a very modest price. You cant get any better than these headphones, and i will buy them as long as theyre available.

Cheaply made earbuds, not what I would expect from a Sony product. I used to buy those black Sony earbuds back in the 90's, that came in the round wind-up case. Those were great. I kinda expected that from these. These are like something you'd buy from the 99 cent store. I don't expect Beats, but for 8 bucks, I expect better. I feel they will bust by lightly pulling on them. Cheaply made.
The sound is horrible on these things, sounds really muffled. Like ear buds you'd buy from the 99 cent store. They do not fit well in my ears, they keep popping out when I work out. I've never had this problem before, not even with earbuds from the 99 cent store. I've bought those Gumy brand earbuds from Walmart.com and they sound pretty good for the price, better than these do, and definitely better than earbuds from the 99 cent store.

They had an odd feedback or clicking-like sound when certain beats would pass through them for about the first month or so, but after using them for about five months now, that issue seems to have dissipated and they work great. They are not the best headphones, but then again, I did not expect them to be because they are cheap. I gave them a four out five simply for the weird feedback issue, but I still use them, and I recommend them to anyone who wants some cheap headphones that work yet may not be the best.

I love these. Great quality. The original pair I had since I was in 8th grade. 8th traders are what? Like 14? It’s been nearly 8 years since I graduated high school. They didn’t give out, I just lent them to my irresponsible sister.
I am super picky about earphones as I find most to be uncomfortable so I’m going to buy a crap load of these to always have as backups in case these amazing little things ever stop being produced.

I wanted headphones that were not the in ear kind because most in ear kind are noise isolating and I need to be able to hear outside as well while doing certain tasks. Also the pair of in ear headphones I have now are awesome for music but annoying at the same time because I can hear the cord moving against my chest and hear myself eating while wearing them.

So I bought these earbuds even after reading reviews stating that these headphones were tinny sounding because I wanted them specifically for listening to podcast which is just voice audio and I plan to buy separate headphones for music. They do work great for podcast but when I switched over to some bass heavy songs I have on my iPod Nano there practically is no bass. You can hear the kick of the drum but it's really light. I would have rated these 3 stars but I went to Walmart and bought a pair of JVC Gumy Earbud Headphones Model: HAF14W and those were the same price as these but they're way better overall. The JVC's are also the non in ear kind but the sound quality is significantly better than these both in terms of music and vocal only podcast. I wouldn't recommend purchasing these Sony MDRE9LP headphones but instead go with the JVC Gumy Earbud Headphones Model: HAF14W. If you're too lazy to drive to Walmart you can order them on Best Buy's website.

These headphones are exactly what you're ordering. Average quality at a below average price.

They're decent headphones, and at the price they're at, you don't have to worry about them to much if you lose them. They still function perfectly fine if one of the earpieces gets broken or cut off, the other side still works.

I use these when I don't want to worry about getting my expensive blue tooth headphones damaged, along with acting like a backup, so I've had several over the years and stash some at work and at home and my car. I have never had one stop working from wear and tear, only from accidental destruction.

These are the second pair of these I have owned. The first pair lasted through daily use and abuse for around three years, well beyond the Ipod buds that my Ipod came with. So when they needed to be replaced, I got another pair. Great endurance for the cost and the sound is terrific as well.

Edit: WELL...this pair went bust after a couple months this time around, as the cord got yanked out of the plug. The plug last time seemed to have a better design while this one seemed to have the cords be a bit loser rather than have it be molded to the cord.

Being hard of hearing, I need ear buds that present clear sound. These are excellent. I also prefer the trumpet shape. The bulb type just doesn't work for me. They keep falling out of my ears. Plus, the sound presented is generally low quality.

These ear buds are well priced. So much so that, when the day after I received my order of two pairs and our new pup immediately chewed one pair and chewed the second pair the following day, I didn't have to hesitate to quickly buy two more pairs.

So I'm now struggling to remember NOT to leave them lying casually around the house. But it's going to be tough. In addition to being hard of hearing, I'm also absent minded. Good thing these ear buds are reasonably priced. I might need to order some more.

I've been very happy with these ear buds. I mostly listen to talk radio and have found the sound quality to be very good. I like to listen to podcasts at night to help lull me to sleep. For this purpose, the ear buds have been very comfortable. I can lie on my side and not feel as if the bud is going to puncture my eardrum. They also remain in place and I usually find them intact in the morning, with no discomfort to my ears or ear lobe. There is no volume control attached to one of the wires, but that is not an issue for me. My only complaint is that it is hard to know which bud goes in which ear. They are labeled but the label is hard to read and if I am inserting the buds in the dark I do not know which bud is for which ear. I solved this problem by attaching a small piece of colored tape to the wire of the right ear bud. Hope they last a long time since I have found most ear buds stop working in about a year. If this happens, I would consider buying them again.

These were the kind of inexpensive earbuds I could buy at the grocery store before, but I haven't seen them in a while. They are my favorite type to wear because I don't like things that stick into my ear canal. These just rest at the bottom of the shell of your ear. I guess the drawback is that other people can tell you are listening to something even if they can't fully hear what it is (maybe that's not a bad thing). It's getting harder to find this type of earbud. They are very inexpensive, which is good since they seem to go missing often.

I'm not sure how these have such good positive feedback. They are simply terrible. I bought these to replace a set of Sony headphones that are failing. I needed earbuds that weren't the in-ear style that isolates outside noise, so I could still hear what was going on around me at work. I didn't need highclass sound, just something to listen to some tunes and make the day pass a little faster. These were a severe let down. They worked and are cheap. Those are the only positives. The earbud is too small for my ears, so it fell out constantly. I don't have large ear canals and most earbuds fit me fine. This is the first time I have ever bought a pair of headphones that didn't fit. The worst and most crucial part that these headphones epiclly fail on is the sound quality. They have zero bass. Like negative bass even. I played a song and switched headphones to see if it was in my head and it was like night and day between my old sony's and these headphones. And my old Sony's were not some high quality noise isolation headphones. They were just like these only with a billion times better sound and fit. These things have tiny sound, so you'll have to crank the volume to hear them and crank up the bass to even slightly make up for their total lack of bass response. Save your money.

After after my two pairs of Fontopias lasted 2 years each and six months or so using a pair of Sony earbuds that came with my voice recorder, I decided that I am only buying Sony headsets. Durable and the sound is fine for how I use them -- many hours each day.
Unfortunately, the first pair I bought were these. I listen primarily to audiobooks and podcasts; I also depend on them when exercising.
The thin cord -- too long for armband or collar clip mp3 players -- of this pair makes noise whenever I touch it or it touches my shirt or skin. In other words, they are lousy for exercising!
The sound may be a bit tinny in comparison with my previous pair of Sony freebies.
I've been pleased with Sony headphones in the past, but these are pretty junky and there's a crackle in the left side. Guess you get what you pay for.

My favorite fit of headphones since the Sony MDRE828 is no longer available. Earbuds are slightly smaller but no noticeable difference in feel. Doesn't block out all external noise. No annoying rubber ear plug!

Had these earbuds for almost two weeks and it is freaking amazing. Sound quality is great and it feels comfortable in my ears. WARNING: Never buy headphones from this seller named "Kikimall", their headphones are horrible and will break within 3-4 days after receiving it. Otherwise Sony has perfect headphones and will last you a long time.

After my Sony E10LP headphones stopped working after nearly 2 and a half years, I had to find a new set. I went with these, thinking that surely they were more or less the same as what I had before. Nope.

The previous version had a design that would let you tell left from right ear buds at a touch, which these lack. The other ones had a bass level that I previously hadn't realized was possible in a pair of ear buds, while these have yet to learn that such a thing exists.

Ultimately, I should have stuck with the E10LP and accepted the fact that I couldn't find them in black, rather than bothering with these. They work, they're well built, but ultimately I'm disappointed every time I use them because they're not the previous ones I had.

If I'm completely honest, I'm hoping these die soon so I can justify buying a new pair.
The microphone is horrible. Can't use it to talk over phone on my iPhone. 6s. I tried on Samsung Galaxy - same thing. Looks like microphone is defective.

Prompt delivery, they sound great, but they are so hard & stiff that they hurt my ears. I think these might be an older design because my other Sony earbuds are so soft and comfortable - but I lost them. I will go back to Walgreen's where I bought the comfy ones and re-purchase. These will get thrown into a drawer and stay there forever until I get sick of looking at them and just trash them.
I bought these for my niece for travel and she absolutely loves them. They do not hurt her ear and it blocks out the noise.
I like this style of earbuds. I conveniently found it on Amazon and the price was almost half of what I bought my other pair for.

I use these with my cell phone, the side of cord brushes against the screen of my phone, it clicks on things on my touch screen. It's mildly annoying, but otherwise the ear buds work well. No other objections. Would buy again.
These do not stay in your ear, there is no rubber around the ear piece and the sound is very tinty - and you can not return them

Although the brand is spectacular, this product lacks the quality that one would come to expect from Sony. The sound projection is lacking, and is comparable to that of a children's toy. Bass is not translated through these headphones.
The only ones my son will wear. If you have a small ear canal these are perfect as the rest in your ear instead.

These seem like decent ear buds for the price. Do my earbuds that cost 5x the price sound better? Sure they do, but these have pretty good sound. Of course this is all very subjective. I would buy these again.
My favorite earphones of all time threw them in the washer on accident works perfectly works amazingly still pros durability cons sounds decent
Too Small. Wont stay in my ears. Every time I move my head in the slightest they fall out of my ears. Really disappointed because Sony is usually a really good brand.
Too much base, sound quality comes in muffled. Buds run a little large and are a little uncomfortable, with custom fittings.

So far, so good. It's been working fine since the day I got it and it's my only hope that this would work longer than the other brands I've used before which lasted only a year where either buds conked out. I guess Sony maintains her commitment to quality and durability in whatever product they produce in their production lines. Highly recommended to friends and the community.
I have purchesed many earphones in my life, b7t this earphone is easily tge best one i ever bought. Great sound quality, comfy feel, and actually really durable. Worth the price.

These are the only earbuds that I can use. I have tried many other brands including Gumy by JVC, Skullcandy, and many others and I always keep coming back to these. They have clear sound unlike the many others I've used, which I feel have too much bass to them. I only wish they were available in store and not have to wait for them to arrive in the mail.

This is not the SONY EARBUDS that I thought they were.
The one I had in the past you could plug into your digital piano keyboard
and it brought out great lows thru the highs. They were of longer length
and better audio.
They work for a computer.
Will keep them just for computer back up.
Again, no good for digital piano keyboards.
It's too bad that there's not a model number on these
earbuds that keep changing shape and details.
Typical electronic/digital corporations that never
show a better update on these "small" items.

These are great, stylish and effective earbuds for a low price. The powerful sound they give off makes them perfect for wearing casually or at the gym. I personally enjoy wearing them on a daily basis. Whether it be listening to music or watching movies on Netflix from my cell phone, I love how clear the sound is. I am even thinking of buying them in other colors – you can never go wrong with a few extra pairs of headphones lying around.

Product is not the best quality but it will do. I plugged headphones into my phone and when I turned the plug in it made static noise. Also, it doesn't have a volume + - control on the headphones, which I apparently overlooked before ordering the item
These are the first pair that don't fall out of my ears... Good sound , good product for the moneyi

I know I shouldn't expect much for this price, but being Sony I thought they would be better. The headphones sound tinny and distant, and readily jump out of my ears (of course, this is a personal issue, but annoying nonetheless). I do appreciate that they aren't the type of headphones that you have to stick into your ear canal, and I can fall asleep listening to music as they aren't very uncomfortable. I wish they had better sound though!

Not bad for the price but I've gotten headphones for cheaper with better sound quality. Music almost sounds like it is far away and if you turn the sound up the quality gets distorted. If you like music with a lot of bass these are not the headphones for you.

I cannot believe that anyone would give these an even decent rating. I can only conclude that there is a quality control issue. The set I got is below acceptable. Very tinny. No bass. Better sound quality from a soup can with a string.

I have spent more money on ear buds which did not last as long as the Sony ones have. I have a teenage daughter that was going through a pair a month until we found the Sony ear buds. They lasted for 6 months and the ones she has now are 3 months and going strong. I will keep on buying the Sony ear buds because they last and I love the colors. We have bought 3 pairs in the last year and only replaced 1 pair. They fit well in the ear and you cannot beat the price for a quality product.

These are great headphones. They provide clear and layered sound. They feel comfortable and fit nicely in my ears. The feature of the sound being focused toward the front of the ear pieces is really smart. They are loud without being glaring. No one near me can hear anything at full sound. They also block out sounds around me very well.

Great earbuds - I had this exact same pair in gray and they lasted FOREVER. I got these as a replacement when those finally gave out. The only reason I gave this four stars instead of five is because the cord on these seems a little thinner then my old ones, and they should be identical. They still work great but I don't like how floppy the cord is. I still recommend them though!
Good high sounds but virtually no Mids or Bass for earbuds. Very hollow sound. Don't fit ears well and want to pop out. Do not recommend. Found better $2-3 earbuds in the past.
These are my favorite kind of ear buds because they are smaller than a lot of the common ones and they are more comfortable.

Pretty much exactly what you can expect is what you get. Good quality but not amazing sound. They fit well in my ears and they lasted for a while but eventually the circular part will come detached from the rest of the headphone which can cause some problems with the wiring and lead to loss of sound in one ear. Overall they are worth the price and if you want headphones without the squishy parts (which don't seem to fit in my ears) just for casual use or at the gym, then these are a solid choice.
Exactly as ordered, good sound, comfortable fit. My son does not like the ones that poke more into your ear, these are just what he wanted.

I had these earbuds before and they work great, except the only reason why I am giving this 1 star is because I received it with the actual sony package opened, and it look like it was used! I don't know if my is really "new."
I needed something cheap for work. Got what I paid for! Bass is terrible, and can't really hear out the buds. This should be an add on item.

These appear to be cheaply made and the sound is a bit tinny, but I just use them for listening to podcasts while I exercise. So for that purpose I suppose they are OK.

I mistakenly thought I lost them, for a week. I was about to buy another set of earbud headphones, and to tell the truth, I was going to look at other brands.

On the positive side, the price was pretty good when I bought them. I do like the purple color.
These earbuds are horrible. I have the previous earbuds the Sony mdr e818lp fontopia and these are nothing like them. I have freebies I got with my Samsung phone few years ago that are better.
Sound quality wasn't as good as I thought it was going to be. A little bit disappointing. I would return them but return shipping is about the price of the item. I wouldn't buy again or recommend.

You can't get better earbuds for the money. This was a replacement set for my last pair of Sony's. They are very comfortable. I just got a new iPhone that came with earbuds - and those are horribly uncomfortable compared to these. These stay in place while I'm working out, and they don't hurt my ears. They don't slip out when I perspire.

The bass isn't all that great but they fit comfortably in my ears and don't fall out. I found that the grey part that goes over the wires constantly pops off but it snaps right back on. Over all you get what you pay for, but I think they are worth it.

I bought these years ago at Wal-Mart, but couldn't find them after they broke earlier this year so I had to buy them online. Literally the best headphones I've ever used. I barely have to turn up the volume with these (unlike every other ones I've tried) because the audio is so good, and they lasted me YEARS (around 4) before I had to buy new ones.

We had bought a set a couple years ago, at a retail store, they are still going strong being used everyday. We decided to buy a couple more as back ups. Sound quality is excellent for ear buds. Worth the price. Sony MDRE9LP/BLK Ear Buds
Cost me $8 but these are worth every penny in my opinion sound great maybe better than most ear buds that are over priced and fast shipping thanks

Got 'em for my husband's laptop & he's very happy with them. Said he didn't realize how bad his older ones were. Now he can listen to everything, especially music w/o putting his volume to the max.....actually, he had to lower it quite a bit bc they work so well.

I paid about $2 for these headphones a year and a half ago and they finally shorted out yesterday. I wasn't exactly kind to them either; they were frequently yanked, twisted into knots by my pockets, banged against things, and on one occasion submerged in water. The first week I used them, they were a little uncomfortable to have in my ears, however I think my ears got used to them or something because it wasn't a problem long. I don't know why, ask science. A year after I started using them, there was a decline in audio quality. The sound quality is mediocre, but if you're buying something this cheap it's to be expected. I highly recommend this product.
Still,love these ear buds, fit inside the ear canal well. Well made, durable.

With my ears I can't comment on the audio quality other than it sounds ok except for the fact there's very little base. I'm not too happy about these ear phones physically. The wires are small flimsy and tangle easily. My overall impression is cheap. But then at the price, of course it is.

The only earbuds I'll buy! I have really small ears so it is hard to find ear buds that will stay in my ear without falling out and these are perfect. The sound is pretty standard. Nothing mind blowing but they do a good job. I did like the previous model with a longer colored stem but I've gotten used to the smaller one. Highly recommended!

My headphones had a defective left earphone.
I realize these are inexpensive earphones at $10, problem is that they sound and feel like $1earphones.
Sub par materials, feel and performance.
Not sure if the following properties are standard or a further result of being defective.
Sounds very tinny,
no bass at all.
Very limited frequency range.
If you can, spend a few dollars more on better bud earphones. Frankly I'm surprised that sony makes these sub standard earphone at any price.
Oct 1, 2017
Someone made a comment today about my evaluation of these earphones. I definitely got a defective pair as the other customer suggested. Could have been a bad batch, it happens. That being said, it suggests poor quality control. Also Sony never bothered to follow up on the defective pair I received.
Just to clarify, the ear buds I received were defective out of the box. The poor sound quality and faulty left ear bud wasn’t due to me not taking proper care of them.

My 6th grade needed
These for school. So
Far they are still working good. He likes the color.

They are not as loud as I would like them to be. I wish they had more bass in them. Also, at times they tend slip out of your ear when you don't want them too. The Sony MDRE828LP/SLV were one of my favorite earbuds until it was discontinued. I'm not really a fan of the earbuds that are supposed to wedge in your ear (i.e. noise cancellation), so hopefully Sony will have earbuds similar to MDRE828LP model earbuds.

There were a lot of great reviews, so I was expecting more from these bad boys. They fit comfortably, and they're obviously more stylish than your typical buds, but the sound was kind of tinny and hollow. They were pretty cheap, but if you keep searching, you could probably find a similar sound for a dollar or two less. Up to you if you think it's worth it!

I use them pretty regularly when I don't want to use my nicer (read: bigger, clunkier) headphones though, so it's not like they're bad.

For the price ($8) I really can't complain. There isn't much bass but the earbuds are comfortable and the sound is adequate, though muffled, for what I use them for. If you are really into music then maybe this isn't the best buy but for everyday uses like exercising and cleaning they are great. Didn't fit right until I put the foam things they came with on but now they fit great and don't fall out.

Weak, empty sound from poorly designed earbuds.

Sony knows how to make a great earbud with a healthy sound and deep bass response, yet these have neither. While I might normally give a product at this price point a break, I can't really do that here because I've been buying similarly priced Sony earbuds on here for years that sound incredible and since that model has been discontinued, I figured I'd take a chance with these.

That was a mistake. Pay a little more, get something better than these.
These are excellent earbuds! My husband had tried some other ones, in the same price range, but really liked the sound quality of these the best.
They're pretty much what you'd expect for $8 ear buds. The sound is super tinny, barely any base. Their base models used to sound better. Honestly, spend a little more and get something else.
Sound is good (listen to audiobooks only) but can not comment on longevity. The wires are considerably thinner than the previous mdl of Sony earbuds I purchased.

These are the first Sony headphones I purchase and I must say I am pleased with the product. I like the size and sound quality. They are literally just as described, which I appreciate. I also received them sooner than I expected, so that is was definitely a plus. I definitely recommend this product if you are looking for a quick headphone purchase.

My go-to ear buds. I got my second set after the first one stopped working(after nearly 3 years of use and numerous accidental dunkings in water and accidental slamming into the walls and floor). The sound quality is pretty good too.
These are some very comfortable earphones, and they play loud and clear!
They don’t last to long. This is a temporary fix until you can get some better buds.
Love the size. Sound quality isn't the greatest (very low base even for buds) but they get the job done.

I've used it for couple of years and it stills works great. However, the plastics feel a little cheap. I had bought a similar one previously from target and it worked for 3 years. The plastic felt a lot better than this one did. Less slippery and also heavier?

I ordered these and a pair of Sony MDR-PQ5 ear phones to replace my failed MDR-ED12LP phones. The ED12's fit me perfectly and sounded great and I was hoping these would be as good. The PQ5's are close, I'm not sure they sound quite as good but that may be because they don't insert into my ear as fully as the ED12's did. They're definitely not as comfortable.

On the other hand, the E9LP model sounded terrible and didn't fit my ears at all. The PQ5's stay in my ears pretty good, but the E9LP's won't stay in without using the foam covers and I ended up ripping one of the covers stretching it over the earphones. Soundwise, the E9LP's sound comparable to the Samsung phones that came with my Galaxy S4. In other words, terrible.
The plastic covering over the speaker came off on mine after a short time. They're cheap, so you might get your money's worth, but I would just save up and get a nice pair that will last.

For the money - these kick a$$! I've spent less than 5$ a few times and they're not for music. These, for less than 10$, make music a lot more enjoyable. They actually fit well too. I imagine that helps the sound as well as the overall experience.

They work well but after a while they stop working. I purchased this product over a month or so ago and I only used them a few times since I am not a fan of headphones and the right earbud stop working properly. At first I thought it had be me who broke the ear bud which didn't make sense to me since I take care of them well and hardly use them but my sister also had the same issue, therefore, I am giving this product two stars since the product does not last very long but it works great while it does.

Fits really comfortably in the ear and the sound is amazing. For the price, I don't think I could have gotten anything better.

EDIT: Broke after six weeks. :(

These earbuds are a great color and quality seems fine. However, the ear pieces are really big and don't fit my ears. They are huge, really. It hurts to wear them. Don't buy them unless you have very large ears.
I got these as a replacement of my cheap set I use for walking to work. I lost my old pair, and I was searching for a nice budget pair of headphones to listen to podcasts. Audio is crisp.
These are my favorite earbuds! I have bought these numerous times! Love them!! :)

A good set of earbuds for the price - great alternative for those who do not like the in-canal style earbuds. They seem fairly well made. The cord feels very securely attached the the speaker. They are comfortable to use as well, even without foamies. The sound quality is very poor on these however. They are good for things like podcast and audiobooks but I would not recommend these for music. To that end, these were a good buy.
These came in pretty fast but the reason why I wouldn't recommend these is the awful sound quality. I regret my purchase.

The sound of an ear bud is very unique to each individual's ears. To me, these are way to tinny and not enough bass. Sony makes excellent buds, but I will not get this model again. Also the wire to the plug is already shorting out for me after 2 weeks.

If you want mid-range, and that's all you want, these are for you. There are far better earbuds on the market at a similar price. They aren't awful, but other manufacturers are producing better products at the same price point. Keep looking.

I mean most headphones are the same, you can only really tell if your like an audiophile...right?

apparently not

Terrible sound quality

It's so weak and not full sounding at all

Sorry to say that the previous negative reviews are pretty much spot on. I've previously used several sets of the now discontinued MDR-E10LP and loved them. The discontinued model had excellent sound quality for the price, they were comfortable in the ear and had a flexible cable, it was also easy to tell right from left even in the dark.

The new model MDRE9LP is a disappointment for all the same reasons. Sound quality is significantly worse than the discontinued model, they don't fit my ear very well (slightly larger earpiece?), the cable is a bit more stiff and holds a kink from packaging and they are symmetric making it hard to tell right from left.

Might have gone with two stars if I was feeling generous, but that would mislead readers. These do have the short right angle connector that I like, but that's it. I'll be looking for another simple earbud... these don't do it for me. Definitely NOT recommended.

My goal was to get the cheapest decent earbuds that did not go "in" your ear (something makes me uncomfortable about jamming up my ear canal with foam or whatnot). These fit the bill and the sound quality is fine. My only complaint is they are shaped identical enough that you can't differentiate right from left without reading them. An alternative is to look for what side the "big" hole is on (if it's on the right, it goes in your right ear), but the hole is still not "big" enough to easily feel with your fingers. Still, I guess the sound would be in stereo anyway so the worst case scenario's not so bad.
Great service, fast shipping, will order again, thank you

These earbuds arrived wayyy earlier than expected, and I tested them and they fit and sound great!!These were better than the apple earbuds, but I would've liked to have the button
Overall I loved the product and I would totally buy it again

Then suddenly they started actually SHOCKING my ears from time to time!!! Soon after one side of the earbuds broke and stopped working. I ended up throwing them out. Pretty disappointed.

The string is too long, and very easy to be broken. I have only used it for two weeks, and the string is already broken. Very disappointed. The sound quality is ok, better than the fake Apple earbuds that you see it often in Amazon.

Got these for the first time a few years back, they fit my ears better than any other buds I'd tried. I can't stand in-ear ones as they just feel funky and the audio sounds muffled while other shaped buds ones hurt part of my ear after an hour. The volume decreased dramatically and I can no longer hear sound through the right earbud.
I am very dissapointed because I thought that sony would be a good brand. Turns out I was wrong.

You just can't go wrong with Sony for most electronics. We've bought the knock-off headphones before, but always come back to the Sony's for quality reasons. Not Hi-Fi by any stretch, but they sound good and hold up well. Disappointed no one on Amazon is selling the packs with multiple units like in the past.
Absolute garbage. These have to be fake because they could never be real Sony product. I went and bought $1 ear buds at Wal-Mart that sound better than these.

After one year and still fully functional, even when i accidentally place it in washer🙈not to mention my sister has gone through seven with other brands. I appreciate the fact that It fits unlike these earphones being maded nowadays.
These headphones have great audio and last long.

Very comfortable. The ear caps tend to get a bit dusty and dirty though. However, the sound quality is decent and it is a good product for the price it offers. I have been using it for a couple of months now and they are still working fine as opposed to some of my other earphones which stopped working in one ear.

Do not kid yourself! These are $10 earbuds....and they sound like it. Not even close to Apple's basic earbuds. Got as a temporary until the Senns arrive. Overall the sound is Foggy, like having water in your ears. 👎🏼 ☹

this is my 2nd pair. I still use my 1st pair but having 2 pc's I needed the 2nd pair.

easy on my ears.

These work well but they are really hard to get into your ears. The sound is good and all but they are uncomfortable. The soft ear buds are much better. Plus I can hear everything my kid is listening to.
Get the JVC HAF160B Gumy Ear Bud Headphone instead. While these are comfortable, I found the audio quality to be sub-par. The other JVC ones give much superior audio quality and volume.

these work great - just wish the cord was a little longer. I'm making do.

I was purchasing another brand of ear buds (that I wasn't really happy with) until they were no longer available. I'm glad I switched to these Sony ear buds. They are of exceptional quality and last a long time. Additionally, they arrived a lot quicker than I was anticipating.

These ear buds are fantastic. The sound quality is great. The audio is clean and crisp. The in ear buds fits snuggly and are soft to the touch. I live in a city that is very noisy. I have to take the train a lot and i promise you that when i put these in, all other sounds other than my music just disappears. I love that. Another thing as someone who goes through a lot of ear buds I can tell you that with the quality of these i will have them for a long time. Don't be afraid to get these you won't regret it. They were a good buy!

These are good, inexpensive ear buds. I really hate other styles of ear buds, and this is the only style that I find comfortable. They stay in my ears well and they provide decent enough sound for listening to music or audiobooks on my phone. There are other ear buds that provide much better sound, probably without paying much more money, but since all I really needed was a pair to keep in my purse so I could listen to things at work or on the go, they work perfectly for me.

Short version: I'm sending these back because they sound "TINNY"!!! I don’t know if that’s how they all are, or if I got one that slipped by Quality Control. Either way, they pale compared to the 818/828’s “Twin Turbo” design.
Detailed version:
I bought these because my MDR-E818 wore out at the jack from daily use/abuse, and the MDR-E818 & 828's prices went from $8 at the W* store to $20-40 after they were discontinued!!! I'll break my review down into separate categories to make it easier:
- Fit: They are very lightweight, and with/without the foam cover fit my ears OK. They are not biased, so you have to look at the shaft to see which one goes into which ear which may be a challenge while in motion (on a bike, running, etc.).
- Durability I tried these out for a couple weeks, but that's not really enough time. I am returning them for the reason below...
- Sound: This is why you buy headphones. I know you'll never get the "full, rich sound" from ear buds due to their size and the laws of physics. That being said, they are very "tinny" compared to my SanDisk OEM ear buds I use while working out, and EXTREMELY tinny when compared to the MDRE818's I use daily at work which are the ones they are supposed to replace.
Bottom line: If you want cheap, decent ear buds without the rubber “way into the ear” style, and you’re not worried about super-rich sound, these are OK. If you want the best sound I’ve ever heard out of foamy style ear buds, you’ll have to pay a lot for the MDRE818/828. Why Sony had to discontinue their best ear buds is beyond me.
These are going back to Amazon today. Amazon’s purchase was easy, fast, they were packaged nicely, and their return policy is one of the best in the business. I purchased a pair of the Panasonic RPHJE120S, and they are about equal to my SanDisk OEM, which is better than these, but again they also pale next to the 818/828’s.

Really good sound quality for such a low price. I have had a pair of these in the color green for many years until my cat broke them. I bought one of the newer style earbuds for around $10 that is like the rubber ball thing and it was just really uncomfortable, the sound quality wasn't anything like my old ones, and they kept falling out. So I immediately looked for the same model of my old ones and picked them up here on amazon, this time in gray. I love these earbuds so much and will never switch to any other model, they are low profile, have very clear and loud sound quality, and fit really snug in your ears but not in a way that causes discomfort. I recommend these earbuds to anyone who prefers the older style plastic earbuds rather than those new soft rubber ball ones. Best value of any earbuds, so so good.

I have a older par don't know the model but are 30 years old still kicking these have better sound good bass thump thump and good terrible for ear cranking highs work very good on my gpx personal CD player and fm radio picks up even little better than my old Sony's have thought of the inear kind not meny have 3.5mm plug personal CD players and smartphones have check out good reviews see how tuff some have washed um by leaving in clothing not me mine stay with my personal CD player bought two par but probably won't live long enough to use the other par these Sony earphones last and last go with these and if looking for a personal CD go with the gpx with fm radio Amazon has it rocks if by from my stop shop seller or Amazon sold and fulfilled both give tracking

These are my favorite headphones by far because they are really durable and long lasting!! All other headphones I've ever had only last me three months maximum and then one of the buds stops working or I have to hold them a certain way in order for them to work. I've had these for almost a year now and they are still going strong with no problem! The color of the headphones is also really nice and they fit comfortably in my ear. I am an avid music listener so these headphones are in near constant use and I have not seen a decrease in quality whatsoever. I really love the quality of these headphones and I absolutely recommend these to anyone that tends to be rough with their headphones as I accidently tend to be!

These are the only earbuds that fit my ears without falling out. Unfortunately, I bought two of these (one for the office and one for the gym bag) and only one was fully functional. The second pair's left earbud did not work at all. However, I have not had this problem with this product before (and have owned several pair in the past- and lost them of course), therefore I will probably continue to buy these until I notice a repetitive problem.

Had a pair from years ago that I still use to this day. It's really beat up looking though so I thought it was probably time to order a new pair. Glad I found it still available on Amazon. Got it in the same exact color and it works great. The earphones that went with my phone gave out after only two weeks of moderate use but I know these will last me years.

Got these to replace another pair that lasted about 18 months. I like to listen to podcasts while I sleep so they get yanked and crushed a lot, but these are way more comfortable than earbuds. One odd thing is that the volume is different in the R and L earphones. (There's a little raised dot on the top of the left earbud so you can tell them apart without looking, but it took me a long time to find it.)

My third experience of having Sony MDR-E9LP stereo earbuds headphones is still great. My first and second headphones got misplaced in Malaysia when I went back there during last two years and last year summer. As a person who is having an active lifestyle, this earbuds headphones is crafted to perfection for hectic daily activities.
The description of this earbuds stated that its’ provide “quality audio in an ultra-lightweight, compact design with 13.5mm neodymium drivers, an open-air design and 3.5mm chord length”. This statement could not be any truer due to my own experiences wearing these earbuds while walking, running, chilling or even cooking. The good cord length make it easy for you to comfortably place your gadgets anywhere while listening to the audio, the high standard of quality audio lets you listen to the audio without any hassle and the ultra-lightweight make it easy for you to bring it anywhere. Not to mention, the price is so cheap ($10/pair) that even if you want to replace it when it is missing, you will never think twice. As for now, I have had this earbud headphone lasting for one year and it is still working great. This shows that the durability or this earbuds is really good.
This earbud headphones comes with eight colors which are black, white, purple, grey, blue, red, green and pink. The variety of color itself will let you have choices on picking up the color that suit you best. On the earbuds, you will see the letter L and R crafted, which act as an indication for you to plug in the earbuds correctly to the side of your ears. This is because, it is designed specifically to one side of the ear. If you wear it correctly on its side, you will find that the earbud headphone will stay in place and never fall out of your ears as long as you wear it.
As you can see by yourself, this earbuds headphone is a made up using classic design. The new design is either in-ear design or headset design are preferable by some people. If you are the kind of person that did not like classic design, this earbuds is not suitable for you. However, if you are the kind of person that did not care about the design of the headphone, but others such as the audio quality, length of the chord, durability or even the price, this earbud headphone might be for you.

Hopefully, this information can help anyone that is looking for a headphone to make decision wisely before purchasing any headphones.

Like some of the other reviewers I was disappointed by the sound quality. I bought these to replace a pair that I've been using for several years which I thought was the same model, but the new ones don't have the same depth and range of sound as the old (they sound tinny). These are inexpensive and I'll be keeping them as a backup pair, but if you care about sound quality you might want to spend a few dollars more for a better product.

The sound on the headphones it fair. One headphone appears to not be as loud as the other one. The soft cover for the earpiece is something the buyer has to place on the earpiece and it does not hold its elasticity, therefore it falls off.

I have had these ear buds since the beginning of 2013 and they are good considering their price. The reason I like these ear buds is because they are from Sony. Anytime you buy from Sony you are guaranteed a reliable product. Another nice feature of these ear buds is that they come with different colors which are a cool thing (I bought the orange ones btw). I guess the main disadvantage of these ear buds is that the bass coming from them is pretty standard and not very impressive. I know the description says “enjoy powerful bass on the go” but believe me I’ve had other ear buds and in comparison the bass is not that powerful. If you want one to go with your mp3 player I would recommend “Panasonic RP-HV152 Portable Earbud Headphones with Powerful Sound” they are a bit more expensive but worth the price. If you are price sensitive and don’t really care about the bass, get these ear buds.

I love these headphones! These our my absolute favorite, I was so sad when they discontinued them! They stay in my ears like no other headphone and their extremely durable as I'm a headphone breaker and this last me forever!

I was looking for a good pair of earphones to go with my Samsung Galaxy S4 and figured Sony would easily fit the bill. Wow I was way wrong. These were definitely not it. In general the audio was muffled, which is very surprising from Sony earphones. Maybe muffled audio is just a hip new thing that I haven't been able to get into yet.
I just got a new pair of these because my last pair lasted me a hole 2 years and I wear ear bus a ton I never changed the king or brand since.

After the earbuds that came with my iPad broke, I bought this pair, as well as a pair of the Panasonic RPHJE120V In-Ear Headphone. Unexpectedly, the very inexpensive Panasonic was much better. Here's why:

- I found these Sony earbuds uncomfortable, with an awkward fit. They were coming out of my ears easily. It's like they weren't quite made right for my ears (and maybe any ears). The Panasonic were really comfortable and fit securly.

- The sound on the Panasonic was much more clear and crisp. For the Sony earbuds, when I was watching a movie I found I was missing a lot of the words, and the sounds just weren't as full, crisp and rich as with the Panasonic.

So honestly I wouldn't recommend these earbuds, but I'd suggest the Panasonic as a good quality pair at a very, very low price.

I have always liked these headphones . I had a pair for 3 years worked perfectly til they just stopped working but it's okay. I decided to buy these because my apple ones stopped working. When they arrived I saw that one of the earpod had glue or something on the side coming from inside. I didn't pay much attention until it started making a static noise. I took it apart , and tried taking off the glue but it didn't work, therefore, I put it back and it was now a lower noise than the other one when I played music. today, these decided to not work anymore. Update: I received a second pair of these ear buds today for my birthday. My wife purchased them for me without knowing that I had a problem with the previous pair. I decided to try them to see if they would work. They did not. Same exact problem. Must be a manufacturing defect.

Way more comfortable than those noise canceling ones.
simple and get the job done. Really affordable also. I have not had any problems with them.

Love this product. bought 2 before in the past and has lasted me at 2 years each item. The quality of this product never fails me. Came in time period it said it would and cant wait to use.
