Excellent product and exactly what I expected.
not great sound at all. I was expecting a crisper sound. When played high bass tunes , too much static.
These are perfect ear buds for my small Sony Walkman. I usually order two at a time so I always have a back up. Very reasonably priced, too.
Excellent quality and reliability! Would order them again

Same thing happened to me that has happened to some other customers. They came in a weird baggie, white/gray instead of black. The left side stopped working almost immediately and they fell apart, literally, after a couple of weeks of light use. Knockoffs maybe? Sony gear is usually pretty good in construction and performance - these were terrible.
had to replace my old headphones, and it's nice to see that my favorite model is still being made :)

I already have a pair of the these earbuds that I had bought at a Rite Aid because my old Phillips earbuds with good sound quality finally gave out. I paid twice the price for it at the store so this pair from Amazon.com is way better deal. Sound quality is loud and crisp, very good quality for the price especially when compared to other brands that are so awful, you'd have to crank up the volume to the max just to hear anything.
Sony always does a good job with ear buds. These are comfortable with good sound quality.

I love these earbuds. I bought 3 in in dfferent colors for myself & one as a gift. They are very sturdy unlike 3 apple earbuds which have come apart although comfortable. These are very comfortable & stay in the ear.

I know these ear buds are cheap, but I didn't expect them to SOUND as cheap as they do. Very "tinny" sound, no low end, no ability to distinguish instrumentation or background sounds. These are no better than a $3 pair in the checkout lane at the grocery store.
Always I use sony earbud and my son too. The are more resistant than others brands. Well, at least for us.

The price is good and it fits nicely my ear, which is something I am really picky about. I am probably going to buy another pair when the time comes. (don't get me wrong, the quality is good, I've been using this product everyday for months.)

These fit perfectly in my ear. I had the previous model (I forget the model number) and used them daily for hours and they still worked great. The only reason I had to replace them is because I lost them! These are comfortable, have decent sound quality (especially for the price) and I'm able to wear them for hours at a time with no problems.

Awful. I've had them for a month and while I will say that the sound quality could be much higher, especially coming from Sony, that's not the reason for my negative review. The ear buds fell out of my hand and onto the floor and the covering of the ear bud popped off and it will in no way pop back on. Cheaply made. Waste of money.
Great headphones.

I've bought these headphones multiple times before and they usually last a decently long time and the quality is great! However, I bought a pair in mid-August and already one earbud does not work anymore. It's only been a little over two months since I bought them. Very unhappy that I can't even find any type of warranty

great sound quality and fit is amazing i generally can't stand ear buds very uncomfortable these are so comfortable i have falling aslepp with them in. I listen to alot of Podcast and voices are clear music sounds good to.
These ear plugs are great! My Honey borrowed them and loved them so much he kept them for himself.

Need to replace a pair of Samsung buds that came with an old MP3 player. The bass I get out of the Samsungs are making finding a replacement set difficult. Based on other reviews I was led to believe these had a decent level of bass...they don't. At least not compared to the Samsungs. I have also tried some from Panasonic. The Panasonics were noise-isolating and I don't like in-ear buds...the search continues.
Nice buds.

These headphones are just old reliables that dont feel as bad as the other similar options. They are not fancy at all and arent the best sounding but they do take some punishment and are great backup to more sturdy or wireless options.
I love these earbuds! They're great, and I use them almost every day.
Sound quality is stellar, wouldn't expect anything else from Sony brand, also the plug is an 'L' shape so it easily blends with whatever you plug it in with.
Purchased for school. Has good sound, fits kids ears well!
Bought for my daughter and she only likes to use these now because they sound better than others she's tried. And at a great prices with fun colors!
Awful audio quality. I wanted the earbud style but these are way to cheap. Also, tiny packaging causes very tight kinks in cord.

I personally love love Sony earphones ONLY. Why? They work well and last long, its tough. and I will always buy these only. It doesn't give you headaches like those gummy ones. Recommend try if have not, you'll love it! One time my niece poured water all over one of the earphones, but it still worked fine, another time it fell in a sauce and it was fine again. The only time I would purchase another one is when it went missing and I really need another one! Price is affordable and lasting earphone!!!

The sound quality is great for the price, they're really cute, and they stay in place, even when running. I've had lots of problems with earbuds, but these fit really well with the foam covers, and the covers are very soft. The cord is a nice size so it doesn't get tangled up too badly, and they've taken a bit of tugging without falling apart.
Broke pretty quickly. Invest in some apple headphones, those are more expensive but will last much longer

these are some pretty good headphones for the price. every pair of Sony headphones i bought sounded excellent. i ordered these in hopes of them being just as good, but they're just good. i gave them to my sister and she loves them. i'm just use to having headphones that sounds like i'm at a live concert.
Good sound quality. Have been using this for over 3 months now and it is still working fine. Don't expect an enchanting sound quality, but a good product for the price I paid (around 8 dollars).

These ear phones turned out exceptionally good for all that I imagined. I was initially unsure about buying a 7.5$ earphone though it was from Sony. But its totally worth every penny. Its 6 months since I bought them and they've functioned superbly. They have had some rough times.. I've pulled them when they're plugged into the laptop at times, I've lifted the iPhone by the wires. I have crushed them ,slept with them on, left them in my jeans and turned them into the washer by mistake. Both but both the sides still working and they sound great. Noise cancellation- I would say 80%.. Theyre very comfortable in my ear as well..
The only reason I give a 4 is due to quality of the foampads. They are terrible and kept slipping off until they eventually tore when I was refitting them. If not for this, they are perfect.
The only headphones that stay well in my ears.

When I read the reviews here I was worried these wouldn't be as good as the previous model, but so far I've only had success with them. They're very comfortable and stay in my ears much better than any other brand of earbud I've ever used.

These are the best earphones EVER. They always last me from 6 month - 1 year depending on how well I take care of them. They are extremely comfortable and they sound quality is AMAZING. Definitely a Sony thing. These are my #1 go to earphones. If I ever lose them , I immediately buy the same exact ones . And they come in the cutest colors ! From light blue , grey , pink & green. (:

I thought these headphones were going to be pretty good after reading the reviews. These earphones are terrible. They are the kind that will only play through one ear unless you plug it in JUST the right way. My old earphones that I lost were so much better quality. Also, there is little to no bass when listening to music through these.

The earbuds themselves are bad and the quality of music that plays through them are bad.

Pros:
- really clear sound
- reasonable price

Cons:
- bass seems nonexistent compared to my "Pioneer STEEZ"
- made in china (not surprised)
- flimsy cable
- transparent plastic on the outside part of the ear bud (the colorful part)

Overall I would say that these ear buds do their job well, given the $7.34 price tag.
Insanely good on smartphones.

This is the second pair of these that I have purchased. The previous pair lasted more than five years with nearly every day use. The sound quality and fit of the ear buds is consistent between the two pairs that I have; this brand ear buds have the most comfortable fit in my opinion and are not too big to fit in my ears like most other brands that I have tried. I would buy these a third time.
These work well with my ears.
I purchased this as a donation to a children-teens advocate service. I believe this was a useful device for a deserving teenager that may be going through some difficult times.

I love the clear sound from these ! One of my favorite things about them is the foam pads that cover them. I have always had trouble with me ears itching, and these foam pads prevent that! I also like that they come in colors. I bought an extra set since my cat likes to chew on wires and I did 't want to find myself without a set.
I previously had these same Sony earbuds only they were pink and white for 4 years. Once they wore out, I bought another pair in this color. Love Sony brand
thank goodness for a sturdy pair that my cat and child don't break in two days. Good but not amazing sound range.
This headset is fantastic. It has a really cool design and is really comfortable

This thing is a tank! I accidentally dropped it without knowing and ran it over with my car and it still works! The sound of the headphones are clear and crisp, for a under 10 dollar earbud that is pretty good. Only thing I have a complain about is if you lose those earbud cover they slip out of your ears fairly easily. Other than that complain I love the earbuds.

These are beautiful earphones (I got the blue ones). But the sound quality is a bummer. I have many pairs of earphones from all sorts of companies. These sound cheap. I used to buy Sony earphones that come in the wind-up wheel-like device. They sounded real good. They don't make them anymore. So I tried these. Blah. What a bummer. I guess I can use them to listen to *speech* on my MP3 player. But for music, not worth it. Just a dull, ugly sound.

This company does not know the meaning of customer service. I placed my order like I would anything else about 8 months ago. I got an estimated delivery date for my headphones and waited for them to come it. The date came and went. About a week after the later part of the date went by I went to look at the tracking and it said it had been delivered.
I contacted the company and told them what was going on. They ignored my first e-mail. After I sent a slightly angry second e-mail they responded saying that the USPS was just slow and to wait for a while. Long story short I kept writing to the company every couple weeks requesting a refund, always first e-mail being ignored, second one angrier one being brushed off. It took them about 10 weeks after the later part of the estimated delivery date to FINALLY refund my purchase. Avoid this company at all costs.

I've had Sony headphones before and these are definitely not Sony brand. These have very poor sound quality compared to Sony headphones I had previously purchased for double the price at a large retailer. I found a lack of bass when using these. I gave them to my 12 year old son as an extra pair

These are absolutely my favorite earbuds.
I wear earbuds at work, so I can't use in-ear headphones (too hard to hear if someone has come into my office or said my name ect). They are the most comfortable earbuds I've ever used, and fit nicely in my ear without being too snug.
They are a great price, and they last super well. I buy a couple pairs every 3 years or so, usually because I've lost my old ones. Over the years I think I've had only ever had two pairs that had one headphone stop working, and I am _not_ gentle with my earbuds.
Exactly what you want in a cheap earbud, inexpensive enough that it's not painful to re-purchase, but sturdy enough that you don't have to re-purchase because they just quit working!

I am very particular about the earbuds I use. The ones with the rubber tip that goes more into your ear canal make everything sound weird to me and the round "Gummy" ones fall out of my ears. What I hadn't noticed in the picture before ordering is that these aren't perfectly round (nor are they banana shaped like one reviewer said) and I think that helps them stay in. At least in my ears, I can't speak for anyone else.

Another issue I have with earbuds is with the cord being long enough. If I'm listening to my mp3 player and have it on my desk at work, I can move it close enough that a shorter cord doesn't matter, but when I'm listening to my scanner and having it close to me isn't an option because I'd knock it over I want a longer cord and while the cord on the MDRE9LP could be an inch or two longer, I'm glad they're not shorter. The cord is almost the "pefect" length.

Overall, I'm super happy with them after using them for only ten minutes and I'm glad I bought them.

I purchased these ear buds as an upgrade from the really cheap ones I've been using. (The ones I have keep breaking.) So far I am really happy with the Sony Ear Buds. They are a little longer than the ones I have been using which is nice. I mainly use them to listen to music and for guided meditations. The sound is crisp and clear. The only thing I'm not happy with is that the Ear Bud covers they sent with the product are so thin that they both ripped when I tried to put them on. I have friends who paid a lot more for their Ear Buds and they aren't nearly as nice as these. I'm kind of rough on stuff so I don't know how long they will last, but given the improved sound quality I'm happy with my purchase.

Several years ago I purchased a little MP3 Walkman, and the sound quality was spectacular. It remained good even after my poor little earbuds made the trip through the washer and dryer. But over time and continued trauma, the sound quality did continue to degrade.
I tried several other brands and none of them even came close to the Sonys. So when I saw these I didn't really care about the price (which was very good) - I just needed some good earbuds.
These are great! Crystalline sound quality, and have that middle-of-your-head sound generation quality. :) So glad I found them!

These are the older Sony ear buds and I like them better than the new ones that are out in the stores now. These are tougher, stronger, and sound better than the new ones. I had three pairs of the new all black ones of a big box store and in less than a month I had one pair left. I went to Amazon to see if any of the older ones were available and I found a bunh for under $10 so I bought them and have them put away because I know it will be a long time before I need to replace each pair. These are great for riding around in your travel bag because they take a beating and keep going. Nothing breaks and nothing sounds bad. They aren't for audiophiles. but for the average music fan, they work quite well.

I purchased this product for somebody else, but they were very happy with it. One thing to note is that the white earbuds actually are not 100% white. The middle part is white, but the little piece on the outside is without a doubt grey. Not light grey, not off white, but full out grey. Both the part that says Sony and the little circle part. Luckily the person I gave them to thought they looked cooler in person than in the picture so it worked out, but it is something to keep in mind if you're looking for all white headphones. They came very nicely packaged. They are very happy and there are no regrets.

I have an iPod Touch, but I was never fully satisfied with the earphones it originally came with because the sound quality was sub-par. So, I hunted for a new pair, not wanting to spend more than $15. I wanted something brand new and decided to buy these earphones to replace the original pair. I've had about 3 pairs of these earbud headphones over the last 3 or 4 years and the quality has always been excellent, in my opinion. I bought these earbuds to replace the same model I'd been using for about 2 years! My old pair had been dropped, twisted, wrapped around my iPod and the quality of the sound never changed. I only replaced them because the sound finally gave out one day last week. The sound quality is really rich and clear. I only need to turn up my iPod's volume to about 50% in order to hear music or podcast with crystal clear quality. I would definitely repurchase these in the future. Shipping was also very fast too.

Thought I would give these a try. We usually buy the Gumy brand for about the same price. I'm sorry to say that these are literally garbage. I tried to return them but they're not eligible for a return, so I will have to throw them away. I won't subject my ears to such poor quality. Sony, you get a major fail on these. Buy the Gumy brand, they give you a reasonably nice listening experience.

This is my second set of these ear buds. I use them every day and am pretty hard on them, taking them off and putting back on numerous times a day. After about a year one of the ear pieces no longer works, but that happens regardless of how much I spend on them. These are economical, have great sound and fit my ears nicely. I will keep buying them as long as they keep making them.

So I had a pair of these previously in white and I liked them up until one day, you couldn't hear anything out of one of the buds. I bought these thinking that they were going to last longer but after just 2 weeks of using them, I couldn't hear from one of the ear buds EITHER!!!!! It was a waste of my money.
Poor quality, and I received a color I didn't order.
Really good
Great, like being able to hear the world around me and my music too!
Great ear buds for the price. Remember their are not pretending to be a replacement for high end head phones.
My daughter loves all things Sony-she uses this for her cell phone and for taking classes online and watching You Tube-great buy-I am getting one for myself as well.
Use these things for running/biking/climbing/working out. Lets me hear what is around me while still hearing music. I tie a not in the wires just below my chin so that they never fall out my ears.

I should have read more 1 and 2 star reviews for this product. I got these to replace my sony mdre828lp which finally died in one ear. The old earphones weren't great to begin with, but these felt like a step sown.

They are comfortable and super small, but they have no bass unless I press them into my ears and hold them there. I ended up replacing them with sennheiser mx 365 earphones, which were much better.

Love these headphones.
I got them in several colors, I keep a pair at work, in the car and at home.
Plus they don't cost an arm and a leg.
Like them
For a spare set of earbuds, these work fine for audiobooks, as well as music.
Great earbuds! I bought it for my niece, since she wanted pink earbuds. She loves it. Sound quality is great, and very well constructed. She is using it for few months now.
Bought these for my husband since these are the only kind he'll wear. I knocked off a star because one of the earbuds stopped working after just a couple of months.
Crap !!!!! That won't stay in ear.

Pretty good ear buds. I've had them for over a month now and I haven't seen any wear or tear on them. Nothing like the cheap $1 ear buds that you can get at the dollar store that only last about a week or two.

Update 9-2-2016:
It's been over a year since I bought these and they still work just fine! No signs of wear and tear at all!
I am happy with the size and the way they fit in my ears.now I need to find out how long they will stay in my ears once I start mowing my lawn
They're comfortable, they work, they're cheap, they last quite a bit first pair lasted like 2 years

Great standard set of semi "disposable" ear buds. I use these at the gym, on planes and I jam them in my pocket whenever I get a chance. I have destroyed a few pairs of these by constant use and mishandling but I don't mind. These are great for me because I cannot stand the "in ear" headphones, they just feel uncomfortable to me.

These ear buds are great, the sound is incredible through these small buds, they are comfortable I'm very happy I bought them. Ear buds of these type are hard to find anymore so I plan on getting a couple more for backup, I bought two pairs. The buds were only $9.00 a pair so for the price it was a real bargain. Great purchase

These are the only type of earbuds that actually fit in my ears. I've bought at least 6-7 pairs over the years. I'm not always very nice to them, but the seem to hold up well.

Sound quality is fine for me too, pretty average, but suits my purposes fine.
They're fine but ear buds could have been a little longer, decent price.

I find these kinds of ear buds to fit my ears the best. If you have small ears and want ear buds that are durable, these would be a good thing to try out. My last set lasted me about 8 or 9 years before I finally had to replace them.

These earbuds are probably exactly what you expect. They have a comfortable fit in my ears, even when not using the included foam pads. The sound is reasonable, especially for music while working out or listening to audiobooks. The cord is longer than most cheap earbuds, and that is a definite plus.

I've used several sets of these and never had them wear out, only had to replace when my wife steals them or my cat chews through the wires. Longest time in use was probably 1.5-2 years without any problems.

I would highly recommend these if you need a cheap set of earbuds. They won't replace a $100 pair, but they were never meant to.

Inexpensive ear buds work fine. Sound is pretty good. The wire quality is just OK. My 100 dollar Bose ear buds look sound and feel great, but at this price, i can abuse these and when they break i can toss them and get another pair.
perfect ... thanks

Assuming you don't lose the covers that protect the earpiece after the first time you take them out of your ear, you will certainly experience the short leash on these the minute you try to lean over to take something out of your desk drawer ... and your head is suddenly yanked back ... The sounds quality is fine, but will never buy again.
Always used this ear buds since it works the best for me as I do not like one of those where you have to attach rubber tips.
One of my older pairs lost sound in the left (always left for me) headphone so I purchase these. I love these headphones! Nice bass and the sound is clear.

These Sony earbuds are the ONLY ones I buy for my family. We use them for all our iphones, ipads, ipods, tablets, and laptops. Just as good as the Apple OEM earbuds. My kids think the iphone 5's are better... but I don't agree. These Sony's have a nice pure balanced sound. Plus the price is right...
Great Brand, Product, and Price--an unbeatable combination! Many thanks, Amazon!
best buy. great for running.
Love these, comfortable and don't fall ot
I ordered two. One of them had a rather tinny sound, and the right earbud popped constantly. The other one is fine (for now) but not spectacular. They're cheap, what else is there to say?

Great sound for the price and very durable. Use them everyday during my commute and have had no problems. Only thing that woul d make them better is if they and a mic to use on my phone too. Add to my wishlist so when they do eventually faoil I can get another pair.

Love these earbuds had my last earbuds which were the same product last over 2 years and then a wire in in one speakers shaped in 2 and only 1 earbuds was working so went here and found the earbuds I was using here and now I am happy to use my Ipod Nano 7th gen while at work. Thanks Amazon you are the BEST!!!!!!

I love these ear buds. I have had to purchase them a few times due to forgetting them in a hotel room or a grandchild running off with them. When I order them I purchase two pair just in case. I have only worn out 1 pair and they lasted over a year with me using them constantly.
Bought as school supplies.

Perhaps one of the greatest Ear Buds of all time. I own a pair and they are very durable, reliable, and have crystal clear sound that brings you to a whole new perspective on the true sound of music in your songs listened through them. Highly recommended!

This is the second set of Sony MDRE9LP I have owned. The first set lasted about 8 years and would still be going strong if I hadn't stepped on one of the buds by mistake. They are very well made and will deliver quality sound for years (if you don't step on them).

I also wanted to mention the very speedy delivery. Since I have an Amazon Prime membership, I get free two-day shipping. But I actually received this item within 24 hours of my placing the order. That's super-speedy.
Decent headphones for price. Fits my weird ears so I'm happy. Good for people who don't like ear buds that go in your ears. Sound is as expected for price.
They are OK for non in ear buds. Just OK.
Lasted me almost 6 months, and I'm always using headphones, whether I'm out or at home or in my bed. Great quality for the price, great sound with music, would recommend and am buying again.
Run a little big (or I have small ears) - but they work fine.
Earbuds eventually fall off. Sad purchase.
When i first used used these headphones, there was an annoying staticy noise. However, it eventually went away and it works well. Now, to see if it will last 4 years like my last earphone...
I have difficulty keeping earbuds inserted in my auditory canal. These come with a thin sponge-like cover which makes it easy for the earbuds to remain in place.
Cool ear buds...
bought as a gift for my wife who loved how these fit in her ear and sound.

What can I say about cheap headphones you don't already know, they aren't the best sounding headphones I've used, they probably won't last very long compared to other headphones I own. But for under $10 they are good enough to not care too much about sound quality, longevity, or if they get lost.
like
WORST HEADPHONES/EARBUDS i HAVE EVER USED AND CANNOT BE RETURNED.(NOT EVEN AN OPTION). UNCOMFORTABLE FALL OUT OF YOUR EAR AND NO BASS OR MIDRANGE AT ALL.
Bought these for my daughter and she loves them. She has them in constantly and they seem to work well and not have issues.

I accidentally purchased these earbuds thinking they were the Sony MDR-E10LP earbuds. I do not like these earbuds as much as the E10LP, the sound wasn't as good and after a while if you turned the volume up too high on a podcast the sound gets pretty distorted. All in all I recommend the Sony MDR-E10LP over these all day any day.
Good product and look upon arrival. Time will tell for sure.

Don't expect to get found shattering sound quality for this cheap. You get what you pay for. Cheap ear buds to use knowing they'll probably get lost or break within a few months. Anyone who complains about the sound must've forgot they paid $8 for these.

I ordered it back in November will one day shipping and did not receive it until a month later. And now one of the ear bud is not providing sound at all. I have kept them safe and stored properly. I will not buy this product again.
Great sound! Always stick with sony because some of their headphones last longer than others.

I was really disappointed with these earbud headphones. I just expected so much more from the Sony brand. The sound is fine, what I expected...but I first bought them for my 13 year old daughter, and she complained they hurt her ears when she wore them. I tried them, and boy, was she right. They were awful. Very uncomfortable. I used them once and that was it. They only reason I didn't give one star was because the sound is decent.
A bit smaller than the average pair that looks like this... perfect for those of us who are a little petite. These fit good without hurting my ears like others brands do.
I have been buying sony for many years. Ever since my first experience with broken headphones. The other brands just don't have the right sound.
Perfect, fast delivery and nice for those who enjoy the flat buds similar to the old iPhone headphones. Great sound.
Purchased as a gift but wish I had bought a pair for myself.
This works and does not drain your wallet. I normally changed buds at least every 3 to 4 months due to heavy use as in gym workouts or jogging.
Works very good. happy with this purchase. Thank yoy!
Awesome

Comfortable to wear, but bass is very weak. Had a similar sony ear bud before that had much better bass and was the same price.
Maybe Sony quality going to the dogs these days.... hmm

Easily worst headphones i had bought. Ever. it would but it in the mid range of the freebee category.

I put on the headphones, and the first thing i hear is static. If you even touch the wire you get static. Also, sound quality is horrible. I would have head better luck playing my phone on loud and listening to that on my run. Honestly, i think i am just going to throw them in the garbage.
Amazing quality for a relatively cheap earbud. A bargain.
Always great. I bought these twice. Though the only reason I had to buy them again is because my new kitten chewed on the wire. I have been buying these for years, (including the older versions.)

The Good:
-They don't go directly in your ears.
-Made by Sony
-The package included a pair of foam buds.

The Not-as good:
-Not much bass response as I had hoped. News, Talk, and music that isn't bass-dependent sounds okay.

Absolute crap product. I no longer have the original packaging and stuff, so I am forced to toss it, effectively tossing $9. The worst ear buds I ever bought. I listen to heavy metal music exclusively and this earset sounds tinny and has no bass. Try Slayer without bass. Disappointed in Sony. I know they make better products, so thi could just be a one off mistake, but I recommend staying away from this MDRE9LP.
I love these earbuds. They are very comfortable and makes listening to music easy.
st patrick gift for my teen not to intense to destroyhearring lose like beats,, great sound total block every one out
New earbuds always take some getting used to for me, but I really like these! I find them very comfortable and the sound clear =]
Great earbuds. Sound quality is nice and clear. They also fit the earcannel completely so it drown out outside noises pretty well. Would definitly buy another pair.
They are doing the job and came in nice packaging in the advertised time frame. I have not had the issues with them that other customers seem to be plagued by.
Didn't last long but my daughter is rough on ear buds. I don't get it.

One of the best if not the best low cost earphones. They sound good, no bass though. They are great for running / exercise. They are comfortable, you can wear them for hours and may forget they are there.

These are ill fitting and have no bass. I bought these because I listen to more podcasts than music but they're not even good for that. It's like listening to nails dragging across a chalkboard. SCR EEEECH No,seriously, it does.

I bought this product to replace an older version of similar Sony earphones, which have lasted me the past 4 years. The product arrived at the expected time. I was somewhat disappointed in the quality. I thought that I took care of my earphones well, but within a week, I started experiencing the same problems I had with these new earphones that I had with my old Sony earphones after 4 years. Sound was inconsistent as I walked around the the cord attached to my iPhone entangled itself and rotated around randomly. I also constantly hear the little plastic component as I walk around listening to these earphones, which get kinda annoying.

These work really well. I've had them for a year now, and I think they might be starting to wear down. But I stuff them into my backpack, my pocket and my gym bag, and have not taken care of them much. I think these are a good buy though.

Should have payed closer to 5 or 6. Not what I expected from Sony. Mostly because these don't provide much bass. I've had other Sony ear buds similarly priced better than this, those it wasn't much of a spend and they provide decent quality sound.. Audio:6/10 without much bass..

Love these earbuds...
These don't block out ambient sounds and fit my ears better than Beats...
Highly recommended, if you like comfort, and the ability to do things while listening to music or, like me, audiobooks.
I just wish they were easier to find...
Good, doesn't fit as well as a jvc but does the job.

Good headphones.... I took a star away because it could of been packaged a little bit better.... my bubble mailer was opened, which means the item could have fallen out .... I will buy these again....

Way more durable than I expected. I accidentally ran these things through the washer and the dryer and they still work fine three months later. Wouldn't recommend replicating my experience, but its pretty tight.
They work, but the older model was better. Unfortunately you can't find those anymore. So take it or leave it. These are my gym throw-aways anyway

These Sony Ear Buds are cheap but the sound quality lasts for a very long time. The only thing you need to wory about it is keeping the little white things that go over the parts that go in your ear on. I wasn't careful and I accidentally lost it, but I just replaced it with a spare one I had, and they are good as new!

These are the best earbuds ive ever had. Ive had several pairs of these over the years and they never break from overuse, never fade or lose sound. They break because I am not carefull with my possesions. Good sound and great bass on this pair...as usual.

send to my friend as gift
gift

I've had this earbuds since a while, I had them in white and they resisted a lot of bad handling. They stopped working finally after 3 years of a lot of use. I bought two new pairs.

They have good sound, they are confortable, they would be perfect if the wires be more resistent.

My son goes through ear buds like crazy! These have held up for quite a while though. The sound quality is good and he likes this style over the type that go down into your ear. Definitely worth the price. I'm going back to buy more.

I need a pair of headphones to work out with, so a few weeks back I had purchased the Panasonic RPHV21BK In-Ear Earbud Heaphones with Built-in Clip, but that was absolutely terrible, so I went back to Sony, a brand that never failed me before. As expected, the headphones were a lot better than the previous Panasonics i bought. They have good sound quality for the price it comes in, and when working out, it relatively stayed put in my ears and didn't fall out. The only problem with it is the volume; I'll have the volume low, but it's still rather loud in the ears, so I would recommend not blasting the volume, at least until you have a feel for the sound.
Not much bass but that's to be expected of earbuds in this price range. One of my better sets of earbuds. Be sure to wipe them off every once in a while to stop wax from building up.

I bought these for my husband after buying a pair for myself. They work well and can be turned up very loud without much distortion. The cord length is nice and the shape of the buds seems to help them stay in your ear very well - even when working out.
Great product at a great price, or so I'm told. I don't do earbuds but I've bought this twice as gifts, both people loved them.

Warning: Cannot be returned. I no sooner had these out of the box and plugged into my iPhone 5s before I had to start wiggling the cord to get both sides to work. Poor quality. Find something else. Do not buy these. Again: CANNOT BE RETURNED.

If you're not really interested in good sound quality and just need something somewhat discreet to use while on the subway or exercising, these are great. I've been using this model or similar for about 3 years now, and they've done the trick. I've been through about 3 pair as they usually crap out within a year or so of heavy daily use, but at $10ish, that's expected and not really a hassle.
good deal when the kids are rough with them and need their own at school. not a tragedy when lost. sound quality is quite good.
Cheap material that lasted not even one month before the earbuds came apart.
Well the first thing I can say is that I love this ones. I love the color and it's just like the picture... it's just amazing. The sound is good and I'm really happy to purchase it.

These are my favorite earphones by far. I tend to break all earbuds regardless of price in less than a month but I owned a pair of these for 5 years before I decided to buy new ones and mind you, the old ones are still fully functional even though I dropped them in water, stepped on them multiple times, and even slammed the car door on the cable. If you're careless like me then I definitely recommend this.

Maybe because the phone is a Sony? I think Walkman is clearer and crisper than iTunes. But that's not the phones. I love stereo sound in my ears and need to hear what is happening around me. I have scarring on one eardrum so I won't give detail on the sound quality. They have an unusual shape and at first they seemed to fit well into my ears and not fall out. Then I found the little spongey things that made them too big and they fell out easily, so I took them off. Now they still pop out fairly easily when I'm walking about. I'm plugging them into my bluetooth clip on so there's an abundance of wire that seems to weigh, snag and pull them out. Latest engineering has the clip hanging from a safety pin and reducing the weight from pulling on the earbuds. I think I'm missing something, but these earbuds are the same configuration of wires and plug and I think I got them because they are a foot shorter than most. All the excess wire is heavy. Since I seem to be hard on these devices, they cease to function in one ear or the other I keep buying relatively inexpensive sets. I would get these again.

These are decent earbuds for the price you pay. You better find a good source for those little spandex covers because you will be going thru many of them. They either fall off or go to pieces over time. But the buds themselves are good but don't expect rock star quality.

I use to have a walkman that uses similar ear buds like this one, so this takes my back when I use it. Great sound and right length to be tuck in to my shirt. I use it during my breaks and walking around, seems to be fitting into my ears without any issue. I got couple more of these incase it goes bad, still cheaper than my local electronic stores

I'm a landscaper, and I go through several earbuds in a year. Because of that, I just go for the cheap ones that are under $10.

90% of the time, I purchase Sony earbuds because they give you good sound at a cheap price. Unfortunately, they failed with this set. Even worse, I bought two of them.

It's hard to explain, but the sound is not as crisp on these. The bass, or lack of, is bad. Because of that, everything sounds flat. Then, that leaves me to go and mess around with the 'EQ' settings on the iPod. That's an issue, because I have more than one genre of music on the iPod. So then I have some songs that sound good and others that sound poor. With previous Sony earbuds, I never had to worry about that. The difference in sound was negligible when it jumped from one genre to another.

When I listen to music, I have to turn up the volume a little more than I usually did with my old Sony earbuds. When I listen to podcasts, I have to raise the volume quite a bit more.

I can't complain too much because of their price, but I've certainly had way better Sony earbuds for under $10. Now I have to put up with these until they break. Both of them.

I do find them to be a comfortable pair. I'll give them that.

I was looking for a pair of earbuds without the rubbery attachments that are so common these days. I think I heard somewhere that the rubbery attachment vibrates your ear canal and can damage your hearing over time. Anyhow, these earbuds matched the profile, the reviews were good, and they were cheap ($8).

I am listening to music on these earbuds now as I write this review. The treble is OK but the bass needs some serious help. Just like Meghan Trainor I am all about that bass. For $8 I don't expect too much but my last pair of Panasonic earbuds were much better...they had much fuller sound. I will probably go and reorder my Panasonic RPHV21GA earbuds and put these wimpy Sony buds in a drawer somewhere.

This is an authentic review. I did NOT receive this item for free or at a discount for my "unbiased review." I paid full price and am just a regular Amazon shopper just like you are.

Very lightweight plastic headphones that I keep in my bag for occasional use. I was glad to find them because those ones with the little rubber pieces that go into your ears are horrible for me. I've yet to find a pair that stay in my ears.

Sound quality is pretty good for an inexpensive set of buds.

I love this style earbuds/headphones and would choose/recommend over the new style ANY DAY. The new style hurts like hell and is EXTREMELY uncomfortable as you have to push the "cusions" down into your eardrums. Perhaps they do give you a slight better sound and depth. I wouldn't know because the moment I had to apply a single side, I took it right out, threw them away and that was that. I'd rather have comfort than bleeding, puffy eardrums. This set is EXTREMELY comfortable. The sound is good but yes the bass isn't all that. Shocking for a Sony product.

The ear buds look nice, stay in my ears well, and I like that they're labelled left and right. However, there is absolutely NO bass sound from these whatsoever. Even listening to videos of people talking takes some getting used to. But they're good for the purpose I bought them for, which is watching videos on without large headphones crushing my ears.

I've been buying this version of headphones for several years now. They're the only type in this price range that I've found to stand up to heavy long term wear. I use headphones daily (while on my laptop) and I think I break a pair about once a year on average (the only time I've ever had them break was by directly stepping on them but this has happened multiple times over the years). The rest of the time I toss my laptop around from my bed, to the table to the floor and drag hte headphones along and they hold up just fine. Plus, they stay in my ears fairly well as long as I'm not being too active.

I give these 3 stars only, it is OK because the headphones sound quality is not good compared to the previous Sony ones.
Overall Sony is a good brand, but this new headphones the sound is low and not clear at all.
Few years ago I have a black Sony headphones, and the sound was crystal clear and loud but that old model have been discontinued. So I buy this new model one, and I was not very happy, but I am not complaining since it is only $8.
So if you looking for cheap headphones and just OK quality, then buy this.

Quite disappointed that Sony makes these not-impressive headphones. I purchased 2. The design is cool but the sound is not that great and one of them broke after using it for 3 days. I expected more from Sony especially the sound delivery.

Sound is what you would expect from a sub ten dollar ear bud. To be fare, these are not really buds, they don't go inside your ear canal, they sit inside your ear. I guess if I could give them 3.5 stars that would be more accurate.
It's so hard to find this "classic" style anymore, and these are great. Sony is a reliable brand, always.

Compared to the older fontopia designs, the sound on these SUCKS. The frequency response is lousy in comparison to the old MDRE 818 or 828 series. There's nowhere enough bass, and the higher registers sound tinny and flat.
Have always loved these earbuds, ever since I got my first pair over 12 years ago. They dont have a mic but fit perfectly in my ear, if I ever won the lottery I'd buy a case lol.

I searched far and wide for these headphones because they are the only kind I use. I love purple it's my favorite color and the sound that comes out of these headphones are so clear. These are really GREAT quality headphones.
Good deal. Not top notch, but good for the price.
Soo cheap but such good quality. Bought these for a wick substitute for my iPhone headphones for listening to music and glad to say they do the job well.

I chose these as they are not of the highest quality, but certainly not the lowest. Sony earphones always sound very good. The only factor unknown is how durable they are and how long they will last. Time will tell. I recommend buying this model/product line.

I would say that for the price, it is a good set of earbuds. If you're buying this and expecting, super high quality sound, then this product isn't for you. However, if you're just looking for some cheap earbuds that meet your basic needs, this is the one for you.
Great little ear buds. Work well with my mp3 player.
always a brand of this ear buds. My 4 since I keep running my chair over it...
I've been buying these headphones for years. Recently I've been unable to find them in the usual stores I buy them, so I purchased them from Amazon. Same great quality with an even better price!
my girlfriend likes the classic style I dont really but they do sound clear with a little bass for what they are
Fast delivery. True sound: good for monitoring recording. Cord is too thin, don’t know if this last long. Price is ok. Thank you so much.
Nice headphones.

This is my 3rd time purchasing these. I've convinced they're indestructible. I'm unintentionally abusive to my headphones and these stand the test of time. I've used my first pair since 2009.

Plus, the shape of the buds help you figure out which ear to put it in, in the dark.
Sound, especially bass, is as good as any 50$ pair. However, gargantuan bud size can't possibly fit any human being.
They are light, fit snugly into my ears, and produce a very nice quality of sound. Exactly what I would expect from Sony and I couldn't be more pleased.
Cord is too long. Dont stay in my ear right. Sound a bit tinny. Cant distinguish left from right easily.
daughter loves
Very good quality and excellent sound ..
Worked as expected and received on time.
My favorite earbuds ever. They work great, they don't go too far into your ear, and they can be worn for hours.
Really bad sound. Like a dance hall sound and no base. Had to get other and much better.
i love them they are comfy and works great
I bought these as replacement for Sony MDRE818LP (which I love & are no longer offered) but these have horrible sound, also after a few weeks, one earbud volume is much lower
Didn't work at all. If I could, I'd give it 0 stars. I expected a little more for it being Sony. But I guess you get what you pay for. Go invest into better earphones then some cheapy 5 buck ones.

Was looking for headphones that replace the apple ones that come with an ipod automatically and found these. Have not been disappointed yet--they stay in my ears fairly easily, yet don't hurt after being in my ears awhile (I've tried other earbuds and they tend to hurt after being in my ears longer than 30mins/1hr). Love the color options and long cords, and the sound quality is excellent as well. Definitely will purchase more of these once/if my current ones break (which hopefully they won't for at least a year or so).
Great Product!
They are made for dumbo's ears. If you have small or normal ears you are screwed. You need to play them super loud to hear anything because they're I'll sized.

Nice pair that doesn't go heavy on the bass and rests comfortably in my small ears for hours. I keep them in my purse, but have also used them for running since my Bluetooth buds died and the sweat hasn't seemed to bother them.
Defective out of the box, but not valuable enough to go through the hassle of packaging and shipping for a refund or replacement. Just a waste of time and money.
not recommend this one, low sound quality and uncomfortable. for this price and this sound quality, i would say this is a waste of money if you are going to buy
The quality isn't there anymore. :(

This is a complete JUNK! Zero bass and you can barely hear anything. I doubt this is a genuine SONY product. The entire package is in Chinese (except for one or two lines in English) and the quality is poor (nothing like SONY). Very disappointed. Do not buy.
These are cheap earbuds, but the sound quality is mediocre and you can tell they are very cheaply made. not terrible for the price, but there are better build quality ones for the same price.

Just an OK ear bud, I'm trying to replace some old Sony ear buds I had but that were all hard plastic (like these), but they had better sound than these. A lot of the other Sony ear buds I've bought and tried have a soft plastic piece that covers the speaker that can too easily pop off.
No bass whatsoever, and the quality is simply okay, but it's nothing special. Won't order again.
Looks really useful!

0 stars. A waste of $9. Horrible sound (too hot and middle freq heavy), noisy unreliable jack, flimsy wire connections. Just pay more and get something else. Older models much better (e.g. Sony MDR-E828LP)

I have found that these are a great cheap pair of headphones that sound good for most daily listening. They do not block out any noise, but they play music very clearly and without any distortion. They do not fall out of my ears at all while running.
Sounds good, breaks easily when dropped, cheap, would recommend to another cheap wad.
I like these kind of ear buds and they are durable and sound good enough. Great price. My kids don't like them because they do not insert into the ear. Thats better for me. They wont use them. ;)
Sound quality could be better but these are great bargain earbud that are very comfortable and small.
Great for easy listening, not the best sound quality, but that's not why I bought them.

These ear buds are a notch above airline headphones that are given out. They use the foam covering that is placed over the ear buds that always slide off and the package only comes with one pair so if you lose them like I did you're out of luck. Quality is subpar compared to other cheap headphones I've owned in the past. I would not recommend.
These headphones are the best!! I am still using the pair I bought over 2 years ago!! I purchased this new pair because I could no longer find them in stores. HIGHLY RECOMMEND,FANTASTIC SOUND!!

It's very difficult to find earphones these days that have good quality sound. These are perfect. Whether you like them or not will depend on your preference for sound. I have tried earphones that people said were great, and found them to be completely unacceptable to me. If you've always liked Sony earphones, these are good.
great for the ear
They arrived on time, they were as advertised, the person they were for was very pleased

I don't know specific about sound quality and am not picky. Was just looking for some headphones with a long cord to use at work to attach to the computer. Does it's job, very light, very comfortable. Would definitely buy again.

Wow! These headphones really sound bad. They sound like the cheap ear buds you get with a new MP3 player. Like listening over a speaker phone or an AM radio. Unfortunately, they replace the excellent MDR-E818LP which sounded excellent and cost the same
They arrived on time, they were as advertised, the person they were for was pleased

The last pair of earbuds I had was the Sony MDR E 10LPs. I used those for three years before they broke, and I had gotten them secondhand, so they lasted a long time, with pretty good sound quality. I got these in replacement, but these are nowhere near the 10LPs. When I put them in for the first time the audio sounded tinny and cheap. Then after one week of normal use they broke. Sound wouldn't come out of both ears unless I wiggled and held the cord in just the right spot. Disappointing.
I use these at work all the time. Pretty decent sound for the price!
These are a nice pair of airplane grade headphones. Not worth the buy.
You get what you pay. This heaphones are really basic but it is a good option for those customers who doesn't want to spend a lot of money and they don't mind about the quality of the sound.

These are subpar compared to my old MDRE10LP in terms of comfort, design, and sound quality, but they no longer make the old 10LP's and are too expensive to replace so these would have to do. I only trust 4 brands when it comes to my ear buds - Sony, Creative, Logitech (Hit or a miss) and Toshiba, and for the price of $8.42 these are definitely worth it.
These work great, don't fall out of the ears, perfect!!!

I had no problem with the ear buds. They work fine and the sound quality is good. The material quality does seem a little on the cheap side so I'm not sure how long they will last. hopefully I will be pleasantly surprised and they will last for quite a while - only time will tell though.
As advertised. Prompt delivery.
The cover for the earbuds is quite uncomfortable and thin. They dont stay in place.

I go through these like crazy. I find that the plug on them isn't super sturdy, so one ear tends to go out pretty quickly. Usually, I just lose them before that happens, so I continue to purchase them.

I miss the discontinued banana shape of the Sony earbuds, but these worked okay, all things considered. The sound was good, as is standard of Sony, at the very least. I just wish the earbuds weren't so uncomfortable, due to them not being the banana shape. Please, Sony, go back. I miss the bananas. Please make them again.
I do recommend these headphones, though. Sony has yet to fail me in the quality department of headphones, and I shall continue to buy from them for as long as they fail to disappoint.
great product.
Good quality for the price. I purchased these for my God-Daughter and a pair for me. They are great and still give me great sound!
We have purchased four pairs of these headphones. We keep them in our vehicles and with my gym bag.

I always buy my headphones/earphones from Sony because they are reasonably-priced, the audio quality is great (it's definitely better than Skullcandy), and they last long. I tried every other earphone brand, but they would blow out within months, but when I tried Sony, there was no going back. I use these earbuds a lot and they've lasted me years now.
Nice sound quality
Love these little headphones. I always have a pair because they seem to last forever and as clumsy as I am that is important. They work perfectly with my iPhone and laptop and that's all I need.

These are my favorite brand of earbuds. They work great and last for a long time. I like that they come in different colors and for sony theyre at a great price. The only problem i have with them is as time passes You cant hear from one ear.
Not as great quality as these used to be.

A while back I purchased some Sony headphones almost exactly like these ones. They were perfect, great sound quality and awesome bass for ear buds. I expected as much from these ones, however, there is a huge difference. The sound quality is really poor. I have gone back to using the old ones which have lasted for over 2 years but have exposed wire near the headphone jack. What is really interesting is that I paid more for these ones than I did for my old ones.
Really good souning headphonne. Verry pleased. They stay in my ear verry nice.

The sound is not what I expected. It is kind if hollow.
I really was expecting a better sound.

I am stupid... I wrote a review saying these headphones sucked because they didn't work with my phone. Turns out there was just a ball of lint in the earphone jack. I am sorry, Sony. I'll go buy a new PS4 game as penance.

Whenever I am on my computer I wear these. They are the perfect fit. They are hard to find these days, but I love they way they fit in my ear. All of the new headphones just don't fit right.
These are at an awesome price point!
Comfortable fit and decent sound quality. Delivery was fast

The pair I received only works if it's turned a specific way when plugged into my ipod (you know how headphones/earbuds get finicky when they get old or pulled on, hate that!), started right out of the box. However, I have black pair that works alright, thus the 3 star. Sound is passable when it works. Having only tested two of this kind, I can't really say if it's worth the gamble for the price. Tell me... do you feel lucky?
I love these headphones.... they fit great and sound great.

I have had no luck with the in-ear type of earbuds so when my standard Apple earbuds were finally too worn out to use anymore, I decided to try these. They fit well and feel very secure in my ears. Good sound quality and I think they even amp up the bass more than my old Apple earbuds. Great buy for the price!
Great earbuds.

I purchased these headphones because I had received a similar pair 2 years ago for Christmas as a gift and absolutely loved them. They were cheap, light weight, and had the best sound quality of budget headphones I had ever heard. When I needed another pair to leave at the office I jumped on these because I thought they would have similar qualities. Completely wrong. Although not a bad price point - the sound quality in these is terrible and overall feel of them is much cheaper. Disappointing to see Sony decrease the quality so drastically.
They don't fit in my ears very well and the sound is so poor it's like listening to records in mono. Would not recommend these to anyone.
I like the volume on these earplugs . Fits all my need I would recommend these were a great buy.

I love these earphones there very loud and don't pop easily! They last very long if you take care of them my have lasted for 3 yrs now and I have even washed them accidently in the washer and they still work. Their inexpensive and came in only 3 days. I highly recommend them to any music lover out their.

I just received the Earbuds today and I am being very truthful here, in that I have always been a consumer of Sony products and probably still will purchase them, but these earbuds are just pieces of crap! The sound is like your sitting in a tunnel listening to music. Do not buy this product at all.

As much as I love these Sony Ear Buds it keeps on breaking every couple of months. I replace these earphones every year sometimes twice a year because the ear buds usually drop on the floor and the plastic piece that goes into the ear just breaks apart. I still end up buying another pair because I love these ear buds. They are very comfortable, unlike other earbuds I don't have to squeeze these earbuds into my small ears. Other ones also make my ear itchy--not sure why--these don't do that. I usually wear mines without the fabric covers that come with it. I just don't like the covers going in my ear something about it just makes my ears feel dirty.

Long story short I broke another pair of these earphones today. Mostly my fault; I'm a savage when it comes to handling these things. I'll be ordering another pair pretty soon.
Got for the wife. She likes these old style headphones not the new in ear kind. Said she liked them.... If she could only find them now.
they last well and produce excellent sound.

I have had these headphones for quite a few months now and they were awesome for the first month. Just recently though, I realized that the right side head phone speaker was coming out of the bud itself and I had to reconnect and push the plastic back together. It hasn't given me much trouble since then luckily:)
good sound use them with my portable to watch shows when out of town
Best earbuds out there. I love that they don't stick into my ears as deeply as the trendy styles do. They are a lot more comfortable.
great durable headphones. last pair lasted me over a year. very happy
After 3 month review, it has good sound but sometimes the ear caps come off.
I use these while I ride my bike around town and they're comfortable, look good, and put out decent enough sound for while I'm riding.

Comparing these to my old Gummy ear buds I used to purchase before trying these ones out I can surely say that these Sony ear buds are far more inferior. The sound quality is very poor, they feel extremely cheap, and are not comfortable. After only a month or so the left ear bud lost most of the sound. Will not be buying these again.

Great sound for the price! Fairly durable too; I ordered mine about a year ago and they are still functioning as they did when I took them out of the box despite the abuse of coming in and out of my pockets.

Surprisingly clear and crisp sound. I'm an avid podcast / radio listener and a lot of times the high-end in-ear headphones make voices sound muffled. With these headphones, I got consistent, sharp audio and I now use them primarily for my day to day use. And if you switch over to music, they're just as good, if not better, than iPhone earbuds, except those cost 3 times as much as these.
If you're looking for headphones that do more than just get the job done but don't want to spend a lot of money for features you won't even notice, these headphones are your best bet.
**Note, I've had these headphones and my apple ones for the same about of time, and the Apple ones have already torn, while these Sony earbuds are still like new!

Been using these for years for cycling and running. They are not noise cancelling which is important when on the roads riding or running. Too many people zone out with headphones and don't pay attention to traffic. A great way to get killed. The sound is decent for a low priced wired headset. Sure, I have to replace them alot, I just toss them anywhere and they only last so long but for 8 bucks what do you expect?

I have used a Sony Walkman small AM/FM (SRF-M37W) radio for 20 years - earlier versions even had TV channels (audio only) and I prefer the SOny earbuds - no foam covering and not stuffed into your ear.

This version however breaks the FIRST time the earbud hits the ground and then it time for superglue - since I'm wearing the hip radio the wire regularly snags on a drawer knob the dog paw, whatever, but when the ear bud hits the ground the cover and the bud are separated.

Even with superglue getting a fix is tough. Looking for alternatives. Oh - forget trying to get through to Customer Service.

Wow, these are really, really cheap. They claim "powerful base on the go" but this is not correct. NO BASE at all... Very weak sounding, actually. The sound is very thin, if that makes any sense. The closest thing I can compare them to is the headphones that are passed out for free, on airline flights. The really cheap, no name brands. Thus, I would certainly expect more from Sony! My previous pair were Sony MDR-E828LP, which were great. Thus, I went back to the Sony name thinking they would again offer a great product. But, these aren't near as good as their predecessor. Now, I get they are sub $10 headphones, so what do you expect? I guess something that offers semi-decent sound quality. The pros, if there are any, are in the cord length, the ear comfort, and the price. But, to me, the sound quality is so poor they are just not even worthy of purchase. I'm currently listening to the $10 Apple pair of OEM EarPod headphones & these are much better than this Sony inferior product.

These are my favorite pair of cheap earbuds. They're very comfortable and the sound is very clear. They last way longer than other earbuds. I think it has something to do with the bent input jack. It's not sticking straight out so the point where the hard connector and bendy wire meet doesn't get as much stress.
These don't go inside your ear so it doesn't block out a lot of noise. Good for when I'm working and still need to be aware of people around me.

These earbuds are great for the price. As a mom of preteens things like this tend to disappear. Well, for Sony ear buds for under $10 I can start stash them in a drawer or in my car and don't mind if one of my children snags them. Plus they sound great, have a well designed plug, and are comfortable to wear! The quality is almost on par with the expensive ones my Galaxy S8 came with. I'll definitely be buying again if they get lost.

I rarely give a 1 star on anything, but I am very disappointed in these earbuds. I've previously owned Sony MDRE828LP and MDR-E818LP, and pretty much all aspects of these are worse.

- sound quality is very tinny and a bit muffled - a huge decrease in quality compared to those other models.The fidelity is what I'd expect from a free pair of earbuds that comes with a cheap phone.
- The size of the speaker is smaller, and thus, a very loose fit in the ear. If you are moving around at all, it requires constant re-adjustment.
- The wire gauge and weight of the buds is less - cheaper construction and cheaper feel.

I bought these to replace my 828's that I wear running 2-3 times per week, which finally died after 3 years, and I simply can't stand the sound quality on these new ones. Maybe worse, the fit/weight makes them pop out of my ears constantly while running. Thus begins a new search for quality earbuds...

I've had this type of Sony earbud for years for working out and jogging but lost them... I bought this type again because it's the best sound quality I've heard for an earbud. These newer ones are a lot more flimsy. The sound quality is still good, but the plug itself broke when the cord was pulled as my phone fell out of my pocket (only once) and now they don't work properly. My old ones went through rougher treatment, being pulled at countless times, and nothing like this ever happened. I give these 5 stars for sound quality (for an earbud) 0 stars for durability.

I had these headphones previously and they lasted a really long time until they recently didn't work anymore. So instead of going to the store like Best Buy where I had purchased my old ones, I took the chance of getting them through Amazon. I was a little skeptical after I bought them because I made sure the model matched the same as my old ones, and I did not want to have a problem when I use the new ones since this is the only type of headphones I really like for myself. Luckily they were exactly like my old ones after I received them today in the mail and they work perfectly!

My husband bought a brand for me for Christmas and gave them to me early and I hated them. They would not stay in my ears. The little pads kept coming off and the sound sucked as I would be listening and realize that one wasn't in my ear then I could barely hear the sound anyway. So for my after Christmas present to myself I did some reading and decided to purchase these Sony ear buds. I rarely listen to music except to try out excerpts of cd's on Amazon but they sounded amazing to me. Mostly I use these with my laptop for Netflix viewing and they are great. I did listen to my new Chris Isaak cd and it sounded so good but then he sounds good....what can i say. Anyway, so far I really happy with this purchase and would get them again.

After using several pairs of the JVC Gumy earbuds I tried this pair from Sony. The Sony pair look and feel about the same and sell for about the same price, but the sound is much muddier. By turning the treble and bass way up and the midrange way down, the Sonys can approximate the sound of the Gumys but they still don't sound quite as good.

More positively, the Sonys have an L-shaped connector which might survive longer than the Gumy's straight connector when connected to an iPod that's constantly tumbling in a runner's pocket.
Terribly uncomfortable for my ears. And if you move, at all ... they fall out.
It is great. After 6 months still working worth buying it

These are great headphones! Sound is crisp and clear. I love how these ear buds don't have rubber around the speakers- to me it is much more comfortable and the buds don't slide out as much. Amazing price online too- in the store these were almost $15. Not to mention how they look; they are very stylish and comfortable.
Good sound!
Great Sony headphones - as expected. Came in original packaging and correct color as ordered. 10/10 satisfied. Definitely going to purchase a second set in the future.
great price great gift.
Good product as advertised

Sony is class. Time and time again they deliver products with amazing quality and durabilty. The pair I recieved seems to have a problem with the right earphone so Ill check with amazon about that. But they are comfortable and a great fit for the athletic types.

I was looking for a cheep set of earbuds to keep at work. Since i only listen to music on a low volume at work i was not looking for anything high end and in the past Sony has been a great option. But i was very disappointed in these headphones. they sound very cheep and there is no richness or any bass to the music at all. i used them for only a few min and have yet to use them again and may give them to the kids to use.

I know these are cheap headphones, but they fit pretty poorly even for their price. The sound is also overly can-y. There's nothing to bad with them per se, but they could have at least given them a better fit. You get what you pay for though.
As good as any earbuds I have had in the past. Actually I was surprised how good they are. I'm sure there are more expensive ones, but these serve my purpose on the workout equipment at the YMCA.

These r great! I'm using them as I write this actually. The sound quality and the comfort is absolutely great! I was planning on using these as a replacement if my headphones broke, but now I'm actually using them more than I thought!
Also, they've lasted me noticeably longer than most earbuds I've bought.

I dropped my old sony pair in my coffee. I saw these sony ones that are supposed to be the "newer" model of my old ones. While I waited for these to arrive, my coworker gave me a free pair that she got from her flight. It was so horrible I couldn't stand listening to my music longer than 30 seconds. Once I got these sony ones in the mail I was so excited to try them. The base in my music is gone. It's only a little bit better than the pair my coworker gave me. A bit more comfortable; a bit better sound quality since it doesn't have that much static noise. I would be impressed if I got this pair for free, but not for the price I paid for.
I really like theses but prefer SONY MDR-E10LP Earbuds because of the shape. They fit me ears better but the sound quality is very good on both. It's just a matter of personal taste.
The sound of this little ear buds is phenomenal! The downside, they often go missing. Everyone wants to borrow them.

I had one of these headphones before and they worked very well, even when they are forcefully unplugged that would break other headphones. I already had a pair before ordering these but lost them, just I got another pair. Although then I found my old pair so now I have two.
Good cheap ear buds with acceptable audio quality. When I listen to music with these ear buds, it sounds the same to me when I listen to it other ear buds or headsets.

I've been using this style for years. It's my go-to earbud

These are comfortable and have great sound-throw out the ones that came with your Iphone/touch and get these instead. We'll have to wait and see how long they last-

Update to my previous review. I lost these outside, about a month ago. The sound is a little tinny and there's not a whole lot of base for it, but I use these to walk to and from my apartment to campus and running on occasion, so it works fine for me. I really like the packaging - very easy to pull the headphones out of the package. They also come with two foam earpiece coverings which I thought was nice.

I've seen a few reviews mention the sound being too low but I actually have the opposite problem; I usually have to turn the sound down on my devices to the lowest possible volume because of how LOUD it is.

purchased these as a gift for someone who uses them all day at work. They love them and the ear buds are small enough to be comfortable all day.

I always return to this product. I love it. I was in a van traveling with my teammates, blasting music through these earphones. A teammate turned around and told me that it is as loud as his Beats by Dre headphones.

Best Headphones ever... My ears have never loved another as they do these fashion buds! I should have got more of them since its hard to find in stores. Great buy!

Slightly smaller than standard earbuds and perfectly fit inside my small ears. They do not fall out while on the treadmill or walking around which is wonderful! Worth every penny and the sound quality is far better than my old earbuds. Will buy again when these wear out.

I was a huge fan of the Sony Mdr-E10Lp earbuds but those sadly were lost in a move. I bought these as a replacement and they are not quite the same (not quite as comfortable and I think the E10Lp had better sound) but they are adequate for podcasting and casual music listening at my desk job. I have now bought several pairs and they are definitely still better than the equivalent JVC earbuds I picked up in a store. Still cheap enough that I didn't feel like I was breaking the bank to buy extra pairs to leave at home, work, etc. Thumbs up.

If you like to have multiple earbuds around the house, in the car, at work, etc. you can't go wrong with these. Had a minor problem that seller took care of immediately. Would purchase this product again and would purchase from this vendor again. Excellent experience.

The audio quality from these earbuds is terrible. After Sony discontinued the MDR-E828LP, my favorite inexpensive earbuds, I bought these thinking that they would be of similar quality to the MDR-E828LP. Not even close. The bass on the MDR-E828LP is great considering that they are earbuds. The bass on the MDRE9LP is practically nonexistent, and they have this hollow/boxy sound that is just not pleasant to listen to. After suffering with them for 5 months, I was able to purchase 10 sets of refurbished MDR-E828LP earbuds. These will last me for a while, hopefully long enough for Sony to actually improve on the MDR-E828LP rather than put out something vastly inferior. I tested them just now, and the difference between the MDR-E828LP and MDRE9LP is incredible. I find it hard to believe that Sony would put its name on garbage like the MDRE9LP. Avoid these at all costs.

I bought these to replace my dead—and recently discontinued—Sony MDRE828LP ear buds, thinking they would be a close match, and perhaps even an evolution of the old design. (The MDRE828LP had insanely good bass for the size and clear, crisp treble and midrange sound. And at the time, they were only $5.) The shape of my ears makes high-end, rubbery, noise-canceling ear buds a no-go; I much prefer these type of ear buds.

I was sadly very mistaken. These are horrible. Mushy, muffled sound, like having cotton in your ears. No bass. Tinny. Not to mention the shape, which is uncomfortable and chunky. Unlike the old ones, these are cheap crap quality to go with the cheap price. For music, the sound is honestly unbearable. I ended up giving these away to Goodwill immediately.

Shockingly bad, even for the paltry eight bucks I paid for them. You can check my reviews; I can't stand super-negative, shrill reviews based on some personal issue the reviewer has with a product. But the sound quality of these buds were, to my ears, terrible--as in no redeeming value even at the very low price point. I've had Sony ear buds before, and loved them (till they ultimately shorted out after a reasonable period of time). I'm surprised Sony would put its name on these. I knew things were not good when I opened the box and the package said "Fashion Earphones" or some such. Luckily, I also ordered the Edifier H180 Hi-Fi Stereo Earbuds at the same time. For a few extra bucks, these buds deliver significantly better sound quality. In short, if you're looking to upgrade your listening experience from . . . well anything, keep moving.

I chose these as the previous generation of Sony ear buds were my favourite. These stay in just fine when I'm jogging and I have used them about 15 times already. The only complaint I have is that the previous generation had curved pieces (arms for lack of a better term) that i could identify SIMPLY BY FEEL as left and right. These new ear buds have an "L" and an "R" indicating left and right, but you actually have to look at them each time. Soon enough, I'm sure the letters will wear off and it will be left to trial and error to see if I can get them in the appropriate ears. Aside from that one small item, these ear buds are great. Good value, good sound, good fit and durable.

It does make sound. It does so not so much better than 99 cents store headphone, but cost 8 times more. I use it to replace a earphone for TV series watched on IPAD. I want it to be small so I can sleep with it. Sound wise, it is much worse than a 20 years ago SONY headphone with similar design. It is light-years away from its own MDR-V6.

These are not the super bass ear buds you want to jam tunes with at the gym! But they are well balanced, durable and work well with my Kindle and Android phone when I'm watching Netflix or listening to Podcasts. Sony makes a good product, comfortable even without the spongy ear covers, and if I fall asleep with these in, and they are comfortable enough to do this, they won't tear out of my ears rolling over or break off at the wire connectors. The price was outstanding, the product is tough and works well for many sound applications, just don't expect to use them for outstanding music reproduction. There are better ear buds for that but they will cost about 10 times as much.

What a difference of sound from the Sony MDRE828LP. Barely any bass unless I squeeze them deep inside my ears. The cords are thin and feels very flimsy. I'm sure I'll tear them easily and soon! :( Sounds worst than the Apple ones. I listen to a lot of electronic, ambient like Moby, also ASMR videos where I need to "feel" the sound/music and this is not working for my preferences. What a disappointment. No wonder the Sony MDRE828LP cost $30 + nowadays. I'm afraid it's worth the price! Good for audio books though.
They last a long time i still have mine i got them a year ago
