I subscribe to a wide variety of daily and weekly podcasts and I am constantly walking around with earbuds on. I'm sure that listening to podcasts constantly instead of loud music is better for my eardrums but it is murder on the earbuds. I have probably bought more earbuds in the last five years than five people buy in a lifetime. Since I have an Apple Nano and an iPod Touch, I was buying Apple OEM and replacement earbuds. I would buy twelve or fifteen at a time. The problem was that the earbuds might last only a week before either one side or both stopped working.

I bought a pair of these Sony earbuds a few days before Thanksgiving at a local discount store. It is now the end of January and the earbuds are still working like the day they came out of the store. And yes, they have been put through the wringer.
The sound is better than the cheaper Chinese Apple replacements, but what really seems to set these earbuds apart is the way they are constructed. The wire connections to the earbuds and the plug seem much stronger and more durable than the Apple design.
I would definitely recommend this product.
I love these earbuds! I take them on jogs with me all the time and the sound quality is pretty good. In the 5/6 years I've been buying them, I've never had a pair break. Definitely worth the $8.

These ear buds don't fit nearly as well as my Sony MDRE828LP ear buds did. Sony shrunk down the diameter a little bit compared to those earbuds. Once I the little foam cover is lost, the earbud will easily slip out of position in the ear with the slightest pull of the cord. I have never seem to have been able to make the foam covers stay on longer than a week without getting lost. The angled piece of plastic which the cord comes out is much smaller and shorter than what is typical. This makes these ear buds great when you are listening in bed and your head is lying against a pillow, but no so great if you are jogging and need to re-position the ear buds in your ears.

Perfect Sony earbuds for the price. I needed another pair, since my puppy chewed the last pair I kept in my bag. Music and audio sounds good and clear. I like the shape of these ear buds as the typical bullet-like buds have never fit my ears right. I would order again.

Don't get these if you're going to use them primarily to listen to music, even if they're a secondary pair -- the sound quality is that bad. There's absolutely no bass, and if there's any sound whatsoever in your environment, you're going to have to crank the volume all the way up to hear Your music. If podcasts are your thing, you might be OK with these as a secondary pair.

I bought them because my dog eats the rubber bits on the in-ear buds. I guess I'll just have to buy another pair of those and be more careful about leaving them around.

I cannot wear the tiny in-ear buds that are so popular/common (they give me instant dizzy spells) and some of the buds in this style (coughApplecough) are either too large or too hard for my outer ear. These Sony buds are fantastic. I like them so much that I've actually stocked up a little. The sound quality is great as well. I might be approaching this in reverse, but if the buds are hurting my ears (or making me dizzy), it doesn't matter how great they sound. So I go for comfort first, sound quality second. These get high marks from me all around. Plus, as a bonus, they come in ORANGE, which matches the case for my MP3 player.

They also don't get as dingy as the "jelly-style" buds I've tried, which are comfortable, but discolor quickly.

It's okay. The good thing about it, it is pretty loud, stays in place while jogging, and would probably be great for an audio book.

The downside to it is that headphones lack sound quality such lack of bass. When I'm listening to music I really can't feel the bass and sound quality.

I would not recommend for listening to music, however if somebody likes to hear some good narration sound I guess go for this product.

For it's price, it does what it is suppose to do - except for the quality.

I subscribe to a wide variety of daily and weekly podcasts and I am constantly walking around with earbuds on. I'm sure that listening to podcasts constantly instead of loud music is better for my eardrums but it is murder on the earbuds. I have probably bought more earbuds in the last five years than five people buy in a lifetime. Since I have an Apple Nano and an iPod Touch, I was buying Apple OEM and replacement earbuds. I would buy twelve or fifteen at a time. The problem was that the earbuds might last only a week before either one side or both stopped working.

I bought a pair of these Sony earbuds a few days before Thanksgiving at a local discount store. It is now the end of January and the earbuds are still working like the day they came out of the store. And yes, they have been put through the wringer. I've snagged them on the cabinet knobs. I've lifted the iPod Touch by the wires. I have slept with them on. Both left and right are still working and they still sound great.

The sound is better than the cheaper Chinese Apple replacements, but what really seems to set these earbuds apart is the way they are constructed. The wire connections to the earbuds and the plug seem much stronger and more durable than the Apple design.

I am happy with the product. In fact, I've already ordered a supply of them from Amazon. I would definitely recommend this product.

P.S. Music sounds great on them, too! Enjoy!

These ear buds were not good. They had a very tinny sound and the volume wasn't great; I had to turn the volume on my device WAY up compared to where it normally is just to get a comparable level. In addition to the terrible sound quality, the construction was very poor; the buds themselves were very light plastic, and the cord was very thin and easily tangled.

The only reason I give this product 2 stars is because they fit in my ear perfectly. They weren't too snug, but they hung in there very well, even on a run. That said, you can get ear buds with those same qualities and much better sound elsewhere.

I know there are already reviews like this, but I didn't take enough time to read through them and catch this before I bought them; so here's another one.

These sound terrible; don't buy them. Tinny, etc as others have said. I was going to try and return them, but in the return process it says it would cost around 5 dollars to return, and I'd only end up with 4 dollars refunded in total. So I'll avoid that and just be stuck with them I think.

So don't do what I did, read these reviews and heed the warnings.

Extremely disappointed. Have used Sony headphones for years, same price, but old ones were much better quality. They used to curve to fit the ear and my last pair lasted literally years. This set I had as a back up for when the old ones failed (I use them for hours every day). They didn't even last TWO WEEKS. Stopped working after just 10 days. Won't buy again.

These earbuds are great. They are always available on amazon prime for less than $10 and come in a variety of colors. I am not an audiophile by any means, but I notice better quality out of these ear buds than from headphones up to 60-70$ (I have never bought headphones more expensive than that, so they make stack up better in some cases).

Since they are at such a low price, I didn't initially expect much. I am on my 4th pair now, after about 10 years of extensive use. My old pair is only showing some minor signs of usage, but they do need replaced every once and a while because they do go in your ear and they do have small holes.

I am always at my desk, for work or gaming, and I am always listening to music and these do the trick for a low price. I expect to purchase another pair again in a year or so.

I bought these ear buds specifically for working out and running errands. For $8, I would recommend these to anyone. The sound quality is pretty good for the price and they've held up well, despite being yanked out of my ears multiple times for various reasons (catching the cord on a door handle, my dog pulling them out when he's excited, etc). I've had problems in the past with other headphones where one of the earbuds dies while the other one still works, and I have not had that problem with these yet. I used to buy them at Target, where they were $15, but I bought this pair in November 2014 and recently bought another pair in August 2015 because I lost the first pair. I use these with my ipod, multiple laptops, and my samsung galaxy S3 with no problems. Good quality, but if something happens to them its not a huge loss either.

The sound quality isn't quite as good as Sony MDR-E818LP Fontopia Ear-Bud Headphones with Acoustic Twin Turbo Circuit (http://www.amazon.com/Sony-MDR-E818LP-Headphones-Discontinued-Manufacturer/dp/B00005QBUU/ref=sr_1_35?ie=UTF8&qid=1431018564&sr=8-35&keywords=sony+earbuds), but it's much better than Panasonic RPHJE120S In-Ear Headphone, Silver (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003EM800S/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_1). Also it was almost as comfortable as the Sony MDR-E818LP Fontopia Ear-Buds and much more comfortable and louder than the Panasonic RPHJE120S. Overall for the price it was a pretty good deal. I wish the Sony MDR-E818LP Fontopia Ear-Buds hadn't been discontinued and weren't so pricey now.

I have expensive beat headphones but ise then mostly when I travel on a plane but these have been my must have at all times, they work great and small to always carry with me. I have been using these for over 4 years and in the 4 years I have only had to replace them 3 times.

These are the most comfortable for me to wear all day, and ive tried a lot of different sets. i do put a generic soft foam cover on them yet, but its much better then others ive tried. The sound is decent, not the best and not the worst, but sounds great for voice (i listen to a lot of podcasts) highly recommend. My kids like these too (use them without the foam) ive bought several pair.

I've bought these in pink/white and also in black. My first pair I bought multiple years ago and still works, but I just wanted another set. They stay in your ears well, and the sound is great. I've never had issues with them not working. For being an affordable brand, this is great.

All earbuds break eventually, This is due to the headphones getting old and wires growing weak. These however can last you 12-18 months before one ear stops working! i have owned other brands like panasonic and Philips that have stopped working in one ear 4-8 months time! Plus these are a bargin price and there are lots of colors.

The big reason these last so long is the headphone jack. You see the main reason they break is when the wire is bent by the headphone jack in a weird way (like wrapping it around your mp3 player) These however got the L shape jack so the wire doesn't get any stress at all! personally i think my last pair broke because i dropped my mp3 player around 5 times over the year causing the wire to catch it causing stress to it.

Used to have Sony MDR-E828 ear buds which were comparable in price but far better in sound quality compared to these, which have poor low frequency / bass response. Music comes through with a tinny, distant sound. The cord also feels to be a smaller gauge and made of flimsy material. These headphones may be fine for listening to podcasts or the news, but I would not recommend these for listening to music. They do come with a pair of soft foam ear pads.

This is the same model that I had 4 years ago but I bought mine from a walgreens. The quality of the materials used to make this headphone seems to have went down. My previous ones lasted 3 years and they were very durable. This new one seems very cheap. I cannot recommend this to anyone wanting a lasting pair of ear buds...Mine lasted less than a month of regular use and then it started to lose sound in one bud. It was also falling apart. This maybe the same model and brand but it is definitely not the same quality it used to be.

The first pair of these headphones I had bought on a whim at a local Big Lots for about $5, and I hadn't expected much out of them-- I had just needed some new ones for the commute to and from school. They lasted almost four years before the right side went out. It was pretty amazing to me that they had lasted through high school and into my first year of college and the abuses that came with that: being thrown into my backpack, surviving PE in 100 degree weather, rain, etc. I bought my second pair shortly after the first had died at Target for closer to $12, which is still inexpensive but more than what you can get here on Amazon. I only bought this third pair because I had thought I'd lost the second, so now I have two pairs that work wonderfully (one two years old, this one six months) that have traveled internationally in checked luggage and carry-on and have put up with the abuse of three playful kittens and an overly-excited toddler. I highly recommend these headphones for quality of sound and construction, and hope that they're still being produced three years from now!
Inferior sound quality. OK for voice, marginal for music. Spend a few dollars more and get something with at least decent sound quality.

When I first plugged the headphones in and pressed "play", I literally laughed out loud at how horrible the sound quality of this product is. All kinds of music, from classical to classic rock, come out tinny and distorted, as if you were listening to a tape recording of a record, played behind a few sheets of cardboard connected to a string tied around a tin can.

The build quality is also shoddy; even the slightest brush against the cable or jack will lead to loud distortion and echoing while playing music from any kind of mp3 player or computer. This means that this item is entirely unusable while walking, let alone jogging.

This item actually makes the default iPod headphones look good in comparison. From its cheap materials (Plastic that feels weak and thin) to the lack of any features (Mic, volume control, quality audio, etc) this item is most certainly not worth even a dollar. I feel silly having paid even $7 for this piece of junk, and would definitely not purchase it again or recommend it to anyone.

DO NOT BUY.
